text: First time here and can't wait til I get my order!!!! Soo excited so far iced pistachio latte is bomb
The guy forgot my drink. The food tasted oily. Value, quality and service can not compete with Dougie J's Cafe, not even close. Will NOT recommend this place. I am going back to Dougie J's .

At first glance this place looks like any other privately owned coffee shop. When you walk in the mood is calm and relaxing. You're greeted with a smile and upon looking at the menu excitement builds as you can tell that this is no ordinary coffee shop. It becomes obvious that the proprietors Tiffany and Mae put a lot of effort into creating menu choices that are not only healthy, but delectable and unique. The coffee is wonderful and flavorful especially if one's tired of the over roasted bitterness of Starbucks and many others coffee. As far as the food goes I have trouble ordering anything other than either the hashtag breakfast sandwich or the mixed berry salad. My favorite smoothie would definitely have to be the kale champ as it is not too sweet and tastes incredible.  frequent this establishment as I feel others should as well. Oh yeah and if you're having a bad day you should pop in for an ice cream waffle. It makes everything better.

I highly recommend Tiabi Coffee & Waffles  to anyone that loves waffles , awesome coffee , great teas and is looking for vegan food in Las Vegas .. This is the only place to go !!!  They are super friendly , patient and fast service. I am always impress Thank You!!

I've been going to this place since the open in 2013 and it's stayed a favorite of mine. The staff is always friendly and before they expanded, it was the owners Tiffany and Mae working everyday and they would try to know everyone personally. The drinks and food are great but it's even better knowing you're supporting genuine people. 

If you're into coffee, they have some quality beans and drinks for you. If not there are smoothies and teas. Lots of veggie options for food, which is nice but they pretty much cater to any preference. They are from Guam, and I've found that islanders have a pallet that leans more towards sweet flavors, so expect that when ordering food lol. It's not a bad thing, you can definitely taste that a lot of their inspiration comes from their home. Food is made fresh and to order. 

Anyway, check this spot out and tip your baristas.

Honest opinion is that it's all right, nothing at all to rave about other then maybe the atmosphere of the place. 

The two sandwiches I tried was flat out BLAND, the waffle in itself was uninspired with no actual flavor. The break-the-fast was overwhelmed by the bacon, I could not taste the cheese or egg. And the other was completely forgettable, left a "why" in my mouth. Why did they add two together, it tasted gross. 

Maybe I'll come back and try to test out other products they sell, see if standalone items like waffles or coffee would be a reason to comeback. But don't let the hype fool you, it's a 2 Star at BEST. And that's because of how the atmosphere felt.

This place is great! My co-worker recommended it to me, I was kind of skeptical, because my friends had recommended this other place and I was very let down. But I went this morning with some friends. I ordered the churro waffle. SO GOOD! It tastes just like a churro, i got it with whipped cream on top with powdered sugar. My best friend got a west coast sandwich, with chicken ,tomato , avocado, bacon, and their own tiabi sauce. She let me try it and it was good. She loved it. My other friends got strawberry kisses waffle and banana waffle. We loved everything, and the workers were super friendly and nice. I had a great time. Great place to have some breakfast or even lunch. Will come back and keep coming back!!
Wonderful people and excellent food! The perfect option if you're looking for delicious & affordable brunch. I would recommend the west coast if you're looking for a tasty sandwich.

This place is delicious, has a great atmosphere and environment, the barista is friendly and thoughtful. There are cards at all of the tables and the barista will even play with you if they have a little bit of down time. I love local places and this place exceeded my expectations.

Awesome food! I had the hashtag waffle and could have had three more just to keep the taste in my mouth. The staff was also really nice and made recommendations for me when I couldn't decide what I wanted.  

The place was a little tucked away off Maryland parkway but when you find it, it's like finding one of Vegas's secret gems. It's is very well priced and the ambiance is really chill and inviting. 

I will defiantly be back and would recommend this place to everyone!

Bought a groupon for half price tiabi food! Was confusing but thats groupons fault. AMAZING food! I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich and strawberry sunrise smoothie. Def worth going off the beaten path to eat here :)))))
Delicious food and they actually have good vegan options too! The Frankenstein signature drink was the best!!
Went here for my anniversary. Small place with a lot of charm and outdoor seating. Absolutely loved the Tiff waffle macchiato

The photo says it all, my kids would say "yummy in my tummy" lol great waffle sandwich, great blendie and amazing coconut iced coffee... thumbs up, next time in Vegas will definitely come back! Menu is simple but very yummy. Price is awesome best bang for your buck!

A pleasure to rest, drink, and study at! Staff is friendly and kind, coffee is strong and good, and the waffles taste like how waffles should: a delight. Music is not at all loud which is also appreciated. They've done a good job with this place.
This is great. There are really good gluten free waffles if you have an allergy for gluten. I love it and you should to so go check it out.
I was craving waffles while on my vacation in Vegas, and this place did not disappoint! Reasonable prices, welcoming staff, delicious food and drinks. The maple bacon waffle was great!
Food and coffee both amazing! Staff super friendly and helpful, we will definitely be coming back
The food and service here is really good. The only reason I took away a star is because there is limited seating space.

I was so excited to go to this cafe once I saw that they had waffle sandwiches because I LOVE Bruxie's waffle sandwiches, but they don't have one in Vegas. Tiabi gives you the option of the classic waffle (thin, round waffle) or a Belgian waffle (thick, square waffle) for the sandwiches. The classic waffle reminded me of the one at Bruxie, but the quality and service were lacking. 

I ordered the West Coast sandwich and it was decent, but I felt like it was lacking flavor and thrown together a bit sloppily. I also got the red velvet wafflenut and it was super sweet, doughy, and just seemed like it wasn't fully cooked. There were only two people working, so it took us about ten minutes to order and another 20 minutes to get our food. For the amount of customers that were there, they definitely would benefit from having another employee. 

Overall, cute place, vegan friendly, but they just need to work on their consistency and their service.

Saw a Groupon for this place and was intrigued. I was surprised that after attending UNLV the past few semesters that I had never heard of this place from anyone since it's so close to campus. It's a a whole in the wall with wonderful charm. I really love that there are decks of playing cards at every table and board games to play if you so desire.

Now for the food, my boyfriend and I asked for the cashier's opinion about what was popular and we went with four of her top recommendations. Both she and the guy in the back were super nice and helpful. I ordered the Kale Champ and one of the waffle sandwiches. My boyfriend got a hot caramel coffee (which they brought him a cold version instead of the hot he ordered, but he enjoyed it) and the Elvis banana peanut butter bacon waffles (Seriously amazing, the crispy bacon worked so well with the all the other ingredients, a must have). Everything was really delicious and despite the small mix-up we'll definitely be going back again.

Small biz coffee shop in a strip mall that tries hard but falls short on quality and style. The coffee was fresh brewed and good, waffles made fresh are a plus too but my breakfast sandwich had that "instant" egg square and bacon slices. 

The decor needs to come together a bit but overall it fits the eclectic college clientele of the area.

You had me at vegan baffles and almond milk. nom nom nom. Two things which are very hard to find, especially in Vegas. The boyfriend got The Hof (he's the carnivore) which was this pretzel bun with roast beef, arugula, cheese and agave-mustard sauce and loved it. I had two vegan waffles with macadamia nuts and strawberries with an almond milk latte. I also got the kale salad to go and it was really good. Not too heavy on the dressing. Just perfect.
Really cute spot. Not the same boring menu you see everywhere. Very attentive service, good prices. Really happy I found this spot. Taste buds happy :)
Decided to get the groupon and try this place out and it did not disappoint! Cody got the break the fast waffles and of course I opted out for something sweet, Banana Nutella waffles! Soooo good!
Had the west coast waffwich and it wasn't what I expected. It exceeded it! Great job guys. Def be back.
Vegan waffles are hard to come by, especially at these prices. The coffee was so good. Would definitely go back.

Eggs tasted like they were pre-frozen. Turkey sausage was cold, and inedible. Cappuccino was it's only saving grace. No need for apologize, or ask me to come be and revisit and give you a second chance. Sometimes in life you have one shot, so make sure each meal you prepare is a make or break. Save the long reply and just put your words into actions.
A good quick quiet brunch stop. Clean, soft good tunes, a gathering place with cards on the table. Simple tasty waffles. Coffee better than Starbucks - and I'm not saying their coffee is bad.

Great waffles and coffee specialties. Nice atmosphere and very friendly service! 
We came here on a Tuesday morning and it was not crowded at all so we could order right away. 
We had the banana waffles and the one with strawberries. Both were really nice. The latte and the cappuccino were very nice, too. 
I can definitely recommend this place if you like a sweet breakfast!

It was great!!! Very accommodating to my vegan needs!! And my boyfriends non vegan needs! :) it's a shame it's so far away from me and not in the greatest part of town! But don't let that scare you away! It was top notch quick breakfast!

Had what I honestly consider to be the best waffle I've ever tasted in my life. Bacon, egg, and cheese on a crisp, soft-centered, golden brown waffle with Siracha sauce and maple syrup so good it probably just came from Mayor Rob Ford's favorite Canadian Maple tree. So good I'm just going to crush some work and stick around for lunch too (apparently they do burgers and sandwiches on waffles too?) Check this place out if you're in town. You'll be glad you did.

Me and my mans decided to stop and try this place before heading home from our little Las Vegas trip, and it was a great decision! The employees are super friendly, the sandwich we had was the "West Coast", and it was really good on the ciabatta roll. For dessert we got the "Bananatella" waffle and that was delicious as well. It's a cute little place for some lunch or small dessert. 10/10 would recommend!

Been a regular for a couple months because of the great team that runs this place, along with the fresh quality of ingredients they use! Always a pleasure to come here! I usually get the West Coast sandwich! Comes on a waffle or ciabbata
Mmmmm some of the best sweet and savory waffles I've had. Very light and fluffy. Awesome cappucino. Wish they had fresh eggs though.

Very cool local business. Excellent customer service and a great menu. Places like this make my mornings happy :)

Excellent prices, fun ambiance, healthy menu options, and super chill staff. Highly recommended.

I went there for the first time today. The waffles are fresh and delicious. I tried the Bananatella. It is two square belgian waffles topped with whipped cream, sliced almonds, and Nutella. The waffle is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

I am taking off two stars because the interior is unappealing. The decoration does not look good, the paint color is unappealing, the furniture is mismatched, the table looks old and dirty (even though it was clean). 

Overall, love the food and dislike the atmosphere/interior decoration.

This place instantly reminded me of one of those like little coffee joints that you find in like Seattle or New York! I had actually been looking for a place like this for a while!! The atmosphere is amazing but not only that! The food is amazing as well! Good portions for what you pay and the mocha is amazing!
SO GOOD. I got hashtag breakfast sandwich with snickers ice coffee. Everything had great flavor cookies fresh. Boyfriend got red velvet waffles and he said it tasted great. Smoothies were also a hit!

Service is horrendous and wait time is ridiculous! AR order time, told it would be about 20 minutes,  ok. After waiting 30 minutes I got up and asked how much longer, surprise, they didn't put in my order. Girl next to me got wrong item and had to get a refund then refund wasn't right amount and had to go back to cashier to correct. People on other side of me were halfway through their meal and still hadn't received their drinks, they had to go ask for them.

Waffle itself was great tasting but insides were skimpy, like they just tossed a handful of items on it and sent it out since they knew they made a mistake. I never did receive my kettle chips. :-( bottom line is, don't bother.
Literally sweetest group of people. The owners are very friendly with genuine, great hospitality. The food was AMAZING and extremely affordable. One of those hidden gems in town.

Once I heard about a waffle bar in Vegas, I knew I had to try it, but unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed with my experience here. I arrived at eleven with a party of six, and another decently sized party had just arrived a little earlier too. We ordered, and waited such a long time for our food. There were only two employees working there, and we understood how difficult it must be preparing for two medium sized tables, but the thirty minute wait for our food was just too long, and that ultimately contributed to my three-star review. :( 

On the other hand, I'd give the food a four. I split a West Coast and South American. I'd highly recommend the classic waffle with sandwiches instead of the Belgian! They ran out of ham for the South American, but they compensated it with bacon and chicken; it basically became another West Coast though. Our party also checked into Yelp, and received the wafflenut. I tried the white chocolate macadamia, and although it wasn't exceptional, it was still delicious. :)
Really chill place with breakfast options. Getting the iced coffee and Waffeldilla. Super clean place. Friends love this it too. Free water

I made the mistake of discovering this place on Groupon as something new to try while visiting Las Vegas. The deal was for 3 - $8 vouchers to be used by 1 person with only 1 voucher per visit. Understood. So I go over from the Strip and plan to order and leave then come right back; then I was going to come back again before leaving town. Well I get there and they tell me I can't leave and come right back because it has to be on a different day or at least a few hours later. I tell them that is not ideal because it's a $40 taxi ride roundtrip from the Strip, plus that is not what the fine print says. They tell me it's up to them to determine what qualifies as a visit. I tell them that needed to be included in the fine print since they want to stick to the fine print. They said it's their decision and I can't leave and come back within a certain time period. ((So if I order something and decided it was really good and want another one, I have to wait a few hours before I can come get another one with my Groupon. Foolishness)) At that point I didn't want any of the food because the poor customer service and the bad attitudes of the employees made me lose my appetite. So I can't comment on how it tastes. But as far as the customer service and employees' personalities are concerned, they left much to be desired. If you don't mind crappy service then go for it. But if pleasant service is an important facet of your dining experience, then don't waste your time.

So happy they opened a location here. Their menu is so refreshing to see in a time when menu's have become mundane. I'm still exploring but so far the bananatella is the most delicious. Imagine if you will a waffle with the perfect amount of banana slices laid on top with almonds and Nutella drizzled all over the place! Its a great treat. The service at this location is excellent which I was so happy to see as they just opened. Servers have a lot of energy and are always smiling. Anyway, Tiabi Coffee & Waffle is perfect for the center and the surrounding neighborhood. Worth the visit.

My friend and I were looking for a new coffee shop type place to go to and we came across this little joint. It's very hidden, in the ghetto. It's on Maryland and flamingo in the target shopping center. We walk in, there's no where really to sit. It's a very cute shop but really small. Super clean. Everything on the menu sounded sooo good. I literally couldn't decide for like 15 minutes lol. The service was great. I got a waffle and coffee, and my total came out to like 14 bucks! I was so confused. I could've gotten Starbucks and a Belgium waffle from Egg Works for less than that. Definitely not worth that much money. I would go there more often if it wasn't so expensive and in the hood of Las Vegas.

Get the hell off of the strip & check out the bomb food places around Vegas and Henderson. This place has good prices, good portions, a comfortable feel, & good people working the shop. It puts all that mega-hyped bourgie trash on the strip to shame. Fuck all that noise. Come here, get a westcoast waffle sammich, get some coffee, get happy.
Loved the food, coffee, and the service. Vegan and Gluten Free dedicated waffle makers are a welcome sight.

this place is delicious! it lets you get your cup of Joe and a little more!
the customer service is great!! they're all so nice! The ambiance is relaxing and you can just sit around and read your favorite book :)
I had the banananutella waffle with a side of fruit and it was light tasting, not too sweet, yummy! The cup of fruit was a pretty good size for $1. Next time I'll try a smoothie.

This place is amazing! Fantastic service, really good food and drinks! My best friend and I were visiting from out of town and stopped by this awesome little spot. We are both vegetarians so it was perfect for us. Take the time to check it out!

Place appears to have BOMB food options! Especially for Gluten free intolerances. Multiple waffle and coffee options, great for kids as well. They even have an array of shakes, and desert type waffles as well. Really unique teas, as well as cheap coffee choices.
Very lit, very tasty. Got the sandwich. It was gr8. Good drinks 10/10

Just tried this place for the first time a couple of weeks ago. I got one of their savory waffle sandwiches for a coworker and I, as well as a custom sweet one for myself later. Both were delicious, albeit a little expensive considering the size of either. I can't imagine it's that pricey to make a simple waffle and add toppings :P But, it was still fairly good. I come by here now every once in a while to pick up a coconut truffle latte, as those prove to be a good-quality pick me up. The vegan kale cookies are a little different and a tad dry, but not at all bad (: Overall a cool place, the environment is welcoming but not quite as intimidating as, say Lestat's in SD, where you're surrounded by professional artwork and tattooed baddies. A solid 4  for customer service, drink quality, and surroundings c:
Really really good! They definitely should put more chicken on the wafflewhiches though. I indeed recommend the Waffle Macciato or whatever they call it, it's killer!

I got waaaay too excited at the thought of a waffle bar, but my wafflewich ended up just being decent. Swapping bread out with Tiabi's waffles didn't really change the overall taste of my breakfast sandwich, which contained eggs, sausage, and cheese. Their waffles aren't very flavorsome alone. I doused my order with srircha. 

Despite my table's seemingly simple wafflewich orders, we were left waiting for our food for an unreasonably long time period. There were only two people working in the shop, sharing the responsibilities of taking orders, preparing and carrying out the food, and attending to guests. Needless to say, the service was definitely lacking. One of the owners actually asked my friend and I to wait before ordering, but she completely left us hanging. There was a moderate amount of people in the shop, but it wasn't terribly busy. 

By the end, I don't think anybody in my party was super impressed with their wafflewich nor their wafflnuts, which tasted super doughy and undercooked. However, all of our meals were savory. Tiabi's sweeter breakfast choices might be a better option when ordering.
Spent a day doing my homework here and really got thing a done! Quiet place to study on weekends. Loved the Waffle with strawberries!
Avocado smoothies and awesome waffle sandwiches. Vegan friendly and the food was delicious. Small hole in the wall type place.

Nice service and nice tasting food but not all ingredients are fresh. Not sure about the waffle mix but my sausage, egg, and cheese waffle had a perfectly round egg that looked like the ones that come in the frozen breakfast aisle at your local grocery store. For the price I was expecting a more "home made" taste rather than fast food. In the end, I will probably go back again though if I find myself on Maryland Avenue (#DMVnative).

I went in a few days ago and the place was really cute and clean. When i wen to order i was attended by Gabriela. She was very helpful since I was so indecisive when it came to figuring out what i wanted to order, so she made the process a whole lot easier. overall excellent customer service, will be returning much more often.

Cute little waffle shop.  They have a big variety of toppings for waffles.  I got the elvis which had bananas, peanut butter and honey - delicious!  

On another occasion I got a green smoothie that I was a little disappointed by.  The ingredients were not blended until smooth so there was just too much texture.  Aside from that, the flavor was good.

The best waffle combinations ever! Can't believe I haven't heard about this place sooner. Great service and loved the oldies playing in the background. Definitely recommend to anyone , and all my friends and family
A coffee shop is exactly what was needed in this neighborhood.  And I'm thrilled it's an independent coffee shop.  Love the ambiance and the atmosphere.

Ordered the vegan waffle sandwich and Las Elvis vegan style. The coconut "bacon" was a very nice touch added on top of the agave, peanut butter and bananas. The waffle sandwich was the perfect amount of savory. Very good! Great coffee too! Will definitely eat here again!
For a small shop they have a big menu. Friendly service and prices are typical not exhortant. Vegan options (if your into that) gluten-free too (also if your into that)

I was SO happy to finally see a coffee shop besides Starbucks pop up in my neighborhood. My sister and I stopped in one lazy Sunday to check it out. I had an ices pistachio latte. It was creamy, flavorful, not too sweet, with just the right amount of espresso. My sister had the iced lavender latte which was delicious as well. I've come back since and had the pistachio latte again and it has been consistent. I did try the waffle machiatto and it was awesome with the fresh, hot mini waffle served on the side. This place is worth checking out. Support small business!
Friendly service and great Belgian waffles , must visit especially if you are  Vegan.

This place was very chill, reminded me of the places they have in San Jose. I ordered the Bananatella waffle, and an iced honey cream latte which was ON POINT! The waffle is very filling, and of course Nutella makes everything better! I will definitely come back for the coffee though, as that was my favorite

The food was great. But had to knock off a star for the service. Maybe could use another personnel be out on the floor to clean up especially on weekends. I mean why give the customer a wash cloth to clean the table themselves. Other than that it's a must to go try out the food.

Small interior. Otherwise this place is fantastic. My favorite is the West Coast "Wafflewich" it has such a wonderful savory flavor that I just can't get enough of. Good portion size. I even tried one of their vegan muffins. Now I love my bread and sweets; I am not a vegan, but they looked so delicious I had to try one. So yummy. I don't think vegan has ever tasted so delic!

Gotta try this place out! Lots of breakfast, lunch, and desert waffle choices. As well as coffees of all kinds and smoothies.

Their Waffle Carmel Macchiato, Bacon infused waffle and red velvet waffle sticks are TO DIE FOR! This place has it all and they are close to the strip and convention center for quick made to order catering needs!

Incredibly good. So good. My avocado was a little hard. It that couldn't overcome the rest of what was going on with that waffle sandwich. My new favorite place in Vegas. No Smoke. Woot woot. Had a Red Bull Apple Cider. Shazam!!!  Order it.
Cute coffee shop off the strip.  Coffee was good and the waffles were nice and crispy.  We ordered the waffle macchiato, tuxedo frapp and the Thai chicken waffle sandwich.

We found this little breakfast/lunch/vegan place a month or so ago and it original a delicious.  The Viva las Elvis is great and you can get it gluten free or vegan.  Today I tried the Waffledilla and that's my new favorite sandwich, with the sweet fluffy waffle and savory inside it hits the spot!  Love the trendy coffeehouse atmosphere, music and friendly staff. I would give 4 and a half stars if I could.  After more perfect visits I will give them 5!

Been here twice, love the smoothies! and the breakfast waffles are great but the best part is you can customize anything and that's really helpful if you are on a certain diet. The staff is super cool and friendly.
Delicious! We tried the breakfast sandwich, West coast, and smores and all were great! We even went back for another breakfast sandwich!

I ordered the west coat which was actually very good the only problem was the waiting it took over 30 minutes to make my sandwich which was a little upsetting since they said it would only be 15 minutes. Friendly customer service maybe they were short staffed ? Because the resteraunt wasn't very busy. the sandwich was ok too me I think bruxxi on the Las Vegas strip is better. The waffle isn't as crisply as I would like it's more of a regular house type waffle which is still very delicious.

Love this place! We usually come here every weekend. The west coast is delicious and I love their seasonal drink menu. It gives you more options to choose from and they are always good! The service is always awesome even when they are busy. Wish they were still open late though.
Some of the best waffles I have ever had. My friend and I ordered the vegan waffle sandwich and it was delicious! Cannot wait to go back!

I decided to try this place! It's located in a strip mall near Target! It's small but the service was good and the employees very friendly! I ordered the Viva Las Elvis, which is a waffle with bananas, peanut butter and honey, with bacon cooked into the waffle! It was very tasty! I definitely recommend this place, great taste and fresh ingredients, and a nice change of pace from the pricy strip coffee shops and the waffles are spectacular!
Their Waffledilla with avocado was delicious!  My family thoroughly enjoyed their waffle sandwiches too!
Even worse, the response tries to make me wrong! I'm the paying customer, hello! I'll take my money elsewhere. I feel personally insulted. Awful customer service.

Dropped in for a light breakfast based on other Yelp reviews one morning in Vegas.  Split the Western waffle sandwich with a friend and soon wished i ordered a whole one for myself.  Delicious!  The iced coffee was good too (it was hot outside already).  Will be back to try some other items.

Not recommended. Tables are sticky from the syrup. Waffles are burned. Also, a nice lady came in when we were here and had a small cup in her hand. She asked for a little bit of ice. The woman working declined with a statement to the affect of "we don't give things away for free, you have to buy something". 100 degrees outside and you won't share a little ice. Not for me

Tried out this new coffee/waffle place that opened up.  Well new to me.  It's a nice little place to go.  If you aren't watching calories or just got a sweet tooth then the red velvet waffle is delicious.   Also got a snickers iced coffee which was good too.  Will be back since the staff was very helpful since it was my first time.  Glad there is something other then Starbucks around here now.

Great place to enjoy a casual waffle meal with a type of coffee concoction that will satisfy your palate.  It took me a minute to think of that phrase :p . The waffles are a perfect blend of crisp and soft with interesting and creative varieties that will have you coming back. They offer gluten free on certain menu items so be sure to ask. The coffee drinks look tasty but they are definitely cheat meal status.  Luckily it was mine today hence the banana/Nutella waffle, the pizza tasting waffle and the bacon and eggs sandwich waffle.  Shared amongst two adults and a toddler,  of course. Not to mention the two kale chocolate chip cookies,  two July 4th inspired sugar type cookies, blueberry muffin and an all vegan mini Nutella cake type thingy.  Did I mention it was my cheat day? It was all delicious. The staff were super friendly and answered all of my questions. It's nice to see good customer service.  I'll definitely be back but right now,  it's leg day.
I wwnt in today for the first time.  The coffe was well made and delicious.  The manager was very friendly and even made me try one of the waffles, which was fantastic.  I will be back!

I absolutely love Waffles. I frequently make them at home and stumbled upon this place and love Theirs too. I tried the Peachy Peach Ice tea on the first visit with a waffle. It was delish! I then come in for an iced-coffee it was good as well. The service was fast and price is affordable.  I will become a regular in their cafe.

Do not eat here!!! Gross waffles, I am assuming someone screwed up the waffle mix recipe that morning because if that's how the waffles taste everyday I'm truly surprised that place hasn't gone out of business yet. 
The waffles just had a weird texture and an off taste. They just did not taste right. We also ordered a "hot" coffee but it was cold, probably had been sitting out all day. If you serve nothing but coffee and waffles you better have fresh brewed hot coffee and decent waffles but they couldn't even get that right. 
Worse than the sub par food was the service, when the server came to check on us and asked how the food was I told him it was not very good and he just said "okay" and avoided eye contact and walked away! Wth!!! What kind of service is that?! No apology, he wasn't even interested in asking why I didn't like the food for the sake of feedback. He did not offer to call a manager over, just said "okay" and left... That is NOT OKAY!

I really love this place. They make an amazing cappuccino, great shakes, and I love the 'kisses'  regular styled waffles. So good. Haven't had a bad tome here yet, so glad I found a great coffee shop, way better then any big time coffee shops.

I was looking for something breakfast-y, about 1230 PM on Sunday. I had seen this place since I live in ghetto area around here--it's in the Target shopping center. I dropped in and it smelled great.
I'll admit I'm not a big fan of waffles (prefer eggs/hashbrowns kind of breakfast) but the menu of waffles looked interesting.
I tried the waffle with bacon inside. When the server was getting it ready, she asked me if I wanted butter and I said no, which was okay. 
At any rate, waffle was good, bacon was crisp and I switched out the sugar free syrup for real stuff. The downside was that sadly, I was still sort of hungry but decided not to order another one :) Price is reasonable.
I don't do coffee, so I can't speak to any those offerings.
I'll go back and try it again sometime.

I know I'm in the minority but the food here is just ok. I actually left feeling sick to my stomach, this is just before heading to work so I'm not happy right now. I was beyond excited to try this place and went out of my way to come. 

I had the west coast and the honey espresso coffee. 
The girl at the counter was very nice and everything came out super fast... but it was not busy at the time. As soon as my sandwich/waffle was ready I dug right in but it was already soggy and just fell apart. Kinda disappointing but oh well, I managed with a fork and knife. The waffle was tasty on its own but together it did not jive with me.

Honey espresso was yummy, almost too sweet for my taste so likely wouldn't order again. But they have a lot to choose from. 

If I come back I'm just gonna stick to traditional waffle with minimal extras on top to play it safe.

My husband and I found Tiabi about 3 weeks ago and we have been there 4 times already!  We start with the starwberry sunrise and green nut drinks. We have tried almost allo of the sandwiches and they are great. Today we had the waffledilla and it was fantastic!  We love to eat on the patio which is dog friendly.   Great way to start the morning!
Great place for waffles! The employee, Israel, great customer service and did an excellent job with mine and my girlfriends food!
Good coffee.. the waffles and waffle sandwiches were under impressive, ambiance was fine nothing special

Where do I even start? I've driven by this place a zillion times & never knew it was there. I'm so glad I found out about it. A bunch of us went one day for lunch & the ONLY unfortunate thing was that it was already crowded so we waited for our food for quite a while. But it was worth it & I can't wait to go back & try more items! I had the west coast wafflewich which was seriously delish. I tried a bite of a friend's waffledilla which was also yummy. The owner (?) brought out churronimos for the table due to our long wait & holy yum. Appreciated the acknowledgement & gesture. Looking forward to my next visit!

This place is so cute! I haven't tried the food but the coffee and service is on point! Great music and good vibes here. Perfect place to chill, read, or grab a coffee to go. They also introduced me to Epoxy. Buy 10 coffees get the 11th free!

If you love waffles, you won't be disappointed. I was visiting Vegas for a week and just stumbled on Tiabi. It was so good, I returned twice. The breakfast sandwich is a standout. My one complaint is the time it takes to prepare your food - about 15-20 minutes - even though the restaurant had no more than four patrons on each of my visits. One person prepares the food and another your drink, and either one is also taking orders, all of which makes for slow service. So if you're in a hurry or just want to grab something for the road, it's probably not the best place to go. If you're not, it's worth the wait. I'll definitely return whenever I'm in Vegas.
Amazing vegan waffles, I loved the guru burger. We were just driving BG through Vegas and had been looking for vegan waffles since we left Virginia. We were not disappointed.

First time here, and it won't be my last! We ordered the Vegan Wafflewich, Strawberry Kisses, Stiles Java Jolt iced and the Snickers Iced Coffee. 

I personally had the vegan wafflewich and it was absolutely delicious. I'm a sucker for anything even remotely resembling caprese, so I was all over this sandwich. And how can you go wrong when your bread base is a waffle? The waffle tasted super fresh and fluffy and really brought out the flavors of the dressing. I of course had to get the vegan mozzarella on it as well and it was great. It tasted exactly like traditional mozzarella, even the same texture. Very impressed with the wafflewich! I'm always so excited to see vegan food options. So I really appreciate this!

The strawberry kisses waffle I sampled from my mom was exactly what you'd expect from a waffle topped with strawberries, whipped cream and chocolate - DELICIOUS. 

I'm anxious to come back here and try some of the other menu options!!
Fantastic shakes had another stores one today highly recommended a little pricy but premium shakes

The waffles and coffee here are good. Honey in coffee? I know sounds weird, but it's good. Wish they had real eggs  though, they only have egg patties. The utensils could be cleaner, they had a lot of hard water spots that might bother some people.

I walk in and everyone is so upbeat in the morning which I miss. I've worked in customer service for too long, but I was greeted genuinely. I've never been here before up until recently and tried the churro iced coffee. Please keep it up. Will return soon!

I really wish this place was close to me, as their vegan waffle selection and flavors are great!

Came here on the way to the airport upon leaving vacation, and it definitely did not disappoint. I had the viva las elvis vegan style, and an avocado smoothie, and my dining partner had one of their waffle breakfast sandwich concoctions. 

my waffle was very tasty. I wish I were eating one right now instead of writing this review. The smoothie was pretty good, probably wish I would've went with another smoothie as avocado smoothies are hit and miss to me (despite loving avocados). 

My dining partner still mentions how delicious her sandwich was and that she wished the place was closer, so there is that too! all and all, great all around!.
Creative Food.  DELICIOUS and the prices are fair.  The staff is extremely friendly.  I had Red Velvet Waffle.
Great little breakfast spot. The staff was friendly and the food was great! The West Coast Waffle with an added egg was recommended by the registrar, and I'm glad she did. It was awesome!
Great energy, good coffee, nice waffles and good people. Mae the co owner has a great energy

Coffee is bomb, waffles are deliciously crispy yet soft ... The staff is cool also, this place is so unlike other coffee shops in Vegas in that it feels like Portland Oregon or San Fran!! I study and chill there !

Gluten free batter that tastes incredible?  Yes! This place has wonderful waffles and you can get any made with aforementioned batter. I highly recommend the maple bacon waffle. Friendly staff and service. If you're lucky enough to live here in Las Vegas,  this is where you should be eating breakfast no less than every single day of the week. If you're just visiting and you want a vegas breakfast that isn't over priced and mediocre than come here! You will not be disappointed!

This place is a amazing find!!! Found them in a deal on groupon! This will be a stop on everyone of our Vegas trips! They have incredible food and the service was fantastic. Told them I was lactose free and the made my coffee with soy for me and even gave me the vegan waffle on my sandwich since the other one has milk in it - so nice of them to care!! The food was so fresh - they made the waffle on the spot as you order! I had the west coast and my husband has the break the fast - both delicious! We will be back. Clean restaurant too! Thanks for the yummy food! We will be back!
3 steps to having a happy day.Step 1 go to tiabi coffee and waffle place fpr breackfest.Step 2 eat tacos el gordo for lunch.Step 3 nap

Recently hit up this ADORABLE spot on our recent trip to Vegas since we had a groupon and oh man was it worth the trip from the strip! 

The place itself is adorable and throughout my various trips to Vegas (yes, we explore off strip, weird I know), it seems like small local businesses just aren't as popular like here in Austin so I love to see that..but I digress. 

Onto the yummies: The hashtag breakfast sandwich was the shit. Not too heavy but totally delicious and filling! The waffle my fiancé had was outstanding! Forget what it was called but it had Nutella and pretty much blew my mind. 

The owners were there and we chit chatted and they were so nice!! Wonderful food, GREAT staff, and overall a much needed break from the Vegas strip. Can't wait to try it out again in April when we go back!

very nice neighborhood place for a different kind of treats. Yes I'd return. There's an I Hop across the street, this is  better.  Although there is a smaller list to choose from. It's a lot of fantastic food here. Stop in you won't be disappointed.
This was honestly the best sandwich I've had in a long time truly! Great location close to my house, thinking about going back for another one today!!

Cozy, clean, coffee.....delicious and local. Waffles cooked to perfection. 
Highly recommend.
It's super good food honestly recommend the bannatella it's super good it's a waffle nutella drizzle almonds and whip cream and also looks super appetizing so is strawberry kisses

Been here many times. I only order online cause it's easier to see my options and when I get there the wait is not long. I've ordered their smoothies, coffee, waffles, salad and from their lunch menus. I would drive 35 minutes almost every weekend just to come here. Great prices. Great staff. This is my Starbucks :)

We had the red velvet and strawberry kisses waffles. They were both delicious! Tried the pistachio latte, it was divine. Prices are decent. Girl behind the counter was helpful with selections since it was our 1st time there. Will definitely visit again if in the area.

So my best friend and I are from Kansas City, and we were on a road trip with one of the stops being in Vegas.  We found this place on Groupon so we figured we might as well give it a try.   I can't even begin to tell you how amazing this place is!!  We absolutely loved it!!!!  Not only is the staff nice, but the food and drinks blew us away!  My friend and I traveled through 7 different states and ate at dozens of restaurants, and by far, this was our favorite place!  In fact, it was one of the highlights of our 14 day vacation, and we miss it already!  We will definitely be coming back here!!  :)

WAFFLES. But with a twist. Tiabi Coffee & Waffle presents some of the lowest priced yet uniquely invented waffle creations in Las Vegas. Their menu boasts inventions like the Maple Bacon, in which they cook the waffle with bacon inside of it! Strawberry Kisses is one of their signature waffles with frosty white whipped cream on top of sliced strawberries topped with a chocolate drizzle. It's simple, it's delicious, it's unique, and I keep coming back for more!

I like small businesses. I try to support them as much as I can. This place is small but they have outside seating they have about 4-5 tables but it's really tight in there. Wide selection of coffee drinks. I had a waffle sandwich ham, cheese and avocado. Pretty good a little expensive but I had a Groupon so it made up for it. It really like this place and I have several more Groupons for me to come back and try the other things on the menu. The staff is friendly but be forewarned; I came in on a busy morning and I had to wait 25 minutes for my coffee and sandwich order to go. Not their fault but it was a little annoying.

Stopped in thanks to other Yelp reviews looking for an afternoon snack and coffee during my travels.  I prefer to stop at local places wherever I go and this is a great spot!  

At the recommendation of the staff I had the "west coast" waffle and an iced "Honey Cream Latte".  Wow!  I got more than a snack... I'll be having a late dinner.  I loved the savory option that had bacon and avocado (my favs!) on a waffle with a little cheese and grilled chicken.  SO good! 

The drink was delicious as well, although I got it half sweet per my taste.  I didn't realize it was a breve (made with half and half instead of milk) but the treat was welcomed since it's so good :). 

Great little place away from the strip.  Good anytime of day - not just breakfast!

This place is amazing! As you walk in, the restaurant looks so cool the way they decorated. I love the chalk walls. Their menu is different from any ordinary waffle house. Their choices for waffles and drinks are really unique. I'm not a fan of waffles, but the B.A.T. Waffle Sandwich was so delicious. If you like iced teas, Just Peachy is perfection. Best of all, its located near UNLV. I highly recommend this restaurant!!!!

I love their waffles, crunchy and light! We had a golden waffle with green tea ice cream and a West Coast Wafflesich, the food is clean and fresh. If you like something light and refreshing(more of a Japanese taste than American style), definitely come here!
Very good food and coffee!!! The Viva Las Elvis (Vegan option) was excellent!! The staff was very friendly as well.

Tasty waffles. The vibe is still being figured out but the variety of waffles and what you can put in or on them is good. A hip little trendy spot that offers coffee drinks and a variety of savory and sweet waffle options.

It is a good breakfast place with a lot of waffle options. I had a waffle burger which wasn't that great. My wife had a strawberry banana waffle and it was great. My guess is the sweet waffles are great - savory ones may be a miss here. They have some creative coffee options as well. A solid place to check out.

We randomly found this place on google and thought we'd give it a shot. We're always looking for local restaurants to try in Vegas and this one did not disappoint!! 

The staff is incredibly friendly and genuine. You can tell they at happy to serve you. They smile when they work and seems like they all love what they do, like it's more than just a job to them. They also take the time to get to know their customers. While we were there, they greeted multiple customers by name and had casual conversations with them.

There are a lot of options on the menu, for both drinks and food. We got the Viva Las Elvis (amazing), Tiff's Waffle Macchiato (amazing), Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich (good, but sausage seemed like it was a frozen patty), and Snickers Latte (good, not too chocolatey).
 
Overall, this place is a gem! We'll definitely be coming back :)
Cute place. Nice selection of waffles, waffle sandwiches and other items. Happy they have vegan options. The waffles were the perfect texture, light and crispy. The coffee was really good, too.

The West Coast I had was amazing!! Perfect meal to start the day, or the long drive back to Ontario.  Coffee was so good, some of the best I've had. This is definitely a must have next time we're in town.

I wish I found this place sooner! Excellent coffee, great food, friendly customer service and WAFFLES! What's not to love? I highly recommend the first signature coffee, Tiff's. Sooo good and comes with a small piece of waffle dipped in cinnamon and sugar on top that you can dip in the coffee for a savory treat. The lattes were also incredible, and every food item (breakfast & lunch) I have loved! Super conveniently located if you go to UNLV, literally down the street in the Target shopping center.
This is the best waffle place I've ever been to. They had sweet and savory waffles. I ordered the savory Thai basil a fb my husband ordered the guru burger. They were both phenomenal!

Great breakfast spot! It wasn't crowded when we were there and the staff was so friendly. We ordered some coffee and got the "Honey I'm home". I would def recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet breakfast.
Thank you for your cruelty free Vegan options!!!!!

First of all, I am a huge fan of breakfast places in general.  I had read in the weekly that this place was pretty good and their menu looked amazing.  So for finals week we decided to treat ourselves.

My partner had the hashtag waffles with strawberries and I went with the bannarama waffles.  The counter lady was pretty nice at first but our order took soo long.  There only three people in the place!  I asked her what was going on and she got extremely rude and said they only had a few irons going and my order would be ready when it's ready.  Need to work on their customer service skills big time!

While we were waiting I ordered a strawberry kale smoothie and it was pretty good until I found some really large chunks of kale that were not blended well.  Tasted like a salad halfway through my drink...

We waited at least an hour before telling her we needed to leave because we were late to class.  She offered us a discount and we ended up getting our orders to go, but they were completely overcooked (big surprise) and the waffles were crispy and tasted like cardboard.  

In the end, the prices are good.  The food and service are not.

This is a very small shop mind you, and there are often only 2-3 people working here at a time. At least that's what I've seen when I go there. Only once have I seen it really busy. This little cafe serves waffles as sandwiches as well as teas. The teas can be taken out or have to drink inside in a big tea cup the size of a small soup bowl. 

When I went with my sister, she ordered a Kisses waffle (Strawberries, chocolate syrup, and whip cream) and I got the Toasty Tokyo Wafflewich (Chicken breast, tokyo dressing, spring mix and cheese). It took a while for the food to come out, which I can understand since only 1 person was working at the time. They have a deck of cards at each table to entertain the guests as we wait for our meal. 
The chocolate sauce dispenser broke and smothered the waffle in chocolate, but my sister was very happy about this since she loves chocolate. My wafflewich was very tasty.

However the cafe filled with the smell of smoke shortly after our our meals were given to us. So the door had to be propped open and let the cold air in.

We found this hidden gem on happy cow on our way back from Hoover Dam. Its in a small strip mall. We walked in to a fun and compfy shop. We were greeted with happy smile and very friendly service. We ordered the West Coast for me and the vegan Guru Burger for my boyfriend. Both were amazing and super tasty. We also split the Green Nut smoothie. I would tell everyone to come and try this gem whether your vegan or not, there is something for everyone.
Great vibe, friendly service and unique dishes. This food is great, I will be coming back every time I'm in Vegas!

They have great filling waffles! Their coffee is very good with some neat variety. We love coming here to grab some coffee and waffles. Cute and clean coffee shop. Sometimes the service is slow, but they take their time making great waffles.
Awesome place with a wide variety of waffles and speciality coffee. They even have red velvet waffles! And you can get it customized how you like. Staff very friendly too!

Great coffee that isn't SB in Las Vegas!  (On another note I'm surprised Stumptown isn't that available around here...)
The service was great too, I especially like how most everything can be made vegan. I'll have to try the vegan waffles next time... they look yummy. Oh yeah, Pearl Jam in the background is a nice touch too:)

I heard great things about this place from a lot of UNLV students, so I had to check it out. I expected it to be just a waffle. While I really like waffles, I can also make them at home, so they are usually just okay, in my opinion.

I ordered the waffledilla sandwich without tiabi sauce. It was spectacular. The flavor of the waffle is off the charts. It had just the right about the sweetness, and the texture was a perfect balance of soft and crispy. The chicken was also moist, and I really enjoyed the whole thing. The chips are also pretty good too, which was unexpected as, again, they are just chips. 

Finally, for dessert I had the cinnamon sugar covered waffle with ice cream. It was really good. I surprisingly enjoyed my sandwich more, though, because the sandwich was more so something that I would not be able to replicate at home. 

Tiabi also frequently has living social or Groupon deals, so this place ends up being super, super cheap. 

I will definitely be back for more.

On a business trip to Vegas and was craving for some waffles. A buddy and I decided to check out some waffle house with good rating and we decided to give this a go. And it was forsure a good pick. Food was great and the avocado smoothie was amazing! Definitely recommended

Oh Tiabi ... how do I love thee? Let me count the ways. You are so incredibly delicious. I can't speak about 99% of their menu because I order a red velvet waffle with chocolate drizzle EVERY SINGLE TIME, but I just don't want to change it up. My sister loves that they have vegan options and are a typically go-to spot for us if we pick someone up at the airport in the morning.

An unexpected treasure. From the outside, I wouldn't have assumed such a delightful experience. I came to TIABI after purchasing a Groupon and assuming it was much closer to where I live. Though we drove 30 minutes to get to TIABI, it was worth it 100%. When you walk in, you're hit with a wall of delicious smells. Then choosing your meal is nearly impossible because EVERYTHING sounds incredible. I highly recommend any waffle with Nutella on it, as well as the Tiff's Waffle Macchiato. It's basically dessert for breakfast, in the best possible way. The service is fantastic. Come, enjoy the free wifi and delicious food, and then come back and try something else on the menu!

The only negative I can think of is there's no storefront visible bike parking, though I can easily lean my bike and against the window and lock the tyre to prevent theft.  This place makes a bomb espresso for your training espresso shot. 

This is my favorite place to grab lunch or breakfast in Vegas.  I live within walking distance and go about 1-2 times a month.  The staff always remembers me and I don't even have to mention that I'm vegetarian since my first visit.  My favorite is the Viva Las Elvis, they make this awesome vegan bacon that is made from coconut flakes in place of all their regular bacon items.  Another favorite of mine is the Guru Burger.  They are happy to try new combinations too if you ask.

My roommate is a carnivore and we always go together.  He really enjoys their non-vegan options as well.

Edit/Disclaimer.  I work here now as of a month ago.  This review was prior to my employment.

Amazing waffles!! Great lunch special! 

This place is probably one of my favorite places to eat off the strip. For the afternoon special you get a small coffee and chips with the waffledilla. Amazing! The portion is pretty decent, but I liked it so much I had two. :D
The service sucked and it took at least 30 minutes to just get our drinks. Not only that but the ice cream was freezer burned and they were literally out of EVERYTHING! doubt I'll be going back again

We stopped by early in the morning on our way to the Grand Canyon, and the restaurant wasn't too busy. At the front desk, they displayed some of their deails, like 10% off for checking in on Yelp, and buy-one-get-one-free on their classic waffles.

The place itself was a good-size hipster cafe, and the employees were all very friendly. The only complaint I had was that the service took unusually long. Our smoothies and coffees came out relatively fast, but for the three waffles we ordered, we waited about 25 minutes. Luckily, they had a few deck of cards that you can play with to pass the time.

Aside from the wait, the food was really delicious. They had a good selection of waffle dishes, and there were a couple substitions that they make to cater to vegans. Overall, definitely recommend this place if you're looking for waffles.
West Coast waffle sandwhich. Nom nom. It was bomb. Tiabi is located across the street from Toys R Us. Definitely a place worth trying.
This place is new & can get pretty busy.... But the food is awesome & the employees are Great....

Amazing hole in the wall restaurant! I love how amazingly friendly the staff is. We are always super satisfied when we come here. We loved it so much that we purchased a groupon for the whole week we were in town. Everything on the menu is to die for! My personal favorite was the west coast and the hey Arnold Palmer. I definitely recommend coming here. You will not be disappointed!

Had such a great dining experience here! The food was awesome and service was excellent! We ordered the kisses, bananatella and break-the-fast waffles. The waffles were light and very flavorful! Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, the toppings were fresh and goes so perfect with each other. For drinks, we had the purple ube frozen frappe, dom's chocolate caramel frozen frappe and tiff's waffles hot machiatto. Each drink was unique and super yummy! (didn't drink them all by myself - shared them with friends) My fave would be the chocolate caramel! 
The ladies of the cafe were all so nice even though we used their livingsocial deal. They were also very accomodating to customers with kids. TWO THUMBS UP to TIABI!!
Had probably the best waffle ever! Loved this place and the coffee was very tasty! Hubby had the waffle sandwich which was surprisingly great!

What a great place.  We were looking for something with breakfast, good coffee, free wi-fi, and popular.  First time I've ever like a waffle sandwich; had the Hashtag breakfast sandwich w/cup of fresh fruit, it was really excellent.

This little place was a great find. Chill definitely come back, next time we're in Vegas.

Hmm where to start. This was my second visit here.  It's a lovely upbeat place with excellent customer service who doesn't give yú attitude when yú have a "complicated order".  We both ordered the Frankenstein thinking it was going to be a hot coffee.  Our cold frothy drinks were presented to us at the counter.  We didn't realize that a blend means it is blended with ice. We thought it was a blend of roasts.  We spoke to the nice gal behind the counter and she explained the differences to us.  My friend then ordered the Java Jolt (which is out of this world good).  The cashier brought out the J.J. when it was ready and wanted to make sure we were satisfied with our drinks.  We tried to pay for the third drink but she refused and said it was on them and apologized for the confusion.  We also asked for a low carb option, she said they could do a sandwich without the waffle, so we opted for that.  It came out perfect and the eggs even had the waffle iron griddle marks.  They have earned a spot on my list of local favorites to visit for Vegas.  Thanks again and keep up the great work.

This place rocks! They are able to make almost anything gluten free. I had the maple bacon waffle with butter and powdered sugar. Boy, was I blown away! The waffle was amazing it had literal pieces of bacon in it. You would never even know it was gluten free. They have a BYOW (Build Your Own Waffle) There are tons of possibilities on this menu and I am excited to come back and try everything. 

The actual space was really cute. The walls had fun quotes and art. 

The service wasn't amazing but wasn't terrible, everyone working was nice and helpful.

Will definitely be a frequent customer!

Great food and great service! The only thing I'm not sure about the food was the TIABI sauce, which tasted a little funny, but overall I enjoyed the food. I asked a lady to take a few photos for us and she took quite a few! Very happy with this place. Can't wait to visit  again.

Fantastic food and coffee. We were all happy about our selections - the waffles are way better than anticipated as part of a sandwich or a quesadilla. The food took longer than expected for a counter service restaurant, but it was delicious and creative.

We ordered the maple bacon waffle and the breakfast sandwich. The food was amazing!  The best waffles ever. I was so impressed. Great customer service and I didn't have to wait too long for my food. I wish there was a Tiabis is San Diego.
Such a cute and vibrant place. The service is so nice and fast! Not to mention how good the food is. It's my favorite place to go for sweets, coffee and a fun game of cards.
I always HAVE to stop here when in town! Delicious yummy, healthy food at a great price - you can't beat it! Highly reccomended especially to those with special diets like vegan/vegetarian!

Who would have thought having waffles as a sandwich and enjoying it with a nice cup of joe would taste so amazing. This adorable place is a central hit to all things waffle, latte, and coffee. Whether you like your waffles savory or sweet, they have something great for everyone. They have a Waffledilla, Guru Burger, Savory Thai Basil, and if you prefer to stick to the Classic way of having your waffle, they do offer Bananatella, Strawberry Kisses, just to name a few. Also they have a waffle bar where you have that option to build it your way. 

I ordered the West Coast Wafflewich ($6.75). This comes with tender chicken, Tiabi sauce, avocado, tomato, cheese, and I omitted bacon. The waffle is served crispy, the tender chicken taste like its seasoned and grilled, and I really like the flavor of the Tiabi sauce. As a side note, I can't even tell these waffles are vegan. All I can taste is how savory and delicious my wafflewich is and when I dip it with a side of syrup, it makes the meal even worth ordering for another one. 

Now one of the most popular Signature Drink is Tiff's Waffle Macchiato ($4.55), which is a blend of cinnamon, vanilla, and macchiato topped with whipped cream and a churro waffle. I ordered this as a regular size hot drink with almond milk ($0.75) and requested a light whipped cream. This drink taste incredibly good! I never knew there is so much enjoyment eating a crunchy cinnamon flavored waffle churro and dipping that on a nice frothy cream. It's just so heavenly.
This place is super adorable and has amazing food! Great location to get away from the main strip for a little while. Service is quick and food comes out fast.

My husband and I visited this place while we were in vegas for our one year anniversary.  We give this place 5 stars. Taste is great and menu is original. It is a smaller joint and if busy be prepared to wait. Love the food, environment, and music. Would come back here if we visit vegas again.

Tell them you're staying if you want your latte in their cup with a foam design. They didn't ask me and put it in a to-go cup. Such a bummer for me since my whole reason for coming was for a fun latte. 

It was a 3 star but the menu still has me curious (half the fun) so I give it 4 stars. There are lots of vegetarian options (even a coconut bacon, bacon alternative which is shredded, roasted coconut with ketchup/liquid smoke and other ingredients that give the coconut a more savory flavor over a sweet coconut flavor. They also offer a V ice cream alternative). 

(4/5) I got a small pistachio latte because of my love for pistachio ice cream. It did not disappoint in terms of flavor. What brought me here, though, were the pictures of the fun drinks with waffles on them. Visual appeal simply makes everything taste better. My latte got defaulted into a to-go cup  even though I was never asked for here or to-go. I'd even set up my spot to study and my drink came after 3 others drinks so there was time to simply glance over and see I was staying (not populated at all, regardless of the three previous orders). So if you come and want a foam design, verbalize that it's for here. 

(2/5) I also got the kale chocolate chip cookie- the green cookie. I'm all about the healthy way of life but this did not make me want to stay on track. Yes, you could taste the kale. The cookie was fluffy (I'm thinking lots of flour), and had I not had my coffee I wouldn't have finished it. It wasn't sweet like a cookie, but it did remind me of a scone without the shape. I probably would have liked it if I was thinking I was getting into a scone, actually. Subbing out for larger chocolate chips would have also added to the texture in a positive way. 

I asked a lot of questions, some were answered with "I don't know" with no intention on finding the answer (such as when I inquired about the different types of cookies) and others were answered by the guy making the drinks. I sort of felt like an inconvenience and like I should just go and sit back down because they wouldn't elaborate much without me 'pressing.' But the cashier could be new. I don't know. 

I loved the menu. It looks really interesting and I love places that have originality. 

The restaurant didn't have a warm, cozy feel but it was nice, nonetheless. Fun, far chalk wall mural. Actually, chalk was the main art theme. I liked it. 

The music was reggae. I dig. Perhaps a little loud. Startling at times. 

Definitely give this place a try, though.

Such delicious food, went here for lunch and had a delicious waffle sandwich South American wafflewich and I Had the ice cream sandwich delicious 
The smells in the restaurant was amazing

I'm very particular when it comes to my coffee. I'm diabetic, so finding sugar free options is really hard. This place makes an good sugar free vanilla iced coffee. West Coast Waffle Sandwich was awesome too. Will be back for more.

SMOOTHIE IS THE BEST THING HERE......not coffee....or waffles

For a place that is specifically a coffee and waffle place... Both the coffee and waffles are not that great. The coffee is mainly milk and barely any coffee. We tried a skinny latte, iced coffee, tiffs coffee with a waffle on top. The coffee flavor is not strong at all but mainly milky ... Maybe next time we should just order black coffee. 
The waffles on the other hand are kinda soggy. They are topped with so much whipped cream and sauces that is what probably took out the good crunch in the waffle. 
The best thing at this place was their smoothies surprisingly. I would give their smoothies a 5! The Green Nut is absolutely the best smoothie ever! And it is healthy with almond and kale it is so refreshing!! I would highly recommend it to anyone. I would come here again but ONLY to get another smoothie not for anything else. 

Also there is a good groupon for this place my friend and I tried it out we each bought $24 worth at this place. But interestingly enough the Groupons  come in three separate Groupons worth $8 each. I am ok with that because we can come multiple times, but when I came with my friend he had his groupon and I had mine and they had the audacity to question us and tell us that we cannot use it when coming within "one visit" well he bought his separate and I bought mine. It is a different transaction who cares it is also separate visit because it is his visit, then my visit. 
Also,what if I wanted to use my second groupon would it be considered a "different visit" if I walked out the door then came back in? They are sticklers about this rule so if you bought a groupon then watch out they are going to grill you about it!

Great place to get some waffle sandwiches or delicious drinks.  Also, the music had me feeling nostalgic, all hits from the 90s, which is a good thing.  A lot of students study here from what I saw.  Very nice workers here and they accommodated a side of eggs for my toddler.  We used the one high chair in sight.

Very impressed! Wife and I shared a wafflewich and a golden waffle. I also had the Snickers iced coffee. Menu is very eclectic. You can tell they are working on the decor as they use paintings from local artists. Will definitely be back to try other items on the menu.

Everything was awesome! I ordered the West Coast waffle sandwich and the BananaBerry smoothie. The only thing it lacked was that the sandwich took awhile for it to come out and it wasn't busy when I went, other than that I would definitely come back hoping for faster service!

Bought the groupon so I had the opportunity to check out this spot 3 times. Suffice to say, after all 3 visits, I thought that it was OK.

I guess that this place focuses mainly on waffles used in a traditional sense, with sweet toppings, as well as savory preparations, such as using a pair of waffles as a bun for a sandwich.

First off, I would say that using the groupon was pretty difficult here. I had 3 of them, good for $8 to spend. The waffles ranged from 5-6 dollars, and the coffee drinks ranged from 4-5. You do the math. I think it would have been better to offer 2 $5 for $10, instead of the 3 $4 for $8.

The good news first. The fillings and toppings they use are great! For the hashtag breakfast sandwich, the egg and turkey sausage was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. For the Tokyo sandwich, the chicken was moist and tender, and the veggies were very fresh. The sauces they use are well balanced, the sweet ones aren't too sweet, and the savory sauces are packed with flava!

The bad news. I hated the waffle. I've tried both the thin waffle they use for sandwiches, and the thicker Belgium style one. My conclusion is that I frankly don't like their waffle recipe. They both had a strong metallic taste that resonated the more I ate it. This happens when I eat biscuits or other quick breads that use too much leavening, such as baking powder. This may be the culprit. The interior of the waffle is pretty doughy as well. 

Also, it took a little longer that I though it would to receive my order. On my last visit, I ordered a waffle sandwich, lolly waffle, and small hot coffee, and I timed them at 16 minutes. It would be better than to rather than to stack 3 separate customer orders at the same time, it's better to do one order at a time, because the 2 other people received their orders 1 minute after mine was ready :/

The coffee is ok but pricy for the portion size. The employees are nice and friendly, but also they seem to be easily distracted.

Wasn't the worst waffle, but not the best. Slightly middle of the pack is where I would put them. If you are in the mood for a savory waffle sandwich, this place would be the place to go because no one else in town is doing it (RIP Bread and Butter). Liked everything 'cept for the waffle itself. 'Nuff said.

Loved it here! 
I got lost and they were very friendly on the phone.
The menu has a lot of options and the prices were great. 
The honey latte was delicious and so was the viva las Elvis waffle. 
A must go off the strip pit stop!

Stopped by to have lunch with my brother. The menu is self explanatory. I ate the waffle named hashtag breakfast Sandwhich and it was bomb! I also had a blended frap called white chocolate tuxedo. It was SOO good. This place is a very laid back place. Music and the environment is very welcoming! 

First time here and it won't be the last. There is a lot of things I would like to try when I come back.

Tiabi is a small little cafe located next to Target. I saw few students there studying since they offer free wifi. The prices were reasonable. I ordered the red velvet chocolate chip waffles. Some of the coffee beverages sounded yummy but I held off from getting one. I went during the evening so it was pretty much slow but there was some what of a wait to get our food. The waffles were good but it wasn't filling enough for me. Compared to Babystacks, Tiabi was just average.
I love this little place. Their coffee is phenomenal and the waffles are just incredible.

My second time here and still impressed ! Had "kisses" waffles with strawberries and bananas with chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream. Came to visit Las Vegas and had to come here again. My first time was last summer. So yummy . But a tad bit pricey.
This place is AWESOME!! I love all of the Vegan options!! I had the Guru Burger and the Coconut mint lemonade. I highly recommend it!
Coffee is super strong. The west coast was SOOOOOO yummy. The customer service was great. Definitely will be visiting again!!!

I am thoroughly impressed with this cute, small,  and quiet breakfast spot.  The waffles are oh so good!  I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich with waffles,  turkey sausage, egg and cheese.  The waffles are made fresh and they're so good.  Also I tried the waffle Macchiato and although they took a long time to make the waffle for my Macchiato they gave me an extra waffle and it was muy delicioso.  I will be back even tho I live all the way in summerlin!  I will be recommending this place!
Vegan Belgian waffles with tasty toppings!! Fun little place with excellent food, great coffee and reasonable prices. Always hit it up when I'm in town. I recommend the Vegan La Elvis.
I can smell the wraffle once i walked in. They have a very unique menu and can't wait to try their food! 10%off when you check in and free iced coffee when you leave a review.
Very nice staff and yummy waffles, I just wish they were more filling.  Their coffee drinks are delicious.

Very good food at an affordable price. Just know that everything is freshly made so this isn't a fast food restaurant. Plane to be there for at least 10-15 to get your food but it's worth it! And it doesn't have all that junk you would get at other restaurants.  Try the Californian! And students get a discount! Just show your ID!

Local place for breakfast or lunch that serves waffles either sweet or savory. Since all waffles are vegan they are flat. The one thing we all said is the food is yummy but dry. We need syrup or more sauce. Order up front. Wait for your food. Bus your own table. Tables with benches or round tables with armless chairs. Not to much room to get a scooter around.

We were looking for a simple breakfast place in the land of Casino breakfasts and we are glad we found Tiabi! Excellent service and very yummy food. The maple Bacon Waffle was great and reminded me of when my Dad used to make bacon waffles! Ah, sweet reminiscence! The West Coast Waffle sandwich was also delicious and it improved on a very decent chicken sandwich with the addition of waffles. If you're liking for a giant Denny's style breakfast menu this is not the place but if you want some really good waffles Tiabi is an excellent choice!

This is probably one of my favorite breakfast spots I have been to in Vegas. The atmosphere is so welcoming and the employees are very friendly. The waffles are amazing and they have so many customizable options. If you're a big coffee fan, like me, you'll love their original coffee creations. I definitely recommend this spot !!
I love Tiabi! I come here because they have the best selection of waffles and waffle sandwiches. It's the best. It's a nice place to relax and have a cup of coffee too!

Love the food the churros waffle topping it's really good!!! My daughter and husbands likes it... The drinks is good not to sweet not to strong.. I love the place it's small it's a chill place the smell of the place is really good... The red velvet waffle I ordered is really good with chocolate chips and chocolate syrup with whip cream and extra strawberry on the side is really good I'll be back for sure... The ladies that work there are really nice too... Oh  download the epoxy app it's a reward apps!!!  Don't forget hihi....

First here in this location people that works here are nice... The place needs a little clean up... The place is really busy than the other one. The waffle makes needs to be REPLACED already or something they been wasting a lot of waffles anyway... The drink I ordered the peachy I didn't like it at all even then have to redo my drink... The waffle churros was nothing like the one at Simmons locations..

Bookmarked to try this place for brunch, and I managed to go here this past Friday with the Mom and Sister. They were hesitant 'cause they hadn't been here before and were expecting to to one of our usual brunch places, but they ended up being extremely happy with the experience.
Customer service was awesome. After greeting us, the cashier noticed that we were probably new to the place, so he told us a little about the ordering process and menu (regular items, faves, and seasonal specials). Pretty chill and nice guy. 
The sister ordered the Halloween-themed menu for a waffle and a cold latte. Mom ordered a Halloween-themed hot latte with a West Coast Wafflewich. I ordered a cold Chocolate Coconut with a West Coast Wafflewich. Hahaha... The sister liked her waffle and her drink, but she wished she had ordered the same wafflewich as us. It had a pretty amazing sauce, and the ingredients tasted as fresh as can be. I will admit that I wish I had their latte though. Don't get me wrong 'cause I liked my drink, but I tasted more chocolate than coconut, and I'm looking for a balance. 
The cashier also kept making sure we were okay as I got the food whenever it was ready to be picked up from the counter. He also happened to be the busperson, nice enough to pick up after us when we were done. Sorry sir... I'll be sure to put our stuff in the bucket thing on the side when we're done. Thanks though!

The clientele in this place drove me nuts. I went there 3 times and heard the word "totes" on numerous occasions. I also heard a "delish" and a "this is so bomb." But the best: "PERF." A girl was referring to some guy she was seeing as "PERF." I couldn't unhear these conversations as millennials talk so damn loud. When I go in for visit 4, headphones will be brought. I can't listen to these kids. Darn college towns. 

Food was excellent. Staff was engaged and personable. Coffee was good. For what it is, I'd give this a 4.5, but since that doesn't exist, I'll round up. Slightly less than PERF, but I'll give it a PERF because it was TOTES DELISH...but slightly less than being SO BOMB.

Help me God.

Quick, easy, mellow atmosphere playing reggae music... waffles are great especially in sandwich form. West coast sandi is good in my book. The drinks are funky cool and creative, very different if you like to explore. So good thumbs up!

Got here at 11:15am today for brunch. The cashier told us that it's gonna be a 15-20 minute wait and since we were hungry and didn't wanna go anywhere before my friend's flight, we opted to wait. 

I ordered a breakfast waffle and iced coffee, while my friend ordered a smoothie, latte and west coast wafflewich. 11:45 and still no food or drinks. The place was packed and there's only 3 employees- 1 cashier and 2 food prep staff. 

Since it was already 12:00, we decided to take our food to-go. Coffee was okay. Nothing special. The waffle was crisp and crunchy which was good. Breakfast wafflewich was delicious but needs a little maple syrup, which we didn't get to have anymore bec we took the food to-go. Prices are reasonable. 

I'll think about whether giving this place another try. Otherwise, they should add more staff.
This place had us hooked from day one. May and Tiff are so sweet and very innovative with their menu. I always get the same thing because it's just too damn good. Love the vibe of this place.
Such good customer service! Staff is welcoming!  They have great tasting waffles and loved their latte!
