Love this place! First time here and for sure coming back. The staff were nice and the bananatella is to die for, and their espresso rocks! Thank you

The Good
A very pleasant and nice staff with reasonably priced items.  

The Bad
The food and the wait. My wife ordered the banana Nutella waffle which came out first and the waffle was overcooked and very dry. The Nutella was flavorless and limited as it was drizzled on. My only other experience to compare this type of waffle with was at Disneyworld and there waffle was moist, soft and warm with the Nutella adding a great accent. 
I ordered the hashtag waffle and a banana Nutella for me. The hashtag was again an overcooked, dry and burnt in some areas waffle with turkey sausage that tasted like they came out of the frozen foods section at Von's supermarket.  Completely flavorless. The egg that came with it I cannot not even explain what it looked like.  My banana Nutella waffle did not even look like my wife's as by the time I got it I was told they were having issues with there waffle maker. It reminded me of one my 12 year old made me for Father's Day. 

The Ugly
Due to technical problems everything took twice as long as long as it should.  I even saw A gentleman get up who had been waiting there before us asking why was it taking so long for his food.  For my inconvenience of waiting so long they offered me a cookie. At that moment they should've offered to discount my food at least. 

One of the things I hate having to do on a yelp review is do a negative review. Hopefully, for others they will not receive this type of food or delay.  My goal is always to stay away from the chain restaurants and find those little hidden gems in the city.  Unfortunately, I didn't find the gem.

This place is kind of average doesn't really surprise me but it does have quite a selection of new food choices. I'm not really into the type of food though so this review is mostly biased on my point of food that I like.

Went here today for lunch with my son who's Vegan. I had the West Coast wafflewich and he had a waffle, vegan of course. I also had a side of green tea ice cream and an iced coffee. The waffle sandwich was delicious! The restaurant was clean, the staff friendly and we got our food pretty fast. I don't live in Vegas but if I did I would definitely be a regular. I would definitely recommend trying this place to any friends who visit Vegas in the future.
Cute little place. Seemingly startup and had delicious waffles and coffee both iced and hot in mason jars(iced). Vegan and regular waffle options available in all flavored and styles.  Very good!

Cool little spot. Drove by  100s of times and finally stopped by for breakfast. 

Great atmosphere. Waffle with coffee is great. Reminds me of when I was a kid and my grandma used to let me dip my Filipino bread in her coffee. 

Great place to bring a date or get some work done.
I enjoy coming to Tiabi for the West Coast waffle sandwich. It's their signature/customer favorite.

Nice concept, average execution. So far we had

- The West Coast with chips
- Hashtag breakfast sandwich with chips
- Golden waffles
- Bananatella
- Waffle macciato

The savory items had the potential, but it was a failure due to the lack of freshness. To be fair, they aren't pricey, so I think it's a reasonable middle ground, but I hoped something better than this.

I probably should go a second time just to hopefully have a change of mind. But I just didn't really care for their items and especially not their service. 

The place is small and they do offer outdoor seating however, in the middle of summer you just can't wing it. 

I ordered the West Coast Waffle Sandwich, which had bacon, tomato, avocado and chicken and their special sauce which I felt was lacking and can't say I tasted it. 

The sandwich was good and we also ordered their churro waffle with ice cream which was also good.  

We also shared a snickers iced coffee drink since they were out of the one we wanted, which was not good at all and tasted more like a cheap 7-Eleven coffee with flavorings. 

Last but not least the service.   Twice we were dropped off items that did not belong to us, luckily we didn't touch them, but perhaps a suggestion would be a number on the table system or similar.  These items went to second wrong table before they made it to the correct table.  Each time the cashier yelled out direction to the server while having patrons in front of her ordering.  Service is key no matter how small of an establishment you are. 

Not sure about this place

The food here is sooo good! The staff are super friendly as well! This was my go-to spot when I was an undergrad at UNLV. Although a couple of items have changed on the menu over time, there's still a great selection and I'll definitely be back. I'm pretty picky when it comes to how my waffles are cooked and their waffles are cooked perfectly. Also, make sure you try the lavender and white chocolate latte - it's bomb!!

This place ruined all food for me. Like a virgin touched for the very first time nothing will ever quite live up to the Western Wafflewich, (more like a waffle taco),  and the golden waffle smothered in butter and sweet syrup. Two course breakfast! The memory of this meal will forever linger, sweet and savory, a place I can visit in the annals of my mind when the world is getting me down and leave smiling a happy satisfied smile.

This little hole in the wall is an amazing gem! Every time I come here I am never disappointed. My favorite is the breakfast sandwich with Turkey sausage and a side of potatoes chips that are so yummy. For those that are coffee lovers I recommend the Espresso Frankenstein this puppy would wake the dead lol. But most of all I like the staff they are super friendly and if you need help choosing whether it be your drink or food they will steer you in the right direction.

Go to this place.  I was hesitant about waffle sandwiches, and this place changed my world.   Had the breakfast sandwich.  Add the turkey sausage.   It was perfect.  Also had Tiffs waffle macciatio.  Sooooooo good!!! Relaxed atmosphere, great coffee food and service.

I tried to love this place because it looked good and was close to where I was living but I just wasn't impressed. 

I ordered the green tea drink, they were out of green tea and what they gave me instead just wasn't good. The waffle sandwich and strawberry cheesecake waffle were just okay. The lemon blueberry muffin was the best part. Although they forgot it in my order and I had to go back for it.
Great food! Great coffee!!! Love their Espresso Frankenstein, it's pretty is AMAZING! It's the perfect blend! We came to visit Las Vegas and had to come back a 2nd time while we were out there!

Delicious #wafflesandwiches !!! Vegan options and decadent coffee options. My boyfriend and I were greeted by multiple employees and were taken great care of when ordering for the first time. We received our coffee and food in less than 10mins!! Also very chill relaxing playlist in the cafe. Great vibes!!

We came here for the first time today. This is a lot like waffles cafe up the street. They have a bit more of a coffee selection and all the food menu was pretty much waffle sandwiches. The prices are about the same but here you don't get chips with the sandwich and it's a bit smaller. The waffle itself was tasty  and not quite as thick so it's not so doughy. Coffee was good and the next time I come back I'll try one of the the fancier ones. As for seating there's not a lot. we sat outside, there was no open seating inside. With that being said it took a little bit of time to get the food since we were waiting for everyone a head of us which is understandable. Service was also friendly.

Cute local vibe, gal at the counter was friendly and the breakfast waffle was just what I needed! My short iced latte wasn't too confusing (its amazing how many people are confused when you don't want 2cups of sugar in your latte) I will definitely be back!

Excellent latte!   The smoothest and easiest drinking coffee I had on the weekend trip.  It blows away the $7 coffees on the strip easily.

Hashtag waffles - I have to assume they were excellent.  The kid devoured both of them in addition to the fruit toppings they came with.  This was the first time ever she finished an adult sized meal by herself!

Hashtag breakfast sandwich - This was good - the standard eggs and sausage.  If it was a runny sunnyside egg, that would have been much better.   I'd probably pass on this one to get a...

West Coast Wafflewich - now this  was a good combination of flavor and texture.  Put bacon and avocado on anything and you have a winner.

The sample of strawberry kisses was a nice way to end the late lunch.

I think i prefer the round crunchy waffles over the thicker style just because they retained their crunch.   But the coffee will definitely bring me back the next time I'm in Vegas.

This is a new spot I just discovered. If you love waffles, then be here. The size is fairly large for a small-stomached person like me but I wasn't gonna waste such good finds. The food was handcrafted with love. It's not noisy thus very good for reflecting on your life whilst munching on waffles and sipping coffee. The only reason I gave a four star was because I wasn't told where the water dispenser was located, so I stayed thirsty for a min. No sign indicating where to place your used baskets so I held on to it for a little longer. But I was excited she remembered to bid goodbye as I exited this miniature-yet-cool- wafs and cof spot. I'll be there again with friends.

This was an utter disappointment!  Super slow service, waffles are bland if you do not get all of the fruity toppings. 

My daughter said she would have preferred an Eggo waffle over this!

The Maple Bacon didn't do anything for me at all.. The bacon was basically super thin, cold and overcooked. 

I would have preferred Mc Donald's over this, I think we are headed there now!

I Don't Live in Vegas and found this place off the beaten path. I love it! Vegan or non-Vegan you can go and have a great meal a good cup of coffee/smoothie in a very pleasant setting. The staff here is some of the best I have encountered in Vegas. They're friendly, helpful and always seemed to have a smile (even when things got busy and everyone was under pressure).  I now make this a place I stop at when coming to visit a few times a year. So, my only caveat to anyone reading this is this, if you are in a super hurry call a head, everything is made to order and it takes some time to cook those amazing Belgian waffles to perfection. So kick back and enjoy, I did!!

Visiting in Vegas. Needing good food off the strip. Found this place. We ordered the waffledilla with avocado, breakfast sandwich, the west coast without tomatoes. All were good and savory. Also enjoyed the golden waffle with strawberries and powdered sugar as well as the churro waffle with strawberries whip and caramel. Very tasty. It was just about the perfect breakfast. The lavender latte both the hot and cold were delicious. The churro macchiato also good. The waffle that comes on the macchiato is built in dessert.  We all thought this was a great choice tasty, friendly staff. Don't be in a hurry though all is made fresh which is why it's so good but not fast food. The waffles are all vegan which is a major plus.  A great place. Look forward to coming back.

place is amazing tons of vegan options 
amazing waffles and a lot of interesting options.
hidden gem! snickers coffee? pumpkin churro waffles? get unique! check this place out! really nice staff as well i highly recommend it

Great place!!!!! Their waffles sandwiches are amazing! Waffles are super soft and fluffy. All of the food tastes fresh! I am typically picky with my iced coffees but they have very good coffee beverages as well. Great and friendly service as well!

Really enjoyed my experience at TIABI today! I came on a Wednesday and it was very slow... (Roberto's next door has $1 tacos on Wednesday which steals some of the business) which was good for me because I was entirely indecisive about what I wanted to order and didn't have to feel rushed. The girl at the counter was awesome and seemed happy to answer all of my questions about the menu items. Even I was annoyed at myself, but she didn't seem to be bothered.

They have a nice selection when it comes to vegan options, and I finally decided on the Thai basil wafflewich with a guru patty instead of chicken and the Honey I'm Home churro dessert waffle with vegan ice cream, and both of them were delicious! That paired with yummy iced latte with almond milk was just heavenly. 

The shop is small and I can see how during busy hours it can be hard to find a place to sit (not very many places to sit). I was happy to come during a less congested time because I got really great service and delicious food! I will definitely be coming back to try the other things.

This place and their team is spectacular! We had a large event here with 20 guests. Everyone was accommodating, the food was phenomenal, and there were was quite a variety for us to choose from. 

I had a hot waffle macchiato and the waffle breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage and veggies. On my way out, I got a coconut cooler, which was a totally refreshing and unique cold drink that didn't make it all the way home with me. :) Definitely give this place a shot!

The waffles were great: they did a great job with a vegan waffle! The smoothie: not so much: very thin and grainy. They had a pretty awesome pistachio latte. It's the kind of place that does a few things extremely well!

I enjoyed my visit, service was great.  Waffle was pretty good.  Pistachio latte was excellent!  I enjoy a thicker fluffier waffle but this one was thinner and crunchy.  Not bad though.  I will return to try more coffees!!!

Found this place on yelp when I didn't feel like walking 2 miles to dunkin donuts. Right from the start great customer service. Incredibly friendly cashier and most importantly amazing food. The waffles had the perfect texture and the fruit was so fresh. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for breakfast in the area.

This spot is quite calm and cool never let me down at all it's amazing. That red velvet waffle! This is a spot that is definitely under recognized and talked about. It's in a great location and prime for locals. The menu and I always have a fight due to so many choices. They drinks is amazing and the prices are exceptionally reasonable, too reasonable if you ask me. The crunch and flavor is everything. To top it off the customer service is the greatest. You want a nice treat to get away from the Vegas hustle and bustle... this is the place

The first of its name! The prodigal child of both coffee and waffle! The place where it all started and the original bringer of delicious not to all. My experiences are short here but oh so memorable. It is comforting to have the consistency in flavors and service that I have come to look forward in my every day life on both sides of town. I know come here and expect to get any one of their signature drinks or waffles and it to blow away my taste buds like no other. I also know that I can see the same great attitude and customer service from anyone in the staff. They are all kind and eager to help in any way they can and are always professional. If I ever find myself frequenting this location as much as the location in the north I know I will never be disappointed which is something that few coffee or waffle or both can guarantee so well as they do. No matter where you are in Vegas do not be afraid to venture out or go somewhere so delectable that should blow your mind. I know when I see opportunity for something Fantastic I am always down. Ps. I am always excited to see the new items they have to offer. Yum!

I come here every day that I am able to. It has the best cold brew around and even if I didn't live so close I would totally go out of my way to come here, it is that amazing. I have been coming here since it has opened and did not think a place could continuously give a better experience like this one has. The whole staff has given fantastic(and I don't use the word lightly) customer service and are so inviting. Their outgoing spirits and humble attitude definitely make it a second home. Which helps me recommend this place on the daily and have had positive feedback from everyone that goes. Which also does not come easy for a self proclaimed foodie like myself. To this day my first experience here was so memorable I know it will last me a life time, which in itself is a feat that most places can match, that has hooked me for life. If you are in the neighborhood or willing to venture out for an awesome piece of treasure. Look no further and make the trek you will not be disappointed. It will be the little chariot that lights up your life.

Came here earlier this afternoon and I was pleasantly surprised how good this place is ! I'm not a waffle person (I'm personally a pancake or crepe person) and I absolutely LOVED my meal here. I passed by this place probably a million times since it's near UNLV but decided to come here since I got a free coupon from my school for their Tiff's waffle macchiato. I ordered their West Coast waffle which had chicken , their signature Tiabi sauce , melted cheese , avocado , tomato and I subbed their bacon for egg instead. It was pretty delicious and savory for breakfast/brunch and it wasn't too pricey ! And I was impressed w/ their waffle macchiato - I loved the cute little churro flavored waffle. Service was very friendly however they make everything by order so don't plan on rushing here to eat if you have class , etc. Also it's not a good place to study , tables are a bit dirty - it's more of a place to just to sit down & eat. They have Groupon and Yelp-in deals available too so more of a reason to come and try this place out :) and vegan options available. Will be back again to try the Savory Thai basil waffle and other menu items !

Cool, unique, hole in the wall place. Every dish I've had has been great. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Just a great place overall.

This place is has got to be one of my favorite spots locally for coffee and a quick bite in vegas!  I've tried the vegan Wafflewhich and not that I'm vegan but thought I give it shot and it was DIVINE. I will definitely be going back to try the rest.

Coffee with a side of waffles! Tiff's Waffle Macchiato, which pairs a cinnamon vanilla latte with a small churro waffle, is the perfect way to start your morning. Bonus points for being priced well too, at about $5 for a drink and treat in one! It's my go to if I pop in here.

This location is small and a bit out of the way for me, but a stop I'll make if in the area. I like the patio seating and the drink menu (the seasonal specials rock!), but generally prefer the waffles at full service restaurants better. Service could be a bit more attentive but the staff are generally pretty friendly.

Eh... Was going to order waffles but they had no ice cream, so I went with the avocado drink. Ummmm... No bueno. Too much ice, no flavor, and I don't think the avocado was ripe enough. I make avocado drinks and it should turn somewhat green. My drink was a pale green yellow. The lady was nice so I gave her a star and then another star for the drink. Absolute fail. Sorry guys... Just speaking the truth. Make the avacado drink more milky less icy. Or just don't call it a smoothie cause it's far from that.

I don't know what these guys are doing to make the waffles so good, but what ever it is they are doing it right!!! They are about to put Bruxie out of business! In all sincerity, best sandwich, waffle sandwich, and lunch/ breakfast I have had in a while! Visiting from Cali, go Tiabi! Thanks guys.

Their vegan wafflewich is pretty tasty! I really wish they were 100% vegan! Vegan butter and vegan waffles taste just the same if not better than dairy butter or waffles. Same with their coffees. Would be way better if they were vegan. Also, the service is pretty annoying... my mother and I ordered the vegan waffle sandwiches and two coffees and I had to go up to the bar four separate times to get each item.
Really nice hangout place. Wait was a little long but understandable due to how busy it was. Drink was lacking sweetness but waffle was delicious!
Bacon inside my waffle mmm. Had breakfast there yesterday and really considering going back for lunch today. Tiffs waffle macchiato is fantastic! Love Tiffy and Mae. Love Tiabi.

Yet another review to say that the customer service needs work. I came by today for a latte after finding this place on the Yelp app- it's still difficult to find, as it's in a nook of the plaza and can't really be seen from the street.
I guess their exterior signage is still being developed, because right now there's just a tarp printed with "Coffee & Waffles".

Went in and there seemed to be some sort of lounge affect going on. I made my way around a group of women clustered near the entrance talking, perused the posted menu, then stood behind a guy chatting at the front counter for a good five minutes before the woman he was speaking to realized I was a paying customer, and said she'd help me. 
I find it a little tacky that the employee (who seemed to be one of the co-owners) was not more attentive to the fact that I was waiting in line to place an order.
As it is, she excused herself in such a way that I felt I was inconveniencing her. 

Regardless, I ordered a skinny vanilla latte- originally planned on getting a sandwich, but it seemed this would have really been a problem to her, so I just stuck to the drink. It was tasty, even if the foam was overflowing along the lip of the lid.

Found a table of samples toward the back as I waited for my drink- the cinnamon sugar waffle and the bacon-cheddar waffle were both really flavorful, though the former was nice and crisp while the latter was more on the limp and soggy side. 

Location seems like it'll be good for students, and they seem to have a lock on the niche market- doubt bistro waffles are offered anywhere else nearby. Hope they succeed, maybe I'll be back when they work out the kinks- namely waiting for the novelty of business ownership to wear off enough for them to prioritize customer service. Their product seems like it'll do well.
Waffles were really good. Spruces weren't an arm and a leg and the Spot was intimate. There were cards to play with while waiting which was great for passing the time. Definitely will be coming back.

First time here.. I like the feel of the place. Took me time to order. I got the Westcoast. And it was awesome.. I got an iced coffee.. And I have to say it was pretty tasty!! I think I'll come back here again and again!!

I only visited this place due to a friend wanting to try it. I've had better. The waffles came out dry. I  ordered from their savory menu and to be honest it was disappointing. The items felt like it came from a box and wasn't that much of a difference from a fast food breakfast "sandwich".

  I do not like the type of groupon they put out. You have to literally come back a couple of times to use all of them. The instructions are there but from now on I'm literally avoiding all groupons that expect you to come back each time to use. Actually I'm not even a fan of groupon but a friend convince me to try this place with her. Even she wasn't impressed due to the fact that she can make waffles at home that tasted better ( her words not mine).

  Coffee drinks is a hit or miss. Some tasted ok and some tasted bitter.

What Will You Get At Tiabi Coffee and Waffle?

Tiabi Coffee and Waffle is a rather unique counter-serve waffle place in Las Vegas. Located at 3961 South Maryland Parkway, it is at the Mission Center just north of the main UNLV campus. This place has some appealing waffle options that are different from what you'd expect elsewhere.

This spot focuses heavily on unique waffle creations. These include traditional waffles as well as some sandwiches that use waffles.

A Different Approach

Tiabi Coffee and Waffle is a contemporary dining spot that offers various types of waffles. It has many vegan food options and plenty of different coffee choices. It was established in 2013 and continues to be an entertaining place for waffles.

This spot has a rather modern look that isn't too unique or different. Still, it is an intriguing place to visit. It has a friendly look to it that stands out as an inviting spot for all members of the family.

What Does It Take To Get Waffles?

The food here at Tiabi is excellent but it can take a while to get. We waited about twenty minutes to get our food. However, we assume that this is because the food is so intricate and designed with an immense approach to detail.

The people here are friendly and do well with getting orders down. They always ensure that the food is made precisely as desired. The fact that these people can work with vegan requests if desired is an attractive point too. It ensures that people can get a great waffle even if they have particular limits on what they will eat.

Great Foods All Around

The foods here start with plenty of great signature beverages. Tiff's Waffle Macchiato has cinnamon vanilla macchiato with a churro waffle and whipped cream. This has a brilliant design that is creamy and detailed.

The Stiles Java Jolt has a vanilla breve misto and vanilla with a bit of extra espresso. This adds an extra amount of caffeine to create a good taste. Various frappes and teas are all around the place too.

The creative nature of this place is particularly highlighted in the waffle sandwiches it offers. The Waffledilla features chicken, Tiabi sauce and melted cheese and an optional avocado. This is carefully made with waffle patties to establish a great flavor all around.

The classic options here are interesting to see as well. The Strawberry Kisses waffle mixes sliced strawberries with a chocolate drizzle. The Viva Las Elvis waffle has bananas and peanut butter plus chopped bacon. A bit of honey is added to create a stronger flavor too.
Everything was awesome! Nice laid back atmosphere. Great food. Great price. Great service. I had the viva las vegas waffle. Banana, PB, and bacon. Will come every time I am in Vegas

This place is amazing great vibes and even better food. Everyone was very helpful and super friendly. The food was so good and I was surprised that it was all vegan. It tasted better than most regular waffle I've had. I can't wait to come here again and soon!

The have an interesting, diverse menu, but I've never had anything I didn't like. The staff and owners are awesome people with a passion for food. Everything is reasonably priced and you get a satisfying meal every time. Love it.

excellent idea. i went for breakfast with a friend and it was busy but quiet enough to be considered intimate. the coffee was not the best i've had but it was not bad. the presentation of my waffle was pretty good but i feel like they were a little scarce on the toppings.
Awesome service. Jay, the manager, was incredibly helpful and very passionate about the menu offerings.
Environment is great..   coffee is great...  Food is great...  Service is great AND their kale vegan cookies are absolutely AMAZING!!!

Cool little cafe in the target plaza center. The cashier was nice and friendly. My hubby had the hashtag breakfast waffle sandwich which was awesome. I had the smores waffle which was a little too rich and sweet for me and I have a serious sweet tooth. I also had the green nut smoothie which was pretty good as well. The wait however was pretty long like 45 mins to receive our food and I was almost late to an appointment. There's vegan options for vegans that I thought was cool. I'll give them another try though to get my own breakfast waffle sandwich.
Def. recommend. Awesome coffee and eclectic breakfast options ranging from my preferred West Coast waffle sammie & then hubby's Viva Las Elvis waffle!!! We'll be back!

A joke.  If all you want is a coffee and a waffle allocate an hour.  It took over five minutes for my mocha and over 25 minutes for a single plain waffle.  They weren't even busy.

Even worse was watching the cook literally man handle every waffle that came out. Hopefully his gloves aren't latex because he would send anyone with a latex allergy to the hospital with his pulling waffles hot from the iron off with his fingers and then flipping the waffle between both hands then shoving them back on to the iron if he decided it wasn't dark enough. Despite the constant fiddling my waffle still managed to come to me cold.  It couldn't even melt the butter on it.

Flavor wise its not worth anything. My mocha was so over chocolated that the only flavour from the coffee was a bitter under note.  As for the waffle it was so nothing I might as well have had an eggo or poured bisquick shake and pour into my waffle iron 

Oh, and they no longer offer Belgian waffles.  

Just skip it. Unless you are a hipster wanting to be seen to be tragically hip, there is no reason to waste the time.

I tried this place this morning and it was a great experience. I ordered an iced Tiff's Waffle Machiatto and it was bombdotcom. Just the right amount of sweetness, just the right amount of milkyness, and just the right amount of ice. The quality of the coffee is legitimate. A+ on the drink.

I also ordered some golden classic Belgium waffles. Finally, I find a place here in Las Vegas with real waffles. Waffles are supposed to consist of a juxtapose balance of crispy exteriors and soft almost custardy interiors. These waffles had that. They were so delightful to eat that I didn't even bother drenching them with maple syrup or butter. 

I would definitely go again for their coffee and 2 nice little Belgium waffles to accompany my delightful coffee. Great job Taibi!
-Ozzy

Visiting Tiabi makes me wish there was one in Arizona! I love the concept here- all things waffle and coffee related. I came in with a suitcase as to make a quick last minute stop for breakfast and get a caffeine fix. The girl at the front was so friendly and welcoming! 

What I had: 

Breakfast Sandwich + well done bacon + extra cheese: 
This was the perfect combination of sweet, fluffy, and savory (and crunchy from the bacon). One thing I was worried about was the waffle being too sweet, but instead it had subtle hints of maple flavoring. Perfect.

Tiff's Waffle Macchiato: A cinnamon vanilla macchiato topped with a churro waffle. A perfect creamy consistency, and the churro waffle adds the perfect touch of crunchiness- if you dip it into the drink. What dreams are made of. 

Whenever I visit Vegas again, I'll definitely be stopping by to say hello again!

Peaceful atmosphere. If you want strong coffee, it's a good place to go. They also make different tea. Chill music. Reminds me of artsy Philadelphia PA vibe. Would be great if they allowed vaping and or made it into a hookah bar.

I have never wanted a local business to succeed more than this one. If you are debating "Is TIABI the right place for me to eat?", I must ask you to consider the following

1. Do you like food? If not, this isn't the right place for you. Actually, you should probably go to the hospital (please see my Yelp! reviews on my favorite hospitals)
2. Do you like food that tastes delicious?
3. Do you like breakfast, lunch, and/or dinner? Do you like smoothies? Do you like coffee?
4. Are you a vegan? If not, are you an omnivore?

If you answered yes to all of those questions, then you will probably love TIABI. Waffles are cooked to a perfect texture that's not so chewy/thick that you want to die halfway through. All of the smoothies are delicious (my personal favorite are the Health Nut and the Avocado, but you do you). Breakfast, lunch, and casual dinner options. Additionally, very extensive vegan menu. Do you have an enemy? Don't tell them about this place. Do you have friends? Do them a solid and meet them there over a Waffle Macchiato and a Break The Fast sandwich.

This place was my favorite a couple of years ago when they first opened and had only one location. Today I had a random craving to get the one drink I sideways get from them, kale champ smoothie. 

Out of all the kale drinks I have tasted and tried theirs was by far the best and I literally had it every other day. Today though, years later, my bf went to pick one up for me. 

When I first saw it my initial reaction was that it looked more green than usual. And then when I tried it, it was definitely NOT the kale champ I knew and loved. It was waaaay too bitter and I felt they left out an ingredient, maybe banana. Had I gone there and ordered it myself and tried it before leaving, I would have asked them to recheck it or add something to it to make it drinkable. I feel it's a waste of money just throwing it out so I'm forcing myself to gulp large amounts of it. I may have to adjust it myself too but it's just disappointing...
The waffles seemed kinda pricey for the size. I had the Viva Las Elvis and it was good but nothing fancy. It was the perfect texture though, crisp but kinda fluffy

If you are looking for a place to eat coffee and waffles that is diverse, takes awhile to order, even longer to get your food and and has very little seating, then this place is for you.  We entered this place at 11:00 and the few tables they have were taken with people playing cards and gossiping.  The people behind the counter do not greet you yet acknowledge you as your standing at the counter waiting to order.  Finally got our food at 11:35 and took it to go because there was nowhere to sit.

The problem with asking for a tip before service -

The food was mediocre, the service was delayed and then when my son asked for a cup for water he was blown off...

When I first walked in, I thought, Crap!. Crap! not again.. Another crappy-overpriced hipster wanna-be "cafe" . . .  chalkboard paint, hand-drawn menu, attractive employees that are smiling. Dammit. I reluctantly ordered the Vegan Waffle-"burger", with a side of peanut sauce, for 6 bucks. For 6 bucks, that's amazingly cheap for Vegas. Ok, then I added the Frankenstein and my friend ordered. A Steel Pulse song came on the overhead, and now, breakfast for two, was under $20. Yes. This, is what is up. Definitely my new go to spot.

Tiabi is a cute little place hidden in a strip mall. Their concept is simple: WAFFLES. They have waffles for everything, with everything. Waffle breakfasts, waffle sandwiches, waffle coffees. We went here in the afternoon when it was slow; no lines and plenty of staff running around. My party ordered three food items and three drinks. The first two waffles came out in about 10 minutes. The third took 30 MORE MINUTES. The first two were done with their meals (and then drinks) before the last waffle came out. There were three staff members basically standing around looking at the waffle makers. No one looked like they were in a hurry to get our food out. There was no apologies or anything as to why the food took 40 minutes after ordering to be prepared. 

The food and drink were good once they were out, but I expect a business, whose sole food item is waffles, to be able to put out items in a reasonable amount of time. I suggest they order an extra waffle maker (or dozen) so this isn't a hamper on their business anymore. I sincerely hope they fix this, for an otherwise fine cafe.

I love the small business feel of this restaurant. Reasonable prices for great food. I almost always order the vegan version of the Viva Las Elvis and it never disappoints. If you're confused on any part of the menu, they will take the time to explain anything to you. No pushy upselling either which is definitely a plus. Be prepared to wait based on the amount of people ahead of you since everything is made to order. However, definitely worth the wait!
Great waffles and coffee. Only complaint is that it is not very noticeable from street. Passed this place a dozen times and never noticed it.

AWE-Mazing!
Gluten free and dairy free waffles with diaya cheese and fresh ingredients!
We had the Thai Basil waffle sandwich and the vegan wafflewich and both were amazing!
We are def coming back for more.
The staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming as well!
Don't miss it!
I've been coming here since they opened almost 4 years ago. Always amazing service. Great food. Favorite place to grab something to eat and talk.

I am not even a Waffle fan but tried this through a groupon while on vacation in Vegas. Their west coast waffle sandwich is amazing. I went back and didn't even bother with their other waffles, which I'm sure are as amazing. They are warm, crispy and amazing. Try their peach green tea also. I wish there was one back home in Indiana, I would be there all the time.

I've seriously lived within 5minutes away from Tiabi for 3 years now and I can't believe I have just barely discovered it! I would always go to the target in the same plaza and Sakana sushi right next to it, so I always saw Tiabi's sign... I just never actually went in until a few weeks ago! Since then I've been addicted and wish I walked in to try it sooner! 
So far I've tried the Break Your Fast, Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich, Tokyo Sandwich, Guru Burger, and the churro waffle as well as the Honey Cream Latter, Lavender Latte, and my favorite yet - the Pistachio latte!! I am seriously addicted. 

Needless to say, customer service is amazing. The staff are all so welcoming and kind. 

As for the food.. The way they make their waffles is so different than I'm used to. They're thinner than typical fluffy waffles, which give their sandwiches the perfect crunch and texture! I assumed the waffle sandwiches would be soggy, but they weren't at all. Also, for the dessert waffles, the waffles have the perfect texture. While the outside is crispy, the inside is still quite fluffy despite how thin it is! Specifically for the churro waffle, the cinnamon sugar was not at all too strong, it was perfect.. Not too sweet and not at all lacking flavor. Also don't be shy about trying out any of their waffle sandwiches, at first I was skeptical because I've never tried a waffle sandwich, but each one I've tried have been really good. Tiabi puts flavors and items that really compliment each other. I don't even know what their Tiabi sauce consists of, but it's a great flavor in many of their items. 
Okay now for the drinks... If I had to single out my ultimate favorite Tiabi menu item I would have to say 100% the PISTACHIO LATTE. Hahaha. The staff must think I'm crazy because I've been coming back so many times for that drink. I get it hot with soy and ahhh it's literally heaven. It's so good that I make any of my friends around me to try it and each one of them were in love too. It's so silky with that perfect flavor of pistachio - seriously spot on pistachio! I have also tried the Lavender Latte and the Honey Cream Latte, which are good as well, but no where near the pistachio latte! Hahah

So by my review I think it's only obvious that I'm in love with this little whole in the wall and would recommend anyone to stop by. Aside from their food and drinks options, the little cafe itself is so adorable!! The decorations are cute and it's so cozy to do homework/study or even hang out with friends. Even though it's a bit small, they actually have plenty of tables/seats and even a cozy couch! Plus each table has a deck of cards and they also offer of board games for people to play as well. Awesome place, great food/drinks, with a lovely staff :)

The Best taste ever I love wallfel





The best Taste ever. I go at least once a week.with a friend the male beacon got to try they when I come in the door I want maple bacon waffle. Try it just the right amount of bacon cooked in it.
Marie Johnson

So don't expect a chain style meal or speed. These are regular people cooking delicious food!  We had the maple bacon Belgium waffle, Nutella waffle nut, caramel macchiato, banaberry smoothie, and the banana Nutella waffle. WOW!

Awesome place, great service, AMAZING food!  If you haven't tried this place, you should.
Food was delicious.. Very nice place with a friendly staff. I'll be back when I'm in town

First time here didn't know what to get so many great options ended up getting the west coast and fiancé got bananatella both great waffles!! The west coast had good flavor. The bananatella was just right not too sweet. The sunrise smoothie was  also a great drink.very refreshing!! Would recommend to anyone looking for great waffles.
This place is the best! They have a very friendly staff and their waffles are on point!! I love their red bull apple cider and their waffle sandwiches!

This was a gem I discovered by accident through a coupon. The staff are friendly. They offer a great selection of waffles and blended coffee. They have plenty of vegan options and also make gluten-free waffles on request. My boss eats gluten free and forgot to mention it, but they switched her waffle out with a gluten free one with a smile. I love the laid back atmosphere and the 70s music!

The waffles taste great and you can find something for almost anyone as long as you like waffles. I can't wait to go back!

I think I may be in heaven. I found this place by luck since I am going to an event at the Clark County Library. When I walked inside, the batista was very friendly. There is so much to eat and choose for, but it's not overwhelming: it makes me want to come back and try more! With this being my first visit, I got the Tiff ' s Waffle Macchiato. Why yes I would love a waffle with my coffee. As I'm writing my review, I'm thinking of ordering more food because I need these speciality waffles (breakfast, lunch, and dessert) in my life.  I just received my drink. First sip and I am in love.
Delicious food, vegan and gluten free friendly. Great service! Try the coconut cooler for a refreshing drink.

Oh my damn! This may be a hidden gem on the east side of lasvegas how did i not know this place extisted i have no clue! I went in with a coworker to get some brunch. We walked in and some nice tunes was on the radio so im already grooving while standing in line and feeling the environment. The cashier was friendly took all my orders quickly there was only two working at the time so we were in no rush. The lay out of restaurant gives a nice mellow vibe has some pretty cool stuff on the walls....now on to the food. Lol

One of my coworkers and i got the Westcoast Wafflewich bannatella waffle maple bacon waffle and a veggie sandwhich peach ice tea redbull cider and tropical tea (i cant remember the whole name)
While we were waiting the family before us had their order come out and their stuff looked amazing! So i became anxious to eat my wafflewhich before i got to the office. Anyways i get back unwrapped it took a bite and a chorus of hallelujah went through my head. It had the right amount of seasoning the waffle itself was nice and fluffy the chicken had seasoning it was just awesome and awesome doesnt even do it justice. 
My friend loved her veggie wafflewhich and the whole office was happy about this place.
Oh and the peach tea was good also.
One thing is that if they could have an option of battered chicken to give a little crunch that would be good!

I gotta say, the online ordering has gone downhill. I order a coffee and a wafflewich and no joke, took 40 minutes. And there were literally zero other customers there. I wanted to grab breakfast before work, guarantee that won't happen again. This was my new regular spot, but when I order and they don't 'grab' my order for 20 minutes? No. I think the only reason they saw my order this time was because I called to see the delay. 

Last time I ordered, they didn't see it until I walked in the door, 30 minutes after I placed it. What's the point?

Food is good I guess, I mean it's waffles. Hard to mess up, right? Coffee is stellar. It's gonna be a while till I come back. If at all.
They are always so uplifted and friendly here! Plus the coffee is good and the walledilla is stellar, my favorite.

I woke up deathly hungry and happened to be nearby Tiabi. I had it bookmarked for a while just was never in the area to try it out for breakfast. IM SO GLAD THAT I STOPPED BY! I ordered the Bacon Breakfast sandwich and it was delicious! (Would highly recommend) Can't wait to come back and try some of the other options.
Side note: Very Cozy & relaxing atmosphere!

Friendly staff and delicious waffles! Had the red velvet waffle and West Coast wafflewhich. Both were delicious. Tender chicken on the west coast and just the right amount of sweetness from the red velvet waffle

Just in town for a visit and discovered this place.... AMAZING!!! They have Vegan and Meat options. Their waffles are 100% Vegan and coffee is locally roasted. 

The churro waffle... I didn't even know that this can be done. We also touched on a few lattes. I recommend the pistachio latte (mind blown) plus everything they have to eat. I will definitely make this a routine every time I'm in town.

Viva Las Elvis! A Belgian Waffle stuffed with peanut butter, topped with bacon and bananas! Sorry, no photo. It did not last very long!

Good coffee and chai. The South American Waffle Sandwich was pretty excellent, too!

My first time here! Coming to get a cup of coffee and waffle before going to wait my lunch at Oyster bar. The staff was super nice!! I had so many requests and she was very patient to listen to me and explain to the barista! Will come back again for sure on my next Vegas trip :) 

Nutella waffle and honey creme latte are recommend!

Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino and wanted to check out a local breakfast eatery and I'm so happy I went off the reviews for Tiabi Coffee & Waffle. There is plenty of seating and it's nicely decorated. We were instantly greeted by the friendly staff and very helpful as to what recommendations in food. My husband ordered the West Coast Wafflewich (waffle folded in half with chicken, Tiabi sauce, bacon, avocado,tomatoe and cheese) and I ordered from the Waffle Bar a Golden Waffle with Thrifty vanilla ice cream, strawberry, powdered sugar and whipped cream. Hands down this has been the most tastiest & creamiest waffle I have ever tasted.   When in town come to Tiabi and check this place out you will not be disappointed.

Average at best, expensive for what you get. The coffee was below average, the guy who was at the register looked stressed and flustered, which really didn't make sense. It took a really long time to get the waffles, which again, didn't make sense as the place wasn't busy and there were 4 people working. Cool concept, poor execution.

I would have given them 5 stars, but I don't know why they have been so slow lately. I LOVE them here. They have great coffee, the waffles are de-lish and they have a plethora of vegan waffles. The wait time is a little excessive though. I come in a lot and every time have waited over 30 minutes for my order! I never complain, but when this is a recurring problem then they should find a solution. I will definitely continue to frequent this place, but be warned that you'll be waiting a long time, so plan accordingly.
Once they get their sign they may be easier to find. The food was Ok.

BOOM!!!  A hidden gem in LV. Great atmosphere and good food. Actually was so good that we came back 3 days in a row. So the food was good, but the coffee. WHOA!!!  They know their coffee. Literally the best coffee I've ever had. Seriously this is worth a visit. 

Good food, GREAT coffee, and really good service. Definitely coming back to this place.

Churro waffles are absolutely genius! If you are in Las Vegas, take a side trip parallel to the Strip on the east side and grab you a churro waffle. This waffle is thin and crispy, generously sprinkled with cinnamon. Add powdered sugar. We got double ice cream. We forgot to redeem our 10 o/o off check-in offer. They kindly honored it after we already paid. Great service and food. This was one of the best things I ate in Las Vegas!

Came here on accident when looking for a place for breakfast. I don't particularly like waffles, so I was out of luck for breakfast options. I tried the coconut iced coffee concoction, and it was pretty good and well priced (compared to the flavored starbucks coffees' prices). The breakfast waffle sandwich I got had eggs, bacon, and cheese on it. It was pretty good, but the waffle batter was kinda bland and wasn't as crispy as I would have expected--but then again, I rarely order waffles. I'm a pancake or crepe or any other breakfast type fan. 
Two drinks (OJ and iced coffee) and two waffle sandwiches were about $20, so I thought it was a little high on the sandwiches for the bland-ness. Maybe the dessert ones are better. The coffee was really good. 
Thought it was weird to ask for a tip on the swipe-payment thing before receiving the food--I left some cash on the table after it was brought out despite paying for the food with a card. I can see how that could be convenient for people without cash on-hand, but I don't like tipping before receiving service. The dining area is really small, but they do offer outdoor seating (in Vegas heat, I'm not sure who'd take them up on that offer this summer, but hey.)

Overall, I like the coffee!
So many vegan options.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Reasonably priced.  Amazing food!

I've only recently started coming here and I love it. The people are wonderful and so is the food. I get the #hashtagbreakfastsandwhich and either the very peachy shaken tea or the Frankenstein expresso. I love this place and not to mention coming in Saturday mornings and hearing live music!
I love this cute little coffee shop. My absolutely favorite drink is the "stiles Java jolt" over ice. The staff is very friendly here! I love having a coffee shop like this one so close to home
Came back the very next day. I will be craving the Guru burger for weeks. This seriously needs to be on a vegan foodie bucket list.

Ordering process takes forever. Spent at least 10 minutes in line with only three parties ahead of me. That being said, waffle macchiato is delicious as was the West coast sandwich. An inexpensive breakfast just barely worth the wait.

We've been coming to Tiabi's since they opened in 2013 and love it!  We bring all of our friends here.  

The waffles are a great small size so I never feel over stuffed.  They are so light and crispy, made hot and fresh to order.  The hashtag is my favorite.  I love their coffee too.  We have never had a bad meal.  I highly recommend this place!

It's kind of hidden back around the corner from Target.

My first time here, been wanting to try this place for quite some time! 
Vegan tiabi waffle w coconut bacon & strawberries was amazing! Tasted perfect. The syrup is just right too, not too sweet or sticky. 
Service was on point.

Came here as a casual meeting with a colleague. It's a small diner type layout with lots of options for waffles and coffee. I liked the décor inside and felt welcomed. I would come here again. 

tl;dr: Simple contemporary style. Eat and go, self-serve.
This place looks so nice and looks like Middle Eastern mixed with a very homely place. Everytime visit I always find ways to plan ahead for another visit
Absolutely love the place . Delicious waffles. And the I ed coffee too. Our favorite place. Make sure to visit

Tiabi Is one of my all-time favorite places in the city to go just to get some quiet time, some really good vegan food for breakfast, coffee and an environment where I can just focus on work that I need to get done. It's good at any point throughout the day because they had something on the menu for breakfast lunch and dinner.

I just ordered coffee here.  I gave it three stars because the coffee was a little weak for my taste. I wanted the coffee with a little kick.  
However, the service was very pleasant.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. 
Again, 3 stars strictly because of weak coffee
Would like to try their food next time.  They have a interesting menu items I would like to taste.

Tiabi is an oasis of calm and deliciousness in the whirlwind of over-priced and under-delivered breakfast joints littering the desert of Las Vegas. I enjoyed the $6 Strawberry Kisses waffles, which struck an impeccable balance between sweet, filling, and light on the palate. A perfect antidote to a night of regret or morning preparation for wandering through the sinful daytime sun, the iced coffee is also refreshing and prepared with care and attentiveness.

Unfortunately, only 1 waffle maker was working when me and my party of 8! came in. I'm sure rolling out one dish at a time is not the norm. Personally, I don't get waffles as sandwich breads. But, everyone else in my party will give this place 4 or 5 stars for the food. Customer service and coffees were on point.

When I could be at school studying, I decided to go to Tiabi's to get a nice breakfast with friends. 

I got the West Coast. It had chicken, bacon, cheese, and avocado. Pretty delicious for breakfast and not too pricy. I do not have any other waffle sandwich locations in mind besides Bruxie, so Tiabi's is convenient since it's down the street from UNLV! 

Service was friendly, but I'd say they're a tad slow, so don't plan on rushing here to eat if you have class or somewhere to be!

I love waffles! I saw this on Yelp and I had to make a visit. It was a cute place. Good atmosphere. I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich, which was good, but it wasn't amazing. It was a waffle sandwich with turkey sausage, egg and cheese served with fruit. Something I could make at home. I also got the "Honey I'm Home" dessert waffle. It was like a churro waffle with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and I loved it! TIABI is good, but not amazing compared to other waffle sandwich places I've visited in California. Their waffles aren't as good quality. Other places are more light, crispy and fresh.

Great coffee spot just a few miles down from the Rio. Easy to get to. Great coffee and waffles. My daughter and I split the Elvis. Service was excellent all the staff was friendly. Not a fake give me your money friendly, a real genuine friendliness. Will have to remember to come back in future Vegas trips.
The food and drinks were very good. The service was just okay. The lady taking orders was not very friendly,  but the people putting the food out were very nice and apologetic for being slow.
Quaint little spot by UNLV, good coffee, enviroment and people; would come again

(Vegan here) I had a lavender latte (sub dark for white chocolate, and almond for dairy milk) and the churro waffle, sans honey, drizzled w syrup, topped w non dairy ice cream and it could not have been better. Friendly service, clean, unique character. Recommend!

The vegan options here are so amazing and are so delicious.  The staff are also extremely friendly.  The food is so tasty that we had to come back before we leave Vegas.  I highly recommend this spot.

Tiabi is a unique and extremely well executed concept See below for Pros and Cons

Pros
From a very quirky minimalist design that makes the very industrial space feel like a cozy coffee shop. 
The Coffee is very good, one of the 5 best coffee shops I've tried in Vegas and I try a new coffee shop almost every Saturday.
The Waffle based food is delicious and unique
The Staff is super friendly
Meeting people in the social collision area of the shop makes meeting new people super easy!

Cons
It's location is kind of hard to find.
It doesn't have enough space to accommodate it's rush
There is no bicycle parking

Overall, everything that Tiabi can control is really really well executed, the things beyond their control they've done a great job of mitigating.

I had an amazing red velvet waffle with chocolate and whipped cream. The West Coast sand which was really nummy and filling. I enjoyed the little shop even though the area isn't located in the best part of Vegas. The coffee was tasty for a non speciality location. I would visit again next time I am in Vegas. Maybe try one of their dessert coffees or a vegan option.

This place was AMAZING. I got the vegan Viva alas Vegas waffle (waffle with PB, banana, agave, and coconut bacon) and my mom got a waffle with fresh fruit. It was all heavenly, and the environment is very laid back as well. The employees were so nice too!!

Totally digged this spot! Great service and yummy menu! I had the waffledilla and pistachio latte with soy milk. Forgot to add on avocado on my waffledilla but it was still yummy! I'll be sure to visit again when I'm in Vegas :)

I am a new resident of Las Vegas. I had a full day of unpacking and purchases to do so I wanted a nice breakfast to start the day. I found TIABI on Yelp as a nearby new breakfast spot and I am very happy I came ! The snicker iced coffee tasted like a sweet treat and the golden waffle was very tasty. I especially liked the portion size, not too much not too little. I will return. Oh and the music was great. Thanks !

As I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering. I found this spot on Groupon. After some confusion about using 3 separate groupons for 1 person, we were able to order. Based on the line behind me, I knew the food should be good. I had the Churronimo which is the vegan waffle with cinnamon sugar and a latte. OMG, I normally don't order cinnamon sugar items but this was so good. This makes me wanna leave Maryland and hike it to Nevada. The "chefs" were friendly and accommodating. My only gripe is that it took a long time to get our food. Other than that, I would go back in a heartbeat.

Came here a while ago and never got the chance to write a review until now. Gabby was really helpful at the cash register, went over the menu with me and my friend since we were first timers. The food was great, but their drinks are definitely overpriced

They are getting exceptionally slow for an order of waffle even when the store is empty. Waited for a total of 35 minutes to get my sandwich. Workers kept on talking and all I get after is "sorry for the wait"

After much procrastination, finally decided to check this place out. It was well worth the wait and is an amazing spot. The atmosphere and decor is absolutely amazing. A very relaxed but nice place to go and enjoy a waffle and coffee. The Recommendations given by one of the employees were perfect. Extremely friendly staff and very polite. The Java Jolt, and Tiff's Waffle Macchiato are very delicious. As well as the West Coast Wafflewich. The price is pretty decent for the quality. Definitley will be back again soon!

Disappointing. We ventured outside of the strip to try something different. In the mood for waffles so we tried this place based only on the good yelp reviews. It's only 3 miles from the strip but it's located in a very ghetto area, very seedy, didn't feel clean or safe. The waffle place was ok, low end diner. Food was average, nothing special. I don't think it's worth the drive outside of the main strip.

Let's start it off by saying this: I friggin love waffles. I dream about soft waffles. I love waffles, I love strawberries, I love tea, juices, sandwiches, quesadillas... so I was REALLY looking forward to this place. We came in and we ordered the strawberry kisses and the west coast. Get a taste of sweet and savory. We also got the snickers coffee and some juice that was seasonal. 
I'll start by saying I liked the snickers thing. But then I have to move into the bad part. 
They seem to use the same waffle mix for their sweet and savory waffles. What does this mean? It means my breakfast was too savory and my lunch was too sweet. And I was very bummed. I swear, I wanted to like it. I might even try it again some day, in hope of a good wafflewich. But it fell short. The strawberries on top helped amp up the breakfast, but the lunch could not be saved. So be it. We had a great time at SeaQuest afterwards, but I'll keep dreaming of the perfect waffle and hope Tiabi can make it in the future. Still rooting for you, but can't justify more than 2 stars for now.

The waffle sandwhiches are amazing. Very light but still filling and very fresh. Staff is extremely friendly and it has a very comfortable atmosphere with comfy couches, as well as tables and chairs. And wifi ;)

Tiabi is great for a lighter version of Belgian waffle plates! It's located next to Target and there's a huge parking lot. I was a little hesitant to order the Bananatella because I thought it was going to be one of those heavy hitters that would make you feel overly full, bloated, and that it would be like having dessert instead of breakfast, but it was just perfect! The waffle was light, warm, toasty, and cleanly presented. For me, the dish was a good amount of sweetness topped with banana, almonds, and whipped cream. It definitely filled me up but if you're coming in famished, you should probably check out the savory wafflewiches. The woman taking our order was super friendly and was more than welcome to give us suggestions. I can definitely see this place being popular with UNLV students because there's a couch closer to the front of the store, free wi-fi, and random decks of cards at the tables but since it's the summer right now the place wasn't crowded. I'll probably have to come back and try some of the other items on the menu!

Thank you Tiabi, 
I had such a great time with my friends and I. The ice coffee was awesome. The waffle was awesome. I got the breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage and added avpcado and it was delicious. 
I'm definitely coming back here again and I recommend people trying this place. It's not too expensive like other breakfast cars. The pricing is very fair.

Sampled the southwest waffle sandwich and while I enjoyed the combination of ingredients I felt that the waffle itself was satisfactory. The waffle was not as crispy as I liked it and almost a little under cooked. The interior of the cafe was cute and I felt that it would be a cool place for friends to hang out.

Words cannot describe this place the staff is amazing and the waffles are to die for ( taste them before you put syrup on it ) I had the butter pecan and my son had the banana tella both were amazing and we were glad we didn't put syrup on them because they were loaded with flavor from the first bite to the last
Yummmmmmmmmm!  I cannot get enough of this place!  The kale waffle salad is our favorite!  We split that with the Californian sandwich!
Great vibs owners are sweet def luv the reggae music waffles are ahhhmazing  overall best breakfast spot off the strip!! :D
Amazing! Once you enter it smells like waffles and I am in looove with the smell of waffles. I had the iced tea with hibiscus  definitely a refresher

I recently found this cute little place by the UNLV. They served waffles and coffee. I love the decor here, comic books around the wall supporting local comic enthusiast. Chic, clean and smells coffee throughout. 

When you walked in, you will see the huge menu in the wall. The menu was simple and inviting. I decided to try the sweet waffle today: banana nutella and pistachio coffee. The waffle took a while to be ready but hey, it tasted soooo good so it was worth the wait. Waffle was crispy, light and gluten free! What's not to love. Pistachio coffee was also perfect, I tasted the delicious coffee, pretty strong coffee, it smelled really good too. To be noted, they support local coffee, good to know. 

I am so glad to find this place and will be back again to try their other waffles!
Love this place! Their customer service is great.. their waffles are delish and I had the waffle machiatto and it was perfect! Very well priced too. Will come here again!
Absolutely unbelievably delicious. Can't imagine not coming here. Bless your taste buds and come here!!

Amazing. Underrated. Up n coming. A north Vegas hidden gem. 1st time here and I'll be back for sure, with more people. Atmosphere is dope with the pairings and card games to play while waiting. I'm a fan.

Tiabi is on the Maryland Parkway side of the Target shopping center. Right now they have a tarp sign that says something to the effect of "Coffee and Waffles" instead of their name.

Although there is a chalkboard menu on the wall grab a menu to get the full details of the items. Order your food at the counter. Ordering was slow when I went, but hopefully will get better with time. Then find your own seat. I would recommend ordering 2 wafflewiches since they do not come with sides (besides chips) or adding items to your sandwich to make it bigger. They are petit. Here's what we ordered:

Break the Fast Wafflewich- The actual waffle is delicious. I like that it's a little sweet. It's also a harmonious texture combo- sturdy and moist. Inside were scrambled eggs, thin bacon, and cheese. The items inside were sparse and the bacon was the thin kind. The price is right (about $5), but I would gladly pay more for a fuller sandwich. I think next time I will ask for extra eggs and maybe avocado on the side.

B.A.T Wafflewich- Same great waffle housing bacon, arugula, tomato, and a delicious sauce. We also wished this sandwich was fuller. The tomatoes were great. I bet this one would be great with avocado.

Regular Coffee- I drink mine black. This coffee was a-ok and came in a to go cup.

Iced Americano- Also a-ok and definitely caffeinated.

I'll definitely be back now that I have a better idea of what to order. Businesses in this area need our support so give Tiabi a try.
Very helpful staff and this place is vegan friendly.  Cute spot to check out.  It's nice to have restaurant options for plant based diners.

Delicious wafflewich!!! Yanel and Jay are very sweet and were really accommodating with our custom orders, they provided us suggestions to make it more yummy by adding more toppings! We tried the guru burger/wafflewich with Tiabi sauce and extra avocado and the breakfast wafflewich. If you are vegan/vegetarian then this is for you :) we are surely coming back.

We have been trying all coffee shops around town - Sambalatte, Dutch Bros, Grouchy Johns etc and this place is for sure one of my faves now! I also ordered the West Coast waffle sandwich and it was fantastic! The waffle was so savory and made the sandwich so delicious! It's unfortunate only two people were working so the wait was a little long but it was so worth it! I'm looking forward to trying all the waffles here!
This is the place to do it... So Delicious with allot of flavor. 100% recommended. Atmosphere is Good and clean Environment.

Only had a blended mocha frappe so far. It was really good and I was really happy that the girl who helped me was willing to use their Ghirardelli Chocolate that they use for baking instead of their normal mocha sauce. It was 10x better and the blend is really smooth

We ordered Elvis waffle without any meat, bananatella, a regular coffee and a caramel
Macchiato. Waffles were good, not great - not super sweet but just right! The coffee was not great but their caramel macchiato was delicious!
Probably best waffles in Vegas.Waffles are so soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. The cinnamon churro waffle s really something special.

Bookmarked. Just wish I lived closer, then I'd be here more often. The Twilight Lavender & Pistachio lattes are my fave. West Coast Wafflewich is bomb. Customer service is always great, never been disappointed.

Awesome coffee shop with great drinks! Had the Red Velvet Latte and Pumpkin Pie Cream frappucino. The Red Velvet Latte exceeded my expectations and the Pumpkin Pie Cream Frappucino was good but not as good as the other drink. It was a little too thick for my liking and tasted more like a milkshake. It was still very good though. I'd come back here if I felt like getting something with coffee but don't want to go to a chain coffee shop.
Amazing vegan options! Had the vegan churro waffle with bananas, chocolate chips, and vegan bacon, definitely recommend.

Only based on the Tiffs Waffle Macchiato this Coffee is Delicious. I kinda want to drop a few stars for the wait because this wait is ridiculous. 40-50min wait for a coffee & breakfast waffle sandwich  Constructive criticism "Hire More Staff ASAP", get people's drinks out before the waffle, keep it moving people! This wait is not worth coming back. I don't care how delicious it is.. your going to keep losing business if you can't get it together. I'm out

I found this place on Groupon and had to stop by after reading the yelp reviews. The shop itself was not very busy at the time, so it gave us some time to chat with the owners. They were super friendly and gave us recommendations on all their yummy waffles. I ordered the red velvet waffle, nutella wafflenut, and a Hey! Arnold. I loved everything, but the Hey! Arnold which is just an Arnold Palmer (cute name though!). My boyfriend ordered the Amaretto Power which was really good! We had a nice breakfast together & definitely recommend!
I'm a sucker for a lavender latte, think it would have been even better with an extra shot of espresso tho.

Met up with a group of friends on a Saturday morning around 11 am. The place was packed and it is a little on the small side. We were lucky to get a table by the front door. The menu is impressive with a lot of options. You can have breakfast or lunch, I opted for breakfast. I had the Viva Las Elvis waffle (peanut butter, bacon, bananas, and honey) and it was pretty good although I could of done without the bananas and I added maple syrup. Others in the group seemed to enjoy their meals.
Due to the small size of the place and how popular it seems I did notice that there were several people who came in but left because of the lack of seats.
I am not sure if I would come back again just because of the location. It is a little farther than I would drive just to have a waffle but if I was in the area I would go back.

I'm surprised I even have a photo to attach. This waffle was so good, I finished it before my friend who referred this place could even ask how it was! Great selection and absolutely delicious. I also had one of their specialty drinks, a snickers iced coffee and it was amazing. A lot of sugar for the day but totally worth it. Decent parking and very affordable and quiet place.

My husband and I have passed by this place quite a few times and finally got a chance to stop by today.  I can honestly say I'm kicking myself for not coming in sooner. There are certainly some odd menu items, like the lavender latte, but there are also some breakfast staples like a mocha or basic waffle.  I had the bacon waffle and a honey cream latte and my husband had the breakfast sandwich and a mocha.  The bacon waffle was absolutely amazing.  Just the right amount of bacon.  The waffle was crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside and not at all greasy like some bacon waffles. The lattes were both very tasty. Only complaint from my husband was that the waffle  sandwich was a little dry.  So maybe order it with butter. All in all great little spot with a small outside seating area.  We will definitely be returning.

Just tried this place for the first time after seeing such good reviews! It definitely lives up to the hype. Very nice and relaxing environment once you come in with super friendly staff. Very classic spot and definitely worth trying out the wafflewiches!

Cute little place that has great tasting waffles. I ordered a double belgian waffle with vegan butter and a large iced coffee. The waffle had the perfect crunch and the right doughy center. I really like the fact that they offer vegan/vegetarian options. The vegan waffle with bananas and pecans is great.  I wish the service didn't take so long though. The two girls behind the counter are sweet but I don't think their business can handle a rush if need be.

Love the place!! Perfect Vegan Waffle bar, an amazing coffee, one of the best I've ever had (And I'm a coffee snob..), very decent prices and lovely atmosphere and service. 
One of my MUST visit places each time I'm in Vegas.
Great customer service! Their Tiff Macchiato waffle really hits the spot on a chilly day...heck any day!

This is one of my favorite breakfast/lunch places! It is conveniently located near UNLV so it's also a great place to go between classes. They have lots of options for vegans too so I definitely appreciate that. Delicious!

I thoroughly enjoyed my waffle sandwhich and drink! I had the west coast wafflewhich (the tiabi sauce was AMAZING) and I had the strawberry sunrise smoothie. After I had those two I felt energized and ready to take on my 3 hour drive! This was a great place to stop and eat! My husband had the hashtag breakfast sandwich and kale champ smoothie. We both agreed my drink and sandwich were better but his was good too. You definitely have to smother the hashtag breakfast sandwich with maple syrup! YUM!

Thank you so much for Vegan options! I was able to bring 5 friends with me and everyone could find something they liked instead of having to eat at separate restaurants (which is important because we are on vacation here in Vegas!). The food was so good! And it's the perfect brunch spot!
Love Tiabi.  They have the best waffles and coffee drinks. Really nice staff too.  Come here once a week.

The place has a really nice vibe to it. Very laid back, but the wait was a little too long. My girlfriend and I waited for at least 20 minutes for two sandwiches and a shake. The sandwiches and their prices were good, but they weren't that very filling for a person who is hungry. I'd like to come back here, but maybe on a slow day or when I'm not in a rush.
Great food and awesome service! Staff and environment are very welcoming and friendly. The Velvet latte is delicious!
Ordered skinny pistachio latte, it was so good with the waffle on top , a small joint .  The pictures looked lot fancier than the actual place tho.
Great tasting, beautiful presentation. Bananatella and strawberry kisses.  Definitely coming back.

I do like this place, but I docked another star because of a recent time I came in, and it was not too busy (there were three customers sitting down at two different tables) and me standing at the register. It took almost a few minutes before someone even acknowledged me, although the girl who finally took my order was apologetic. Also, today we came in and were told we couldn't order food because of a catering order they have. I do love the honey cream latte and waffle sandwiches, and the owner is really nice.

We have been making it a point to visit here every single time we visit Las Vegas since the place opened. And this trip we decided to check out their newest location in North Las Vegas and it did not disappoint. Although it is just a bit smaller than their number one location it is still a friendly clean comfortable place with fantastic food and excellent service. This will always be our family's favorite place to go together.
Eat breakfast here with the wife a couple times a month.  If you want a sweet treat get a Tiffs waffle macchiato.  It's got a churro waffle wedge on top.

Best Waffle House in Las Vegas! Incredible creations and unbelievable tasting waffles. I am so glad I came here for breakfast! Think I'll return for lunch with my daughter and try a waffle sandwich! And I must try the waffle macchiato which I regret not ordering after I saw one served up!

I love the service and I especially love their churro waffle I usually add in some of their ice cream. I've tried their sandwiches and plenty of their deserts my second best would have to be their strawberry and kisses if I'm not mistaken. I can't wait to go again and order that churro waffle.

I was surprised to see that such a highly rated Yelp restaurant was offering a deal on LivingSocial. I knew I just had to get it and try the place out.

I ordered the Mixed Berry Chicken Salad. It came with two yummy waffles. The salad itself was fresh, lots of fruits and chicken to fill you up. The waffles itself reminded me of the HK egg waffle taste, except not as sweet.

For my drink I ordered a Dirty Mocha Chai. It came in a cute mason jar cup. I could mostly taste the mocha but not so much the chai. It was a good drink but don't think I will get it again.

Can't wait to come back and try some of their waffle desserts!

When I entered, no one greeted me. There were at least 5 people on the floor. I looked at the menu for 3 or so minutes when someone finally said they'll be right with me. I ordered their waffle macchiato because it sounded delicious. It's supposed to have a cinnamon sugar waffle garnish.

It took a while to make the drink which it fine. It's hand crafted, blah blah blah, but then he handed it to me without the waffle and he said, "the waffle will be right out. I just don't want the espresso to expire."   why not give me the full effect and make it correctly? Why not wait until the waffle is ready? The lack of urgency and receiving a deconstructed version of what I ordered - killed it for me. 

The drink wasn't bad, not great, but not bad & the customer service needs some help.

OK, this is a lengthy review.  here's a summary:  The wait is FOREVER.  If you're disabled or in a hurry, skip it.  If you're fully-abled with plenty of time on your hands, Tiabi is probably worth the wait.

Now for the actual review:

This place is very popular - there wasn't an empty seat in the house.  This is a problem for me as I'm disabled.  I was feeling halfway decent today and decided to take my daughter out for a (long overdue) mommy/daughter date, since I don't get to do that very often.

We went inside and stared at the menu for a few minutes.  It's big and on the wall near the front of the store, which is convenient.  After deciding what we wanted, I walked around to find the area for placing an order.  There are 3 sections where the counter is open, so they all appear to be there for communicating with the people behind the counter.  After examining the other items at the counter (there's stuff everywhere), however, it wasn't obvious where to stand to place an order.  One of the staff members saw the lost look on my face and directed me to the right place.  Once there I noticed an ipad on the counter which I assume they use to take orders.

We moved to the appropriate counter spot (which is at the front of the store, by the menu), and then waited to be helped.  I was able to wait for 10 minutes, but that's when my back issues kicked in.  In that time, we were given an apology, but no other eye contact or acknowledgement.  I got the impression that they were overwhelmed and didn't WANT to take anymore orders.  I've worked in retail and food service, so I know how that that is.  It was probably a blessing that they didn't take my order, as I wouldn't have been capable of standing around much longer to wait for the food.

In their defense, all 3 employees were shuffling around and working very hard.  The place was just seriously understaffed.  They could've used AT LEAST 2 more people today.  Since my back issues don't allow me to stand for extended periods of time, I hate to say that I won't be able to return to this establishment.  For anyone in the same boat - having limited physical abilities - I'd suggest ordering Tiabi for delivery if you live close enough, or just try a different waffle bar.  The one at Tivoli has plenty of seating and wasn't busy when I went.
