I was very disappointed.  My young daughter was VERY excited to try some new and desserty waffles.  It kills me to get that far into the process, only to break her heart and go somewhere else.  It also sucks because I'm usually in too much pain (or too medicated) to even leave the house.  So when I do leave the house, every minute counts and is very special to me.  Don't take your good health for granted!!!!!!!!

Not entirely related, but worth noting:  Across the street from Tiabi, the wash runs between Toys R Us and Seafood City.  This part of the wash spawns a lot of water pokemon, which are hard to find elsewhere in the desert.

I kinda wish I could leave a review without giving a star rating.  Although I couldn't try the food, it's obviously good.  They wouldn't have been that busy if they weren't doing something right.  I just REALLY REALLY REALLY wish the owners would staff it better, or maybe expand or something.  We aren't all fully-abled college students with the ability to wait around all day.  I also want to mention that I'm NOT the type of person who expects everyone to cater to ME and my specific needs.  My belief - no matter what side of the counter I'm on - is that if your customers are important to you, you don't make them wait more than 2 minutes to be rung up.

First time coming here, let me tell you I'm freaking in love. This place is waaayy underrated & so cheap. I love the atmosphere, the guy who took our order was helpful & very welcoming. I'll for sure be coming back on my next day off! I wish there were more of these than Starbucks or Dunkins.  I love Tiabi

Great place for waffles and coffee
Definitely have to go with the waffledilla
Yummy flavor
Convenient location
Got the iced coffee

This place makes me miss my vacation to Las Vegas so much....the food is beyond amazing and the pricing is reasonable.

The smoothies are absolutely delightful and has really gotten me to eat healthier by making me crave their smoothies all the time and finding the need to learn to make it myself in order to satisfy that craving.

The waffles are so good, both sweet and salty. However, I think I might be more hooked on the salty waffle sandwiches. Its a bit sweet from the waffle itself but overall it is just warm and had a nice balance of fluffy and chewy.

We were on vacation and stopped in since we saw a groupon and we were glad we did! I got the banana Nutella and upgraded it to a Belgium and it was super yummy! My husband got the break the fast which was also really good. I got the red velvet drink and my husband got the pumpkin pie spice drink and both were good. We went around 1 on a Saturday and there wasn't many others in the restaurant, but the service was friendly and helpful and the food was fresh

I used to work around that area and I hated going to fast food restaurants, that's obviously not healthy for us. Thank God I found this place. It is so delicious. I loved going there. Too bad I do not live around there and always wanted to go to their location in Nlv but never had a chance.  
-they are super friendly! 
-fresh ingredients!!!!!
-different 
-LOVE the atmosphere, it is super relaxing. 
-local business 
-Just perfect!

Delicious! Wish they had a location in or near spring valley. The wait time is a bit long, however I understand due to amount of people eating or ordering. Very happy with this waffle house. 4 stars only because pricing is a bit higher than we'd like as well as distance.

I had a groupon so I kinda went all out.  I ordered the Country Chick Sandwich with avacado, chips and a green tea, a chicadilla, the cinnamon sugar waffles, and the wafflenut with Nutella and almonds-- OMG I'm full!  This place is pretty awesome.  Definitely not a dieting place though lol... Their waffles have got to be one of the best I've tried.  Served up fresh and warm, the waffles are nice and crisp on the outside, and chewy on the inside.  Loved it.  

It's located on the corner of Flamingo and Maryland in the Target complex.  Really chill environment.  Great for breakfast or lunch, or maybe a snack or dessert.  There were 2 girls behind the counter cooking and taking orders.  Super friendly staff.  I think they have wifi, because a lot of college students look like they were meeting to get work done.  

Definitely enjoyed this place.  I just wish it was closer to my house!

Love the pistachio latte and waffledilla. The staff is great. I always feel welcome. My 8 month old loves everything she's tried. 

There's always people having meetings in here. Really a great place to catch up with friends, people watch a little, and waste some time.
Just passing by and stop to have branch here. Great place with good prices. Polite and nice waiters. Highly recommended!

What a cute little place! The word TIABI stands for to inspire and be inspired. I love this place for so many reasons. They have fresh juice smoothies, vegan options and WAFFLES! Yes I am conscious about being healthy but I do have a sweet tooth and this place gives me both! Plus the owners and workers are super nice which makes me want to come and hang out more often. 

My favorites:
Peanut butter banana smoothie
Vegan Belgian waffles with the toppings of your choice! 
Vegan kale chocolate chip ccookies!

This place is still pretty new so I can tell they are adding and changing the menu due to demand.. Love it! 
They have everything non-vegan as well so you can enjoy the place with vegans and non-vegans ;)

I bought the Groupon and was not ever disappointed with any of the waffle choices and even the sandwich was delicious. The coconut with basil was very refreshing and the staff was very nice. I have already taken two friends and will continue to recommend.

First time trying out this place and it was amazing!! I got the bananatella waffles and the strawberry sunrise smoothie (I believe it was called). It honestly tasted like heaven. The wait was about 15-20minutes long but it was worth the wait!! Also, the environment is so peaceful like and super cute. I totally recommend trying this place out, especially if you're looking for a place to chill, study while having coffee or simply to have some good tasty snack like food!!

Super enthusiastic & excitable staff.  They were excited to know that we're local (I'm British so easy to assume I'm a tourist.)  Completely sold us on the Vegan Choc Chip Cookies and even brought out a free sample before we dove in. The people working there today are a real credit to the shop and the owners should be proud to have such devoted staff.

Onto the food, we got the Guru Burger on Ciabatta & Vegas Wafflewich.  It was amazing, enough said.

Verdict: We'll be back....
Fluffy,  crunchy and delicious.  Breakfast,  lunch and snacks .. Coffee and smoothie specials. Island reggae music playing in the backyard.  Wonderful service,  and friendly staff

Very small Hipster cafe in the middle of a busy street and plaza feels very downtown inside with the art on the wall and parking the chalk board menu the whole set up ..:.i had the pistachio latte hot (gave it to me kind of cold ) but it was delish not too sweet. 
Waffle Wednesday !!!! It's BOGO day on their Classic waffles so yea I took advantage of the deal ! 
The Waffles were big but not thick (good because I wanted a morning snack not too many calories lol ) 
#1 waffle =Butter Pecan omg omg omg still making my mouth water a bit . 
#2 waffle : strawberry with chocolate drizzle and whip cream also very good but man that butter pecan !!!

Staff was very nice. Food was mediocre. My sister ordered a drink hot, they made it iced. Not a huge variety of hot tea, kind of bummed that they serve "Stash" brand. Really wish they had something unique or leafs in tea pot. Maybe would go back, but maybe not. Was really hoping for more.

I live 6 minutes away from this place and I just happened to run into this place. When we first entered, we were instantly greeted. The guy at the the register asked if it was our first time, and it was. So he gave us a few minutes to decide, we asked a few questions and he recommended us a few things off the menu. After we ordered, the food took no longer than 10 mins for everything to come. Plus free wifi (can't say no to that lol). The food was great, enviornment was great and the staff is great. I will definitely come back here and try the other drinks and food. I highly recommend this place.

I absolutely love the waffles here.  I've tried the Belgian waffle Kisses and my sister's classic waffle banana nutella.  They're both so delicious!  My sister and I can't get enough of their waffles.  Their coffees are good quality too.  Usually, I don't expect much in regards to the quality of coffee.  However, every drink we've ordered is made fresh from their espresso machine, so no acidic after taste here.  Their customer is always excellent!  Very friendly and nice!

Definitely recommended!

Had an awesome waffle for breakfast. The maple and bacon. Not a very thick waffle but it was delicious and I was satisfied. Friend of mine had the Elvis one with peanut butter bacon and bananas. Loved it as well. a great find!!!
Jay gave us much needed guidance through their awesome looking menu (too many good choices). Stoked for this waffledia lunch combo, pecan butter waffle, ube oreo ice cream.

Love this place! I found it via Yelp and went to grab breakfast for a large group. The java jolt coffee was very smooth, but on the light side. I also ordered a few breakfast waffles with turkey sausage as well as bacon, and the zombie red velvet waffle with bacon and chocolate sauce. Everything was very good! I thought the zombie red velvet waffle was missing bacon, but they put a thin slice inside the waffle pocket. While waiting for the food to be prepped, I wanted to order another coffee, but didn't. The owners are very friendly as well. Definitely check this spot out!

I visited this place for the first time last week and will definitely be coming back.  I ordered a large Tiff's Waffle Macchiato.  Compared to other coffee shops, the menu at Tiabi is reasonably priced.  My large macchiato was $4.75, and it came with a churro waffle. The macchiato was delicious and had a prominent coffee flavor while also tasting sweet from the caramel and vanilla.  I wish the churro waffle contained more cinammon sugar just like an actual churro, but it was still good.

I loved how there were playing cards at the sit down tables, and my friend and I ended up staying way longer than we expected from playing a game of cards.

WAFFLES + AMAZING STAFF = Why are you not here already? Selene (sp?) was terrific... She has great energy and was very friendly along with the rest of the staff! Customer service is very important to me and they nailed it. 

The texture of the waffles was so so perfect. Soft on the inside with a slight crunch on the outside. I ordered the hashtag and was pretty sad when there was no more left after I engulfed it all. The ambiance was also nice- upbeat music and fun art on the walls.

Definitely an excellent choice for a cheat meal or any day!

Found this place on yelp and decided to try it out since it appears to be the only breakfast place on yelp that's not on the strip. Causal vibe, friendly staff, delicious waffles and their pistachio latte is delicious! If you are in the mood for waffles, this might be the place for you. Pictures of waffles to come later!

Great experience. The staff, Tiffany & Yanel in particular, were super helpful in helping my family and I order since it was our first time. They answered our questions and explained the menu to each of us. Will definitely return and recommend to others.
This place is yummylicious! I would recommend this place!  My daughter loved her pumpkin churro waffle and we enjoyed the west coast waffle sandwich!

Tiabi Coffee & Waffle is a hole in the wall venue that I am glad I got to visit during my short stay in Nevada. My family and I make a semi annual trip from CA every year...and we usually always settle for the renowned hotel buffets. This time however I decided to change that, and we stumbled on this location for breakfast.

I was fascinated with the originality of their menu, especially with waffles. Savory or sweet...many different options were available to satisfy. I appreciated that this restaurant was vegan friendly for my own personal choice. But my family loved it as well. Although a little pricey, the food we ordered  was indeed very filling and delicious. Anticipate an average wait time as they make the vegan waffles by scratch. 

The restaurant itself had a very welcoming cafe environment. And the employees were kind. 

I highly recommend the visit and the try the Waffledilla and the Twilight Lavender Latte! Heaven!

The atmosphere was perfect! It was just the right amount of cozy and chill, and the noise level was just right. The brew of the day was Guatemalan which I loved because I could drink it black. It wasn't too bitter and I felt it was sweeter then most other beans. I had the hashtag breakfast which was tasty. The waffle had a good balance of softness and crunchy. I also had a side of chips which I believe were barbecue flavor and it was way better than the Lay's ones. 10/10 would want to come here again to try their other items like the normal waffles or the dessert waffle taco.
This place an absolute delight. Staff was friendly and food was delicious. Had the bananutella waffle and a coconut truffle iced coffee. Will be going again!!

It has a very unusual menu...My husband and I are seniors and this is in a UNLV neighborhood by Target so we are not their usual clientele.  But, if they come to Henderson I am there.  They have waffles for every kind of meal from breakfast to dinner.  I had the bacon waffle and my husband had the Western waffle (chicken bacon avocado etc) and their coffee is excellent and he had lemon ginger tea.  Kids would love that place.  The only thing that keeps us from giving it the 5th star is that it is too small and the tables and chairs are not that comfortable and really no décor...so you are there primarily for their menu and they don't let you down there.  

PS...if you order something that requires butter, have them butter it.  Those little butter things are a bugger to open and they said they don't mind pre buttering for you.

I came here for a meet up with friends and hour both a waffle sandwich and a desert waffle. The sandwich (cali one) was tasty as can be. It had a great chipotle style sauce. It truly stole the show. However, my desert waffle (kisses)looked 10 times better than it tasted. The waffle was way too crunchy. 

Needless to say, my overall experience was fantastic. I had very little wait time to receive my food. The staff was nice and always smiling. The place was clean, cute, and comfortable. It really wasnt with complaining about the overcooked waffle because at that point I was pretty full. To full to eat a perfect one.

Definitely go check this place out if you are a Lesley Knope!

I found this place on yelp while I was sitting in the car and wanted something sweet .... 

It's in the shopping center with the target on the side 

The ladies working were very friendly and nice took my order right away I ordered the kisses waffle and the snickers coffee both were yummy :) I would come back to try out other items they have breakfast waffles as well if you don't want something sweet you are in luck don't worry
Love the food, drinks, and service! Tiff's waffle Macchiato is a must every time I am in town! We brought the kids out today and they loved it too! #vivalaselvis

This is a great coffee and waffles cafe if you want something unique and delicious. I've tried almost every coffee and they're all good but the Twilight Lavender and Pistachio are my personal favorites. Prices are lower than any other place I've been and the employees are really nice.

Great food! I got the strawberry and chocolate waffle. I also tried to lemonade which has a slushie in it. People were nice.


Only downside was all the silverware out for customers to use was dirty. We had to request take out silverware as a result .
Super dank peach green tea! The cold brew is also dank. Didn't try a waffle but they looked good!

I like coming here in during the week in the mornings because it's chill. The owners are cool and the food/drinks here are great! 

This past weekend, I took my cousin who was visiting from So Cal to try out the food/coffee. It was my first time seeing the other workers at the shop..

I was shocked to experience a customer having to clean a table for her and her family  when it clearly is not a customer's job to do so. The customer asked a worker for a wet rag so she can wipe down a table that had not been cleaned and still had dishes from the last customer who sat there. Four stars because the worker actually handed her a wet rag. Wtf who does that? 

Then, not too long after that, I experience an angry customer storm out because nobody was at the cash register taking orders. C'mon guys, get it together.
I LOVE Tiabi! I'm vegan so whenever I visit Las Vegas my options are very limited. Luckily Tiabi is so veg-friendly! Their waffles are great, the staff is friendly, five stars all the way!

Went here for the first time the other day before class and it was a little hard to find at first, but the atmosphere is great and the chocolate coconut iced latter was wonderful! I didn't get a chance to have a waffle but they smelled great. Wifi is secure which is nice, but a little loud if you're trying to study

We decided to go off the strip for breakfast this morning and I was looking for a good vegan fare. We stumbled upon this restaurant. It was great! Great service and even better food. They did take a little while to cook but their waffles are 100% vegan. One of the servers forgot my side of chips but besides that everything was great!   Next time in Vegas,  we'll be back!
Great waffle sandwiches.  Great prices.  Nice place to hang out in Vegas that ISN'T a Starbucks.
Nice clean restaurant, easy parking, delicious menu of waffles, waffle sandwiches, and coffee! Employees are very nice too!
The waffledilla wasn't worth the money. Coffee was meh. Seating is not great. But it wasn't awful.

Pretty decent food, but the drinks are awesome. A good selection and all made with the best ingredients and care. The waffles are, just OK. Nothing spectacular, but OK. The chips, meh. I let them be... not really worth it. We tried a couple of things. The Viva Las Elvis was good, but another meh. I loved getting off the strip and trying something a little more local, but with all of the options in Vegas... this just doesn't quite cut it. Go if you want a good Chai Tea or Smoothie. The staff is definitely friendly, but I wouldn't recommend it for a meal.
So I got myself the waffldella.  Who was the first time there surprise my wife was a red velvet waffle
It's sooo good that I can find a place have such special coffee I never try waffle with avocado before it's amazing!

This is a great little coffee shop near my house. In a really great area with great music and a great atmosphere. Interesting food options as most of it includes waffles as a burger or sandwich or an open faced waffle. I love that they offer student discounts and discounts for checking in on Yelp on top of that. If you write the review you got a free iced coffee or iced tea. Also have really great vegan smoothies with protein and nice coffee drinks.
Waffles are good, would've liked a side but they only give a circle of egg which looks like it was supposed to be on a sandwich..

When I went the second time things were missing on my to go order. I spoke to someone one the phone and she told me she would take care of the next time I went. Then when I went back I told the snobby girl about my things that were missing, and she says well that's a lot of things for you to forget, well I'm not the one making the food to go and bagging it so that was not my problem, so she acts like I'm begging her for a cookie, chips, and the waffle side that comes with the tiffs coffee. I tell her to forget about it, then she tells me it'll take 30 min for my order to be ready so I told her never mind and she has the nerve to give a 10% off for a future purchase which to me it was a joke.  I was not asking for a discount I just wanted the items I had paid for that were not in the bag. The customer service was very poor, how is it my fault things are not in my bag when I'm not the one behind the counter, you have the technology to keep track of orders and is not being used. I would never step a foot here again and waste my time.

We came here as an alternative to the constant rape and pillaging that we felt the hotels were offering and what a great option.  They make the waffles fresh and the coffees were great!  Came here twice for breakfast during our four day stay.  Tried the snicker iced coffee and pistachio latte.  Snickers ice coffee is the way to go.  Then we had the Viva la elvis, west coast, thai basil, and banana nutella.  All were good but I did think the viva elvis was very unique since they had bacon, banana, and peanut butter together on the waffle.  This place is in the Target shopping center at the corner of Maryland and Flamingo.  It has weird entrances to the mall but as long as you head for target you will this place around the corner.

Solid food - interesting menu and concept with traditional waffles, sweet and savory waffles, waffle sandwiches and all things waffle.  Quality of food is very high with very good quality ingredients, and super friendly staff.  UNLV location and staff/ownership with UNLV connections is a major plus - they appear very committed to UNLV and the general community.  Great to see good quality, creative and fun places like Tiabi develop in this neighborhood, which benefits from this type of energy and creativity.  Highly recommended.

If you are coming for Belgium style DON'T they stop serving them over a month ago due to taking too long to cook according to the staff. 

My wife LOVES breakfast so I found this place for her. The atmosphere on a weekday morning is quiet and empty but I hear on the weekends it is a madhouse. 

We shared everything today. We started with a maple bacon waffle. I really liked it but my wife said it tasted like an eggo waffle. 

We both had a west coast sandwich despite it being "breakfast". Both really good. Warm waffle as the bread and creamy avocado with bacon and chicken unside-Yum!

We also both had coffee. I had a honey cream iced latte- awesome! My wife had a regular latte with sugar free caramel-also awesome! There coffee is amazing. No bitterness in our milk drinks for sure. 

Overall we loved this place. Great coffee and pretty decent food. Me: 5/5. Wife:4/5. I round down. 

We will be returning for sure!

Btw it is counter service but it was friendly and quick.

Love coming here for their churro waffle! . Always put some sort of drizzle with whipped cream! . Incredible. And it's a good place to have breakfast with friends or significant other. 
The food is always good. But I just can't get into their coffee. I've tried a few different ones and not a fan of any of them.
Quaint and cute, definitely a better option than big chain coffee shops. The coffee is out of this world and the food is delicious. The baristas? Definitely top notch!
Found them next to our favorite sushi place. Delicous red velvet waffles with a pistachio latte.. yes please.

I LOVE this place. Absolutely delicious! I had the vegan Elvis waffle and I ate every last bit. I also had a house coffee. The staff is super friendly and you can tell that they truly care about customer satisfaction. Next time I'm in town I am definitely stopping back by. Awesome!

It was my first time today and  their coffee was great, but the guy who was working there didn't offer me a punch card to get free coffee. He mentioned it to other customers which was rude of him. I plan to go on the Maryland location instead maybe they will offer a loyalty card.
Flat out the best waffles in town. They have an awesome selection of sweet and savoury waffles that will leave you wanting to come back. As I did multiple times.

This place was delish! They have savory and sweet options for the waffles. Fresh ingredients and vegan options to make you feel like it's healthy lol. The coffee is also super good- this is a nice friendly artsy local coffee spot to check out when in Las Vegas. The staff was super friendly and helpful when we asked for some directions! Really went above and beyond.

Went here on a Sunday morning because it looked like something different.

First off the coffee was great. Super delicious & flavorful! I had the honey cream latte and couldn't have been happier with my choice! Perfect amount of coffee and sweet. Yummmmmm!!!!! 

There is practically nowhere to sit so we had to wait for people to get up and we felt kinda like vultures. I know this is not an issue as space is something that cannot be helped and I did not take it into consideration in my rating but I want to make mention of it in case you plan on dining in.

Ashley and I shared the breakfast sandwich and the Honey I'm Home churro waffle. 

The breakfast sandwich was bland. Not very much flavor. Even the bacon wasn't bacony enough to save the dish. It was just "meh...". Added salt and pepper...still "meh". 

The churro waffle however! We should have gotten 2 of these. It wasn't overly sweet like I thought it might be, but the balance was harmonious. The waffle was warm and cinnamony and the honey brought just the perfect flavor to marry everything together. I will definitely be back for this. Perhaps several times...
They have the best waffles! Tried their waffles with peanut butter and it was bomb! service was great. i definitely recommend coming here.
I had a maple bacon waffle and it was amazing! However I thought the portion was a little small. I think it's the best waffle I've ever had. Period.

Food is really good! However, the service is very time consuming  tuxedo frappe was amazing along with the Tokyo wafflewich! Definitely come by and enjoy one of their wafflewiches if you have the time!

Simple, tasty, inexpensive. At under $10 a person, my whole family enjoyed breakfast here, despite needing to push two small tables together to sit the five of us. Would recommend the banannatella waffle, twilight lavender drink was great, as was oolong tea. Staff were friendly and helpful. Inside could use a bit of sprucing up, and the location isn't the best, but I'm a fan nonetheless.

I heard from some people in the neighborhood that a new waffle place opened up right down the street on Flamingo & Maryland Pky, so I had to try!

It's a small order at the counter type of place, but everything is reasonably priced (use a Yelp! check-in to get 15% off, or UNLV students get a discount as well!)  The special here is waffles done in all sorts of ways (with toppings, or as a sandwich in some cases).  

I went with a waffle with almonds, bananas and Nutella on it for about $6.  The taste of it was OK, presented and cooked well, but nothing too special about the batter.  The disadvantage was it took what seemed like forever to get it (maybe just because I was hungry?).  I also got a hot chocolate which was just so-so.

For the price it's a wonderful place, and it's close to Target so I could see coming here for brunch and doing some shopping, I know I'll be back, but the location and low pricing is the main driver.

This is an adorable little coffee shop!!
You really feel the love for the bean while you are here!

The french press coffee was SO GOOD! It made me want to go out and buy one!
But having one here is way more fun!!

The lattes and espresso were amazing as well.
Watching them swirl your latte into a beautiful drinkable piece of art! 
And tastes so good! Amazing!!

Oh....And don't say no to the Waffles! Made to order delish!
Love Tiabi!! It is a really special place!

And the owner Tiffany told me they are getting ready to open a roastery too!
Take my money! I can't wait! I hope they have 5lb bags!

I love this place! I've gone twice and every time, the food and coffee are on point. Service is banging. You really can't go wrong. I love their vegan options and just the simplicity of the place, waffles.
Ordered the breakfast club waffle sandwich, this was very good.  Meats  had the right balance of flavor with the waffle.  Nicely done, good staff, and a fair price.

I'd say the quality of food make this place a 4 but today, overall, it was a weak 3. I arrived at 12pm with a family of 4 who was already eating.  

I ordered the Vegan WaffleWhich which is a waffle with some spring mix, avocado and Tomato with their special sauce. Already they were out of avocado but they made amends by giving me a complimentary fruit cup. This was good and I'd get it again. 

Also had a Golden Waffle which is a plain waffle with powder sugar and butter. 

It took 20 minutes for them to get me this order when it really should have only taken 10 and the fruit they had was not ready. It needed to be cut up. I'm all for freshness but it seems like this place doesn't have a good prep strategy. I did see, however they may have had a take out order they were tending to but there was 3 people there and only 2 customers after my brother and I. Keep in mind this place only makes waffles and my waffle wasn't even warm when I got it. 
I will be trying this place again, as it was good food and the staff was friendly and accommodating but I would prefer better experience next time and it would be as easy as the staff having better prep.
I ordered the breakfast sandwich and substituted the bacon for avocado. It was a dry waffle with a side of smelted cheese, 3 tiny slices of avocado and frozen eggs than were disgusting.

(Longer review to come)

Tiabi is a much welcomed oasis in the hectic rush of Las Vegas. We tried the Savory Thai Basil and West Coast waffle sandwiches. Both were absolutely delightful - crispy on the outside and filled with fresh ingredients on the inside. We'll definitely have to try the sweeter waffles and drinks that they're known for. If you're a visitor to the city, it's worth the (very quick) drive to make it here. Much tastier and less soggy than Bruxie on the Strip.

They wrap up bacon, cheese, chicken, and veggies in a waffle. This really should be all you need to know about this place to make you want to eat here. But, I'll expand. They wrap bacon, cheese, chic...

I decided I needed a pick-me-up and Tiabi popped up on my coffee radar (the yelp app) and I headed that way. As I parked my car and walked towards the door, I became skeptical about this place considering this neighbor can be non-friendly at times. I walked in and did the classic Hanna-Barbera/ Scooby Doo surprised look. This place was clean, inviting, and I was greeted with a giant smile and brief intro on the place. Great way to start my waffle fueled experience.  

I ordered the, "West Coast Waffle Wafflewich" and the "Stiles Java Jolt". The "West Coast", I was told is the fan favorite and if you read what I wrote above, that's easy to believe. This sammie is big, about half the size of an average dinner plate. The tasty ingredients are added to the savory waffle, then folded over to immediately give you this pocket-like snack item. As I ate, I was afraid of two things; all of the food falling out of the opposite biting side, and a weird sweet waffle paired with cheese. My fears waffled away as the crunch of the bacon filled my ears, the tender & juicy chicken, cheese, and veggies came together in the warm waffle. This sandwich was fantastic, and turned out to be one of those food items you realize you haven't put down since the first bite. This Wafflicious sammie was paired with seasoned homemade waffle chips. Fantastic mutated breakfast/ lunch combo.

The Stiles Java Jolt was delicious. Espresso, coffee, and just a tad of vanilla flavoring. I went half on the flavoring, because I don't have a huge sweet tooth, but Normally it comes with four pumps of vanilla. I could have drank two more of these delicious caffeinated bullets, but then I might turn into Spider-Man and climb the walls.

Amazing waffles and coffee, but bad decor. They need an upgrade. 

Yes I'm all about the whole experience. The look, the feel, the food.

Finally after the longest time being in my bookmarks, I got to try this place today!! Located in the shopping center on the corner of Maryland Pkwy & Flamingo with the Target, next to Sakana. Clean and spacious on the inside and I like that they had playing cards on the tables, feels like a place you could spend an hour or two catching up with friends.

I was pretty surprised at how large their drink and food menus were! They have coffee based drinks, frappes, smoothies, teas, and other non-coffee drinks. Cool selections like Red Velvet, Chocolate Coconut, Honey Cream Latte, Java Jolt, Kale Smoothie & Raspberry Lemonade! Tons of different options! My boyfriend and I settled on the Chocolate Coconut Latte and non blended White Chocolate Tuxedo. The Coconut one had some coffee but I'm pretty sure the White Chocolate one didn't. Great flavors but I was expecting them to be more coffee based. The White Chocolate Tuxedo tasted Iike a World Class Chocolate ice cream shake from Baskin Robbins! Both super tasty and an amazing price at $3.75 & $4. Score!

Now the food items! Waffles, waffle sandwiches, salads and desserts! I was also pretty suprised at the amount of vegan items they had! I think I counted about 9 options for food, Awesome! We settled on the West Coast waffle sandwich. Oh and all waffle sandwiches can be substituted with ciabatta bread. It came with chicken, tiabi sauce (vegan aioli), avocado, bacon, cheese and tomato. I was expecting some tiny thing but it was kind of around the size of a 6 in' sub. And for $5.99! Perfect! The waffle was nice and fluffy, had great flavors, and filling!

Our bill for the three items was $17.84 (including tax & 20% tip)! I will definitely be back especially since it's near UNLV. Thank goodness as I was getting tired of all the Chipotle-styled bowl & burrito places. Yummo!

A great little hideaway for when you are in the neighborhood! Nothing like stuffing your face at Roberto's for breakfast and coming here after for a nice coffee while you work. 

Friendly service. 
Free wi-fi
Free water to go with your coffee
Excellent words of wisdom in the bathroom for you to collect.

Quite barren on the decor, so Tiabi lacks that comfort and welcoming aspect. Would come back as the owner was super helpful on helping me pick/customize a coffee that would not be too sweet!

Every time I visit here I try something new, I have never been disappointed! The wafflewich is a must try! I love how fresh everything is made, I leave with a sweet satisfied feeling every time. I like the vegan/vegetarian options as well. Friendly and helpful staff keep a positive atmosphere, one of the reasons I really like this place

I saw a groupon so I bought it & so glad I did! It sits in a plaza, parking was easy. I ordered the West Coast sandwich & a smoothie, the waffle bread exceeded my expectation, it had a little crunchy outside & when you took a bite it was soft and filled with lovely flavors, just the way I like a sandwich so deeeelish & the portion size is perfect! I will stop in here any time I'm in the area, even if not hungry, I'll take home for later. Can't wait to bring my family & friends here!
The golden waffle was okay as was the Strawberry Sunrise. No major kudos are due; they made a vegan waffle that was decent but not at all thrilling.

Last time I was here I got the red velvet waffles and they were amazing. I really like the atmosphere, they have games and the inside is nicely decorated. It is kind of hard to see from the street, it's too bad because I feel like they deserve way more customers. Can't wait to come again.
Must try: # Tiff's Waffle Macchiato! Yummy coffee. Nice people. The wafflewiches are good too!

Yummmmm! Hubby and I shared 3 different waffle sandwiches this morning and all 3 were phenomenal! We will definitely be back... There are so many more menu options to try! Not to mention coffees and smoothies... Gotta try the kale champ smoothie... So good!
Delicious food with plenty of vegan options. The smoothies and specialty coffee drinks are also great and reasonably priced.

This Was My First Time Here At This Location and The Two Girls Working Helped Me With The Menu And Also Recomended Some Items For Me. i Ended Up Getring The West Coast Wafflewich. Sooo Good. The Food Is Light And Fresh,You Dont Feel Bloated Or Tired After Eating Eat. I Will Most Def Be Coming Back

I ate here alone a few days ago and as far as customer service goes they were great! The lady at the front was very personable and actually conversed with me personally. Most places ask you what you want and want to get on with their day, but it's nice to walk into a restaurant for the first time and get acknowledged like they are happy you chose them as a place to eat today. It was a very cute/creative place. I love how there are cards at all the tables. I will have to bring my boyfriend just for that! Lol. I ordered the guru burger. (Vegan) and it was  interesting. I tasted the waffle and burger and it was weird at first but not gross. I definitely will go back. There is a few smoothies I would like to try.
All the outlets to plug your devices are gone.

This is located a few minutes away from UNLV. We came to study after class and check it out. The smell when you walk in... is dangerous. I can imagine it being something similar to heaven's scent. The music isn't too loud... it could be better but some of it was decent. 

We were greeted at the counter by a very nice young man. He was knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions. They have a variety of vegan options in both coffee lattes and waffles. We chose the Java Jolt and the dark chocolate lavender latte both with almond milk. They were great and I would highly recommend. Both were priced like any other coffee house in Vegas, nothing outrageous and totally fair. 

We ordered dessert to go... vegan the cinnamon churro waffle with vegan vanilla ice cream. It was so amazing. The ice cream was like nothing I've ever experienced. The waffle was made perfectly. We put it in the microwave to make it extra warm and soft, since we took it to go... and it was just so amazing. I can not wait to go back and get it again. If you've never been here, I definitely recommend giving it a try!

I love this place! Definitely one of my fav coffee shoppes to go to. They serve great coffees & teas as well as some delicious food. Really cute place to just hang out & in a convenient central location.
I'm never disappointed when ordering the churro waffle, vegan ice cream, and baconut. I absolutely love this place
Coffee was good.... Waffles were cold and hard. It wasn't what I expected. My husband got the breakfast sandwich on a waffle, that was good. I won't be returning

I came in to tiabi today and wasnt sure what to expect considering the last time i was here i wasnt a coffee fan... but i checked in got 10 percent off got a iced coffee with hazelnut and almond milk and a bananatella waffle which im telling you guys rocked my world... BEST WAFFLE EVER!  i will be back cause that waffle will be in my dreams lol do yourself a favor and come in!

Got a new addiction! Mae's Sweet Dream! I've got to ALWAYS have that along w/my order! LOL BUT here's Wut I also got for my dinner AND breakfast! The west coast for dinner & the Hashtag breakfast sandwich, my drink is Dom's Coffee Cake BZB!

If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. The owner was ridiculous!!! They were having a special on the pumpkin waffle and a Halloween waffle. I wanted the pumpkin waffle, which come in a Belgian waffle style. However, the owner informed me that she only had enough batter for the original or regular waffle in pumpkin. She attempted to make me get the Halloween waffle, but I did not want that. I requested the same style of the Belgian pumpkin order in a regular waffle style since they could not accommodate what was on the menu. She began to harp on charging me for glazed pecans because that  was how the original came. I told her why would she charge me considering they could not provide what was on the menu? She began discussing that the pecans cost $, and had an attitude the entire time. Also, we almost choked on smoke inhalation. While I support small businesses frequently, this was a mistake and I encourage anyone who wants polite, fast and great service to turn elsewhere.  Tiabi SUCKS and that's putting it lightly. Needless to say, we took our business to the Crab Corner. DON'T DO IT!!!

Great Food, Great Prices, Great Staff. Can't really ask for more. I don't even really like Waffles in general, but I love eating the kinds that they make. They are really the kings in the Waffle game. Everyone there is real nice and the service was quick.

BOMB. I got churro waffle and wildberry lemonade on my way to the airport, and it made me want to stay another day! The churro waffle was perfect! Delightfully cinnamon-sugary, but not overwhelming. The thin-ness of the waffle makes it even and crunchy all the way across, and the fruit & whipped cream on were presented beautifully. Owner (?) was super patient, kind, and helpful, and even went back and printed a receipt when I forgot to ask for one initially. This place deserves to be way bigger and pricier than it is.

Delicious!!! I got an avocado, bacon, lettuce and tomato waffle sandwich! It was great and just the right amount of food. Also got a coffee that came with these churro-esque waffles. Overall, friendly staff and had a cute atmosphere. Would definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas.

i got the Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich.

waffle was crisp but not hard, the eggs and sausage also tasted great.
the only reason i didnt give them a 5 is that the waffle is way too thick esp when stacked on top of each other to make a sandwich. this made it a little too hard to eat.

I didn't think I'd be that impressed by a coffee shop that specializes in waffles and I was correct. I guess if you view it as a coffee shop first and a waffle shop second it's not so bad but I think most people that want breakfast want more options than just waffles. I tried the pistachio latte and build your own red velvet waffle with Thrifty ice cream and fruit. My boyfriend had an iced Americano and the bacon waffle sandwich. 

I was surprised to see that the coffee came in to-go cups even for a dine in order and I heard the couple behind me remark about the same thing. I guess if their menu shows pictures of fancy lattes with designs in a mug, that's what I expect to get. Regardless of presentation the coffee was quite good. I asked for skim milk and assuming they still used skim milk I found the latte to be very creamy with a nutty pistachio flavor that wasn't fake or overpowering. 

As for the waffles... they're just waffles ya know? My boyfriend's breakfast sandwich was pretty bland. If he hadn't added bacon to it it would have just consisted of scrambled eggs and shredded cheese. Adding the bacon added a bit of flavor but without drenching it in syrup it didn't taste like much of anything. Plus think about the texture of a waffle and scrambled eggs.. bacon is pretty much necessary for a crunch factor. My waffle was a little better, it had a bit of crunch on the edges and the red velvet was rich and gooey in the center. My favorite part was definitely the Thrifty ice cream though. I had a choice of strawberries and/or bananas for the fruit and I just got the strawberries. Overall it was a bit of a sugar overload and I can't see myself eating here very often if at all. Prices are definitely a little steep for what it really is. Not understanding the hype of this place at all.

Vegan waffles, light and crisp, topped with fresh fruit or syrup or other goodies.... A little place in a strip mall, which suited us perfectly, and we enjoyed a really great breakfast before our adventures.

We enjoyed the friendly service and the attention to the preparation - the fruit was arranged, not just thrown on.. 

Beautiful and delish - we shall return!

Oh gezz I picked the perfect place for my waffle indulgence! Waffle is amazing, looks like a piece of art! Perfect hot coffee, great atmosphere. They even have playing cards at every table! Need to bring some friends next time!

Arrived at 11 am on a Sunday - not too busy with just one group in front of us and the tables were moderately filled. No matter how many people are here, be prepared to wait a looooooong time to get any food or drink. The restaurant itself reeks of old oil or some sort of thick grease smell that stays in your hair and clothes for hours after you leave.

Took 25 minutes to finally get my Tiff's Waffle Macchiato with a kind of cold, moderately crispy churro waffle. The drink itself was sweet and tasty, and the whipped cream is quite thick. But 25 minutes for a drink?? Way too long. 

10 minutes later, got the Red Velvet waffle w/ whipped cream, strawberries, and bananas. Boyfriend ordered the Waffledilla w/ avocado. Although good, it looked and tasted like something I could easily make at home in half the time.

People who came in after we ordered would order food to go and get it in 10 minutes or less. Some would then sit and eat inside. Maybe the key here is to order your food to go regardless of eating there or actually taking your food to go?

Will not be coming back due to the extremely slow service and decent quality food.

Used to love this place. The food tastes delicious and they have wifi, so I can study here. I introduced many of my family and friends to this place.

That being said, the service is below average. Not only is the wait time long (they only had 2 or 3 waffle makers, understandable bc they're a small mom and pop shop which I loved), but the owner/worker takes customer requests and suggestions personally. I asked for strawberries and Nutella on my waffle, as I always ordered it. When I received it, there were no strawberries. I hate to complain about food bc they have the power to spit in it when you're not looking, but I thought they'd be ok with me asking since I'd been there several times previously. When I asked, they took a few minutes and handed over a small bowl of sliced strawberries. I thought they were going to add it to my plate, so I brought it up to the counter. When she saw I did this, she grudgingly said,"Oh, you wanted ME to put those on there?" I replied that I could do it, a little embarrassed. 

The reason this was a red flag for me is because one of my earlier stops there, I heard the staff talking about a recent Yelp review. The review spoke of the bad service the customer received. The girl in question defended herself and stated she did nothing wrong. I didn't think anything of this the first time. A subsequent time I was there, a foreign couple (Italian accent?) was asking why their 2 waffles were not similar and if they could remake one because they enjoyed the crispier one. The same owner/worker who didn't take criticism well kept insisting that it was made the same and they just had to let it sit longer to get the crispy consistency. 

At that point, I hadn't been crossed by one of her moods yet, so I continued visiting to get my delicious coffee, waffles and to study. Then, that day hit as it inevitably would. I haven't returned since and don't intend to. Customer service is key, any business owner should know this. 

Since I know you (the owners) read the Yelp reviews, I'd like to offer up some constructive criticism: you should cater to your customers. If you take these comments personally and become defensive, your customers will only continue to be dissatisfied with your service.

This place is great! Today I had the west coast sandwich and it was amazing. One of the best sandwiches in the area. The chicken is perfect for the sandwich. And the waffle as bread is a cool idea. My girlfriend and I normally go in here for smoothies and this was the first time I ate food and I was not disappointed. The smoothies are really good as well the first time I had a smoothie with tofu I didn't think I would like it because of the tofu but it gets better ever time! Would  totally recommend this place to others!

This sandwich I must admit is a great idea but a couple of things needs to change. The waffle is delicious perfectly sweet n crunchy but soft at the same time. The grilled chicken I had was similar to the grilled chicken at Subway and the back is extremely thin. The Tiabi sauce I couldn't even taste. The sandwich should have better quality of ingredients and more sauce. Staff was very nice and patient, gave great recommendations.
Loved how they had vegan options. Very hipster scenery. We got banana Nutella waffles. Very taste. Really would like to try other options next time I'm in the city.
Great study place when it isn't during busy hours. The drinks are good, we have to try the waffle dishes next time!
How have I forgot all about this place! I'll be spending almost every morning here. West coast is my go to !

Super cool spot. Gluten free soy free waffle was very good. Ask for agave instead of syrup. Atmosphere is dope...great music (old school r & b) playing while u work, write or eat. And the music is at a thinking level lol. One to hit up for breakfast fo' sho' when you are in vegas.

This place is a fantastic place to get some great waffles with amazing coffee. The whole place feels really homey and is just awesome. My son's school recently had a fundraiser there, and everyone's mood was really jolly.

Oh my goodness!! I can not say enough good things about this little gem in the desert. Food was excellent. I had the West Coast a waffle sandwich with chicken bacon and avocado yummy!! And my daughter had the southern pecan waffle. The drinks were so good too my daughter had the twilight   lavender coffee tea, which I thought I would not like but actually loved!! And I had the coconut cooler with basil so incredibly good. Love this little place. Definitely worth it!!

I have always loved unique coffee houses! They peek my interests when I travel and I enjoy when they have a good, cozy vibe. Above all, the coffee must taste great and not be ridiculously overpriced. 

This place is so delicious! They have friendly service and prices are reasonable. On top of all the yummy coffee options, they have tasty food. The second you walk in, it smells amazing. They are waffle bar and I often find myself having random cravings for their bacon waffle, but they have great sandwiches too! They have tea if you're not a coffee person. No matter your mood... you will find something here! Also, the names are fun and different. Definitely a change to your average coffee house.

I am extremely impressed with the quality of food and customer service this location had when I went there last Thursday afternoon. I cannot wait to go back!!

Around 3:30ish, I decided to drop into this location with a Groupon to get a bite to eat. When I arrived I was immediately greeted by this very sweet girl with black hair and glasses (I completely forgot to ask for her name), and she explained some of the items on the menu to me as I was deciding. I ended up getting the Red Velvet Blended Drink and the Strawberry Kisses Waffle. Both the drink and the waffle were delicious! The strawberries on the waffle were very fresh and ripe, while the waffle itself was perfect. It wasn't too hard or too soft, and it was flavorful. I loved the drink although I am not really sure how to explain it. Chocolately, but also Red Velvety?? Lol.

When I got there it was in the middle of the thunderstorm so I was the only one in the establishment (which was cool) since if it was super crowded it would be difficult to find a place to sit since it's a bit smaller than the Maryland Parkway location. The lady who was working was extremely attentive and kind to me, checking to make sure I liked my food and making small talk. It's really nice going to an establishment where the workers are friendly and helpful. I left Tiabi happier than when I got there.  

I plan on going back even without a Groupon! 
Great experience, great food and great customer service (:
Really amazing service and food ! Get the guru buger or the waffledilla. By car best quality waffles you can ever find!

This is place is excellent. Great service, friendly staff, and delicious food. We had the Thai basil waffle sandwich special and the hashtag breakfast sandwich. Both delicious. And I love that the side of fruit is fresh strawberries and bananas. And when they found out we like heavy cream with our coffee, they brought us a cup to our table. I would definitely come back. Highly recommended!

I've gone here 3 times now because of a groupon my boyfriend got. The first two times I ordered the west coast wafflewich and this time I ordered strawberry kisses. Honestly my friend ruined waffles for me. She made a ton one time, 3 different flavors   The one that stands out in my memory was the cookie butter flavor. These waffles were so insanely delicious that now whenever I have waffles, I compare them to the ones my friend made and they are never as good. The other issue is I'm personally more of a fan of the Belgian variety of waffles over the eggo variety. Tiabi has more of the eggo variety, thin and crispy rather than thick and somewhat doughy. They have a nice presentation but I'll probably not visit them again.
Nice cool little vibe on the inside, cashier was friendly , I got the bananatella or something like that, shut was fire
Stopped here for breakfast and a smoothie and loved their unique twist on waffles. Smoothies are bomb. Great customer service. Def stop by.
First time here! Yelp made me want to try it. Their tiff's waffle coffee looked really good
Captain Crunch frap is the business!  The honey cream latte is amazing as well..... House made chips and waffle sandwiches oh my!!

Came here for brunch, Strawberry Kisses waffle was delicious! I also had a strawberry smoothie, very tasty and not too sweet. My BF ordered chicken and waffles with home chips. He gave it 4 stars. The staff were very pleasant. I got to try a sample of churro, sooooo good. So I must come back!
Great service! They were all very friendly and helpful. Great atmosphere and good prices. Hashtag breakfast sandwich and the hot Mocha latte were very good. Great fresh waffles and coffee!

There's nothing that makes me more happy than a crisp, delicious waffle and a lovely latte.  

This is exactly what I found when I wandered into Tiabi Coffee and Waffle last week.  A coffee date with a couple of friends turned into a couple of hours of eating, sipping and go-fish.  

(This place has cards on every table and when you're sitting there you can't help but pick them up and start playing card games from childhood, which was a blast.)

I ordered the smore's waffle -- which probably wasn't fair because I've made some extremely delicious smore's waffles myself in the past..  But it was quite delicious! My friend ordered the bananutella waffle (which I actually preferred to mine) and my other friend ordered a waffle sandwich + the captain berry crunch smoothie (which was bomb, but only order it if it's all you're going to have because it was dense and filling and super sweet.) 

I have already been back to this place to order the Honey Cream Latte, which was amazing and will definitely have to make a point to stop by whenever I'm in the neighborhood! 

The staff is very friendly and the place is inviting.

This place is great! Friendly, attentive staff and nice, relaxed ambiance. But the real star here is the food! I am an admittedly picky diner as I am a pretty good cook myself...Bacon-stuffed Belgian waffle was cooked to perfection!! Wanted to eat the whole thing but was pleasantly stuffed after adding a fresh fruit cup for a dollar and a caramel frappe. :) Fruit cup was amazingly fresh, tasty and ample (for only a dollar extra, mind you), and caramel frappe did not disappoint! Total cost was under 15 bucks with tip. -Not bad for Vegas fare!! Eat breakfast here over the Strip!!!!!
Interesting wake concoctions, such as the red velvet waffle or the maple bacon waffle. However, very dry, they were too crispy for my tastes, but they were cheap...so...ehhh
What a cute and unique place! The waffle sandwiches were very affordable and filling.

A casual place for great waffles! Each waffle is made to order, so be prepared to wait for a little bit. The ladies behind the counter are friendly and have great recommendations if you want to try something different. This is a cool local spot to go with your friends and just hang out.

I love this place. The service was great and so was the food. My son ordered the waffle that looks like Pac-Man, and for the first time in a very long time, he ate it all! I got the red velvet waffles, and boy were they great. Their raspberry lemonade was to die for. My son actually got this but I drank some. Overall it was a great environment; they even had games and books to read which made it feel like a hangout spot.
Sad to see this place go.  We really enjoyed their breakfasts. Clever combinations of seasonal flavors always made this place a treat :(
Excellent customer service,  excellent food, and excellent atmosphere. I would recommend this place to anyone. Loved it!!! Very good prices for what you get.

I have been pining for a visit after seeing the wonderful Instagram photos from Tiabi Waffle. Today we headed over around 7:30 and finally got to enjoy a waffle breakfast. I had the Elvis which includes banana, peanut butter, honey, agave nectar. It was the perfect waffle and portions are just big enough to be very satisfying, and not so massive as to be overwhelming.

My husband gobbled up his bacon infused waffle and exclaimed this place a solid 4!! Now this isa tough reviewer, who when he sees the word 'vegan' scrunches up his face and his head folds into his shoulders. This is huge!

I want to return for their blendies, smoothies with a great variety of ingredients, and the black lemonade which is infused with charcoal for digestion.

The cafe is cute and staff are super helpful.

You may find us here pretty often now!!

The service is amazing. Staff are super friendly.... the brew coffee is good. My husband got the pecan waffle and he totally loved it!!! I got the bananatela!!! Omg!!!! It totally hit the spot....... it's a must try .....
This place is perfect.  Just tried for first time and I know there is probably nothing on the menu that is a wrong choice.

Customer service: 5 stars 

Food: 4 stars because this place is no different that any other waffle place around town. 

Location: 1 star because the area is horribly run 
down And completely inconvenient to get to unless you work nearby or attend UNLV. Also the inside needs some serious TLC

All around I'd give it 4 stars because it was good, but it's not worth a drive to eat there.

Another fantastic visit! Had a vanilla cold brew & a waffle breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was DELISH and the coffee is so good that I literally look forward to the one day a week that I can drive across the Valley to have my fix.

My husband and I had a terrible experience there. I purchased a goupon and thought it would be a good reason to try a new restaurant.
First: The employee who took my order put her hand inside my coffee cup when she picked it up. I asked her to please give me a new cup, and that putting her hand inside the cup is unacceptable. As she replaced the cup she said, "We wash our hands."
Second: When the same employee brought us our silverware, it was wet and dirty. I took them to the counter and asked for clean, dry silverware.
Third: The service was extremely slow. A party of four ordered before us, and they received 2 of their orders in approx 10 minutes, and the other 2 orders approx 10 minutes later. The employee explained that they can only make a couple of orders at a time, and offered some cookies as consolation.
Fourth: We got our order 30 minutes after we ordered it. I had the egg, sausage, cheese waffle sandwich. The egg and sausage were heated in the microwave and tasted like rubber.
The only good things: The gentleman that made our coffees did an excellent , and the strawberries on my husband's waffles were fresh.
I spoke to the manager, explained why we were there, our experience, and that we will not be back.
I do not recommend this restaurant.

Just grubbed on their Bananatella waffles! Delicious!  Definitely worth ordering.  A delicious crispy homemade waffle with Nutella sprinkled across it and then topped off with bananas, chopped almonds and whipped cream.  Tastes just as good as it sounds!  Ordered it online and had it delivered and although the delivery took almost an hour (it was through Uber Eats though) it was still hot and fresh when we received it.  Will be dining in next time we go for breakfast, but definitely worth the order.
Yummy.  Just had the west coast and it was the bomb.  Waffle was crispy and fluffy at the same time.  Time for dessert!!

We LOVE this place. It is a small place and not a lot of tables but that is the only negative--and isn't much of a negative. The first time, I had the Strawberry Kisses waffle and a honey cream latte. Both were excellent. The second time I had the West Coast waffle sandwich. Wow! Next time I'm going to be torn between trying something new and having the West Coast again. It was soooo good. The snickers iced coffee is wonderful! Another plus is that the staff is really friendly.

Amazing waffles. Amazing coffee. Amazing prices. What more can you ask for? 

Everything that we got was delicious. The snickers iced coffee was perfect, and the bananatella waffle tasted as good as it looked. Will definitely come back when we return to Las Vegas. I highly recommend this place!

If you are a vegan in Vegas, this is the place for you! We came for lunch one day, and came back for breakfast the next. I had the Savory Thai and Guru vegan burgers. They come in a waffle instead of a bun, though you can ask for a bun if you prefer.  All the veges were fresh, and the sauce on the burgers was amazing! The waffles (also vegan) are crispy on the outside with a fluffy center, and slightly sweet. Probably the best waffles I've ever had, vegan or not.  The blendies (smoothies) were also yummy - I tried the strawberry sunrise and banana peanut butter. If you like PB, definitely get the PB blendie!

My first time here. Liked the vibe. It was perfect for a break from the office. Food was better than I expected and I was delighted at the light and tasty fare. Enough protein to get thru day. I'll return...for dessert! Don't be in a hurry.

Awesome veggie burger
Awesome waffle :)
Great guy on the counter.. Totally enjoyed it.
Best craving around for sweet waffles and amazing tea and coffee... Very friendly... Helpful... Always good...
Went this weekend and had some breakfast for dinner. Great meal and friendly service. Very creative menu!

Mixed feelings on this place, the wait was 30 minutes I was the  not so busy until after I ordered, table beside me all sandwiches,  look nothing special or exciting, got up to complain about the wait, plain looking waffle sandwich appeared less than 5 minutes, cut into it and took my first bite, super surprised on taste, West coast, juicy, seasoned  and simple but good, I rated to the FACT all items including  whipped cream on counters left warm , coffee took 15 minutes, dirty tables and a continuous  line that 3 people could not manage or give great customer service.  Why do you make fresh waffles and put them in an oven, doesn't make sense, unfortunately  I will not be back, too bad Very cute atmosphere.

Enjoying a nice breakfast with the family. 
Food was good. Options are great. And best part is they didn't up charge me for substitutions.
The pistachio latte is very light flavor.
Great portions too. 
The only complaint is dry waffles. Need sauce for sure.
Located in a strip mall on Maryland, tiabi offers good breakfast food and smoothies at a good price. Good customer service and good music, I definitely recommend

Was staying at the Hilton Grand Vacations and Ubered here with my daughter. Located in a strip mall, don't let the location fool you. This place Rocks!!! Unbelievable good Iced Coffee, I had the Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee. Ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and Strawberry Kisses waffle... we ate it so fast we forgot to take pictures of it!!! Get here NOW.

Small seating area. Menu is on the left side when you enter. Order at the counter and find a table. 

Utensils are very dirty. Bad dishwasher/ dish washing? I used napkins to wipe them down. 

Decor is boring. 

Food didn't take long to come out, maybe 10 minutes. 

We ordered a pistachio latte; delicious flavor, lightly sweetened with a beautiful nutty aftertaste. 

Bananatella: these waffles are different from what I have had else where. They are on the thinner, slightly doughier side. Nice crunchy exterior and softness as you bite into it. The almonds on top added a nice texture to the bite. Fresh, firm banana slices. 

Veggie breakfast sandwich: they use the same waffle for these sandwiches, which works great. The veggies were fresh, great tasting. No complaints. 

We enjoyed this place but for $16.XX I don't think we will be coming back. I'm still hungry.

Love this place! One of my go to places when I'm in Vegas and need some good flavorful coffee with some food as well. Today we stopped in before we hit the road time travel back to Cali and I ordered TIFF'S Waffle  Macchiato and it was amazing the hint of vanilla in the macchiato made it even better...I also ordered the Butter Pecan Waffle with ice cream on the side a must try..I could have ate a whole one by myself but I decided to share with my sister...lol

I absolutely love this place! Great location right next to campus. So on long school days, plan on stopping by especially during happy hour and grab a great coffee along with a little snack (the waffle that comes along with the drink!) Service is amazing and the baristas are always super friendly.
One of my favorite coffee spots here in Las Vegas. Wonderful breakfast sandwiches, waffles, at that waffle Macchiato is unbelievably good

If you want amazing coffee and waffles this is the spot.
My favorites are the pistachio, lavender and honey lattes. 
Bacon stuffed waffle with a cup of fruit and butter is my jam.

I called ahead it's faster service. Amazing staff. Try the home made baked goods peanut butter and jelly cookies!!

Wonderful restaurant!! The man at the front counter was extremely helpful, as this was our first visit. We came here Tuesday afternoon for lunch. I had one of the wafflewiches and it was so delicious and filling. Also, all of their food is very reasonably priced. I wish we had some of these restaurants on the East Coast. I know my friends would love it! Such a nice concept and laid back atmosphere.
Love this place . Everyones friendly, and the food/treats are amazing, try the the rebel punch you will not be disappointed!

Best vegan waffles we have ever had!, That have an even greater drink selection than Starbucks as well! The viva Las Elvis has coconut bacon that taste amazingly like real bacon. Must give this place a try!

Met a friend here very early on a Sunday morning for coffee.  The cashier was friendly and very helpful especially since it was our first time there.  She even made recommendations and provided excellent customer service.  I ordered an iced hazelnut coffee sweetened, but no cream and also a maple & bacon infused waffle.  The coffee and waffle were a hearty and delicious breakfast, which surprised me as they were very flavorful!  The place has a nice coffee shop vibe, music was good but not too loud, and it was the perfect spot to have a conversation.
Yelnel was a super nice person. I probably murdered her name though. Sorry lady lolol

A couple of months ago on a beat the street campaign (as I like to call it) a young lady came into my gym and handed me a flyer to this coffee and waffle bar.. Well, fast forward to today and I decided to come in for a coffee and bite to eat. I was instantly met with a lovely charm that was warm and refreshing to my soul. Adrian greeted me with a smile and kind patience as my indecision kicked in. I ordered a white mocha with almond milk (huge win) and the flavors that came from my cup tickled my senses and angered me because I deprived myself for so long from this treat. Anyway.. I look forward to being back soon and seeing where else this Vegas gem can take my senses..

Thank You Adrian!

This place is a must when you visit Vegas. Its a little way off the beaten track but worth the short trip from the strip.  My husband and I got the west coast and hash tag breakfast sandwich and strawberry sunrise smoothie. The west coast was good BUT the hash tag breakfast sandwich was hands down..the best waffle sandwich I ever had. The waffle was so airy, fluffy, and buttery and the sausage and egg was puuuurrrfect. The smoothie was the best I ever had.  The guy at the register was so chill and patient while we couldn't make up our mind! We also had a red velvet lollie and it was was such a treat. I give this place 2 thumbs up!

Such a cute place with an awesome staff! The menu is very creative and have options for everyone-- from carnivores to vegans. 
Although my order didn't come out how I had ordered it (hence the 4/5 stars), I enjoyed every bite.

Came across this cafe on yelp on my weekly Monday breakfast adventure...and I was definitely happy with my visit. My husband I went shortly after they opened and we were the only guests dining in - there was a couple take-outs while we waited and dined (their website permits for online orders).

We were assisted by Mae (one of the owners) who was incredibly friendly and welcoming about our first visit.

My husband had the red velvet waffles, I had the #breakfast sandwich. I had a Carmel apple cider (by far much better than Starbucks) and my husband had a mocha latte (great also). 

While we did wait about 15-20 minutes for our food (not bad by any regular standards) - Mae was apologetic for our time waiting and treated us to a sample of their Churronimo (delicious!).

Will definitely revisit in the future!

I literally just left this place and already ready to come back for more! I had the kale champ smoothie( which was actually amazing, with 2 full cups of kale) and the Elvis Belgium waffle: peanut butter, banana, savory crispy bacon, and honey drizzled on top of this light flaky waffle! I'm glad it wasn't burnt either because I HATE burnt waffles! Friendly staff and if you're a Unlv student you get 10% off your bill! I WILL be back to try more things off their menu!

I really like this place very simple inexpensive. Food is good real friendly staff Excel they should increase their waffle maker I think it be a little bit more efficient. But other than that I think this is a great place to eat very tasty simple. Behind the strip

Heard about this place the other day . Wow the prices here are awesome. I had the lolly waffle it's a turkey sausage wrapped in a waffle it was great. I also had the west coast wafflewhich a avacado blt so good. I als had a great smoothie. I highly recommend this place the service was awesome as well.

Wonderful! Bravo! Excellent! The waffle is handmade and is so tasty. The special sauce of them is amazing. I'm a tourist from Taiwan. If i have enough time, i would like to come second,third,many many time even live near here!!!

Been coming here for a couple of years. First time we came was because we found out that Tiff the owner was from Guam. Of course us people from the same island support each other. It's at the outer edge of the strip so no need to worry about traffic so much. Located in a strip mall on Maryland parkway and across Seafood city. You have to try this place.  The waffles here are exactly how I like them. Thin and crispy in the outside but as you bite into to them has the moist texture. I love their honey latte topped with a slice of churro waffle!! The portion is so right and I don't have to feel guilty for those times your watching your calories.

One of the best breakfast I had had in Vegas. EVERYTHING was fabulous. Worth getting there early. Service was great and super friendly. 
Avocado smoothie, kale waffle salad and the chicken sandwich are delicious, not the traditional waffle combination.

Tiabi is a small-chill-cafe type of joint. It's nice for if you're in a hurry or want to hang out for a while.

My only cons are personal preferences mostly. For instance, I had a large iced pistachio latte with non fat milk, and the flavor was delicious but it was too damn sweet. Next time I will definitely be more specific about how I want my coffee.

I like the concept of the "wafflewich" but it's just not my cup tea. It wasn't bad, but I wouldn't order it again. Does not reflect on the business by any means.

To me, Tiabi is kind of expensive but I think it's similar to Starbucks prices.

I will definitely be back to try a hot coffee and one of their many waffles (:
I had a green tea latte and they strawberries and chocolate waffle.  Both were yummie!!!

So it's located in the plaza with Target on the Maryland Parkway side. It'd be easy to miss it if you don't know where to look! 

It's a small cozy cafe with seating for around 30-40 people? It's super close to UNLV which makes it a prime place to go to for a coffee break and possibly to study. They do have free WiFi! And the owners are pretty cool and really nice.

I ended up getting waffles and tea, more specifically I got the vegan version of Viva Las Elvis with vegan ice cream. It's a waffle with peanut butter, honey (agave if vegan version), and coconut bacon with a scoop of ice cream on top. It was pretty good, nothing too spectacular. The peanut butter melted into the waffle which was pretty awesome, because I mean melted peanut butter on anything is delicious! And the ice cream was well vegan vanilla ice cream and wasn't too special to me. 

I'll probably not get tea again, only because it was $2 for a bag and one cup of hot water. I'm not sure if they'll give you more hot water, but one bag and one cup of water doesn't seem like it's worth it. 

My biggest gripe was that it was DIRTY. I mean the tables, I went through two tables and they were both dirty. There was dried syrup on them and stains from the last customers. I looked down to see if there were any other tables, but most of them seemed like they were dirty to me. I tried cleaning some of it off, but most of it didn't come off with a napkin and some water. That to me is disgusting especially since it seems most people leave their dishes and the owners clean it off. That's just how it looked to me, when other customers ate and then left. When I got there the whole cafe was empty but as I sat there there were people that came and go. So they didn't really have an excuse to be dirty. 

I do however want to try some other menu items the next time I go. I just hope it's cleaner this time. I like the owners, they're pretty nice to talk to. I like the atmosphere. I like the location. I like some of their food so far. But I don't like dirty tables where I'm going to eat especially at cafe/restaurants/etc.
I had the honey cream latte, breakfast sammich with no cheese and my guy had the West Coast sammich with a caramel machiatto...everything was delish. Cute little coffee shop with friendly staff.
Nice service, quaint place. Coffee, teas and various waffles. Great for groups of two. Small inside.

Awesome, awesome, awesome!!! Husband and I went here today and this little coffee shop was incredible. We got the coconut truffle iced coffee and the tiffs waffle macchiato and both were delicious. For food it was the west coast and maple bacon waffle. The west coast was like nothing I've ever had. The flavors were so yummy and you would think with it being a waffle sandwich it would be hard to eat but no way everything stayed together perfectly. The maple bacon waffle tasted just like the Waffle House nice and fluffy and sweet. The service was fast and super friendly. We will definitely be returning here soon.
Delicious waffles. I always go for the guru burger, a vegan waffle sandwich. Friendly service, cool hang out spot. Did I mention their waffles are delicious?
They have the best tasting waffles I've ever tried. It's just like a hole in the wall but they offer the best breakfast ever. Will definitely be back with more friends in tow.
Awesome breakfast place near UNLV. West Coast and Mocha is my go to. Great music and service too!
Tasty and inexpensive, this little gem is a great spot for a coffee or yummy waffles.   Be sure to note the Vats of Nutella.  :)
Great breakfast or lunch spot. Got the waffle chicken sandwich with avocado. Also had their iced coffee. Price point was fair friendly service and good portions will be back.

Waffle bar. Those two words were what initially lured me into this place. I mean, who could resist the thought of personalized-topped waffles? Add the incentive of a groupon, and I'm on it...but unfortunately, I have to say that I was slightly disappointed both times I went.

I had gone to eat here when they had opened a few months ago. I didn't particularly have an optimal experience - my boyfriend's hashtag waffles were served a little cold, and though we were the only customers there, I remember we had to wait a good amount of time for our food to arrive. I understand that this place was just starting out and just getting into the groove of things, so I chalked it up to that factor and refrained from writing a negative review. Additionally, the location is kind of sketchy, but they have no control over that really. 

Flash forward. I decided to give it another shot a few months later. I ordered a dirty mocha chai and a West Coast waffle sandwich (bacon, chicken strips, avocado, tomato and cheese), which was the same exact order I had the first time around. The sandwich is what I'm giving the extra star for. It's worth a try, pretty good. It was better this time too as far as the amount of toppings go. Very filling. 

The bad news: Service time is still pretty lousy. I even added the pre-tip in hopes of speeding up our food, but it was in vain. The employees are friendly, but I was expecting a smoother and more efficient delivery. They should train the people in charge of preparing the food a lot better. It shouldn't take long to make a waffle and add the trimmings. Especially if the trimmings don't require much maintenance and cooking at all. I'm all about trying small businesses and was really rooting for their success, but it was just disappointing to see that this place hasn't fully quite worked out its kinks yet.

I purchased a Groupon in order to give this place a try on my most recent visit to Vegas. I did not get to use all three coupons, but I was able to try this place a few times. The wait can be a bit longer than expected, but the food is rather good. I had a smoothie my first time, which was delicious and filling. The second time, I had a Red Velvet frappe, which was amazing and a sandwich. The sandwich was my least favorite item. I don't know if it was the batter used for the waffle of the sandwich or the fact that it took 20 minutes to be served the sandwich, but I was not pleased.
