I would recommend this place, especially the Groupon if you plan on being in the area for a few days. I do suggest more staff to accommodate the orders. The same guy who took my order, also made my meal which only made the wait longer

This place was alright, I liked that they had a vegan option however it was not that great. It had avocado, tomato, and spring lettuce (I think) with their "special sauce". I didn't like the sauce at all, and it just wasn't anything special at all. I think it was around 6 bucks, however I also got their pistachio iced coffee and LOVED that. My friend got a regular waffle which just tasted like a waffle lol & got the peach tea which she said tasted like water but I thought it tasted good. So overall good place if you think waffle sandwiches are cool and you just want to try one but don't expect anything outstanding.

I adore this cute little coffee shop on the North part of town. My favorite drink to order is the coconut truffle latte; I don't know what it is, but it's super sweet and yummy and it totally keeps me going when I have a lot to study for school. Waffle sandwiches are also great. I really like the Thai basil with extra sriracha :) 
Service can indeed be a little slow depending on the time you go, but expected from a little coffee place with only a few people working at a time. If you need a little pick me up and if you're tired of Starbucks, I recommend trying out Tiabi!
It was really good I loved the waffles I got the service was great they were all friendly and patient. I definitely recommend it !

I love that there's a breakfast place near UNLV that has vegan choices! Actually their yums, including waffles and smoothies are great all day long and their dishes are artfully displayed (like their vegan waffle with strawberries and bananas on top)! I love their vegan waffle burger, and my go to smoothies of theirs are the kale champ and the banana berry ones. Mae and Tiffany, the owners of To Be Inspired And Inspire are always happy and positive and their helper bees are great too! They also play a great mix of great tunes in their shop!

We were visiting family in Vegas and checked Yelp for a place to go for breakfast. All the good reviews on here made us check it out- and we ended up going twice during our short stay. I had the west coast and a waffle macchiato. My fiancé had the golden waffles and a honey cream latte. All of it was amazing! Yes- it took a while to get our food, but they the food is so good that it's worth the wait. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

Just moved to the area and needed a good breakfast. This place hit the mark! I had the Elvis waffles (pb, banana and bacon) and a Snickers coffee. Both were delicious!
The only reason I'm giving it a 4 right now is that I still need to explore the whole menu!

I'm all for helping out small, locally-owned shops, but to get me to visit a second time the food has to be good. With Tiabi, I'm on the fence. On one hand the B.A.T. wafflewich ($4.95) with its bacon, arugula, and tomato was delicious. I don't know what the Tiabi sauce in the wafflewich consisted of, but in combination with the other ingredients it made it unbelievably tasty. On the other hand, the Break-The-Fast wafflewich ($4.95) was a complete disaster. The whole thing looked sad. The sausage was barely warm, the cheese looked like it was straight out the fridge having had no contact with any heat to melt it, and the scrambled eggs looked like prepackaged/pre-cooked eggs found at McDonald's.

Somewhere in between in quality were the two waffle dishes I tried. Ordered as a Belgian waffle, the maple bacon waffle ($5.99) was thick and soft, as expected, with large chunks of bacon in the batter. The savory and saltiness of it in combination with the sweetness of the batter and syrup made it a solid choice all around. The red velvet waffle ($5.50), ordered as a classic thin waffle, lacked any crispness around the exterior. The flavor was well balanced with a moderate amount of chocolate chips and whipped cream giving it enough sweetness without making it too overindulgent.

With classic, Belgian, and vegan waffles, specialty coffee drinks and frozen drinks, there's plenty of promise here. Unfortunately, some of the execution on my visit was lackluster. And, don't expect fast service. Even with three employees hustling in the back we waited a while for our orders despite being the first ones through the door in the morning.

I noticed this place opening up next to Roberto's and was curious to try some of the drinks once it finally did. The first visit there weren't any tables out front and just 3 inside. The tables were dirty, so I cleaned one up with some napkins to sit at. The guy who took my order was friendly and helpful with questions I had about some of the drinks. My second visit I noticed they put a decent amount of tables and chairs outside making more room for customers which is nice. The one thing that was the same is the tables were dirty again. I had to clean a spot to sit and enjoy my coffee and breakfast, not cool. If the tables are left dirty then how clean is the meal prep area? Also the same guy took my order on the second visit and he seemed more eager to chit chat with another guy that was working than he did about answering my questions about the latte art or menu items.

Tiff's Waffle Macchiato ($4.75 for a large) - Cinnamon vanilla macchiato, whipped cream and a churro waffle. I loved this! The drink tasted excellent and the churro waffle was very good! Definitely try this one. 

Iced Honey Cream Latte ($4.65 for a large) - Honey, steamed cream latte with a dash of nutmeg. I asked for this one iced and it tasted good and was a nice change from the same flavors I usually pick. I noticed they promote that they do latte art and so I asked the guy working about it. He said that only he and the owner,Tiff know how to do the latte art right now until more people get trained and that you have to ask for it or your drink is marked to-go meaning it will be put in a to-go cup. It's not like it makes the drink taste different, but it is a nice touch and since this guy said he was one of the two who knew how to do it, well it would have been nice of him to have done it. 

White Chocolate Mocha Latte ($4.65 for a large) - I asked for this one hot and it was like the previous drinks very good. 

Golden Waffle ($4) - This is a waffle with butter and powdered sugar. There is an option to add seasonal fruit for $1 extra, so I did that. The waffle was hard and dry. I only made it through 3 bites and I was done. The seasonal fruit I added was sad looking and didn't appear very fresh, so I skipped on even trying any of it. Since the waffle I had with the coffee on my previous visit was so good, I was disappointed with this one.

I really liked the drinks a lot and they are 4-5 star worthy, but my experience with the dirty tables, waffle/fruit breakfast and the inconsistent customer service leave me on the fence with this one.

Best waffles I ever had! Nice and crispy on the outside with a beautiful golden brown color to it, and absolutely delicious fluffy insides~ Just as a waffle should be! Menu is very healthy, me and my boyfriend visited for a small breakfast and it was wonderful! I got a waffle macchiato, which is a splendid coffee toped with whipped cream and a waffle piece on top. The waffle was covered in a cinnamon sugar, so yummy! We also tried some kale chocolate chip cookies, don't be afraid of the color (or kale haha) they were soft and mosit and very delicious! You can't even taste the kale that much~ Great place for waffles or coffee (or both ;D) we will be visiting again to try out more of their menu!
The food was great but I waited for 35 mins just to get my west coast sandwich and plus its not even busy!?
Fairly inexpensive    quick service  no smiles ever seen though   food is good  coffee is decent   typical local college food place    great deals thru Groupons and living social

Taibi is AMAZING!! The staff and owners (Tiff & Mae) are super friendly and make some awesome food! This is gonna be one of the main things I'm going to be missing now that I've moved away from LV. 
For UNLV students: there is wifi and electric outlets for studying AND a discount if you say you're a student. 
For vegetarians and vegans: there are some great options and the variety keeps expanding. Also, they have almond milk options for all coffee drinks!
Hint: try the "Maddie in a Basket" (vegan wafflewich made with a kale waffle)

Hastag breakfast is surprisingly McD like, just with waffles instead of buns! West Coast Wafflewich is delightful, just right for those who like small morning bites. Maple Bacon Waffle has Bacon made into the Waffle! That's another pleasant surprise. 

Strawberry Sunrise and Banana Berry is both very good healthy smoothie.

I found this place randomly about a year ago when I was craving some breakfast food on the way to UNLV. Just a quick search for "waffles nearby" and I came across this lovely gem, and boy, I am glad I did!
I've come here often enough for the staff to recognize me and have tried a number of things off their menu (and there's still plenty more to try!). I've recommended this place to people and have brought friends and family here, each trip ending up in a generally positive reaction the the food, atmosphere, and service.
The waffles and drinks offered here are numerous and delicious. From savory wafflewiches to sweet treats, theres something for just about anyone. The most popular item amongst the people I've brought here is probably the West Coast wafflewich or the Bananatella waffles. But if you can't find anything tempting on the menu or can't decide, you're welcome to create your own. And that can be anything--drinks, waffles, sandwiches, salads--if you can think it, they'll make it for you. Just to prove it, my boyfriend decided one day that adding chicken to their Bananatella would be a great idea (he's an interesting one). And while our server found it an odd request, they fulfilled it anyways. (Surprisingly, it didn't turn out that bad!) For the less daring, my personal favorite is a customization as well: the Strawberry Kisses waffle with bananas, paired with the Snickers iced coffee.
As for the place itself, the atmosphere is chill and welcoming. They have a nice rotation of music playing and a deck of cards on every table. The furnishings are quirky; tables with mismatched chairs, antique-style lights, and plenty of photographs and waffle-and-pop culture inspired paintings on the walls. It's a perfect place to eat and chat with friends or to catch up on some studying while sipping on some coffee. The servers are nice and friendly, always up to explain the menu and the new, seasonal items they're promoting at the counter (ex. Egg Nog Latte at Christmas-time or the Pumpkin Spice Waffle during the fall). The downside is that it gets pretty busy in the small space during peak lunch hours, and service can begin to get slow. The place isn't usually meant for a take-out and run, it's definitely better suited for people willing to sit, eat, and chill.
I definitely recommend this place to the Leslie Knopes of the world. In other words, it's the perfect place for a waffle-lover with time to chat.

Came here on my recent trip to Vegas because I didn't want the traditional pancake breakfast. This place is located in a strip mall so it was a little tricky to find. No menus just stand up and order from the board. The iced macchiato I ordered was absolutely delicious & came with a piece of churro waffle. My waffle breakfast sandwich was also very tasty and my grandparents loved their meals as well. My grandma had a red velvet waffle and my grandpa had a blueberry waffle. Cute little place and I would return next time I'm in town for your not so traditional breakfast experience.

AMAZING!! Their waffle sandwiches are so so good, and their prices are definitely affordable. I had a Waffledilla wafflewich. The Tiabi sauce is so good. It honestly didn't look like much when I got it, but the delicious taste will pleasantly surprise you. My parents got the West Coast wafflewich and the Savory Thai Basil wafflewich. Both of them loved it! I also got an iced Twilight Lavender Latte, which tastes like a lavender white mocha. It's on the sweeter side, so I personally LOVED it. However, if Starbucks type coffee drinks are not your thing, perhaps that's not the drink for you. ABOVE ALL, even if this place is a little out of the way from where you live, I still think it is definitely worth a try!!
This place is so cute! It has a great atmosphere, the staff is really friendly and the food is great!
I was looking for a quick snack and bumped into Tiabis which is right by my place. I've never had a waffle sandwich before and boy it is delicious!

This Waffle joint is a bit off the Strip in Vegas but well worth the time! Service was good and food was fresh. Coffee is locally roasted and very good! Toni B and I enjoyed the place and food. I recommend taking the time to find this olace.

I've gone here twice now after buying a Groupon worth $8 each for three visits. My first visit was early in the morning on my way to work and I decided to try one of their lattes and salads out. I ordered the green tea latte to drink there and the kale salad to eat for lunch later on. The green tea latte was very good. The size was reasonable and the price is what's expected even without the Groupon discount. The kale salad was also very good, decently proportioned and reasonably priced. The lady that was working there was very kind and helpful. It's good to say that my first experience there was rather pleasant and I was excited to drop by again to try the waffles.

I came in the second time with my boyfriend so that we could both try the waffles. I was looking forward to purchase the red velvet waffle since red velvet is one of my all time favorite flavors lol. After ordering, I sat down and waited for our waffles to be done. I noticed an uncleaned table the table over us. This table was not cleaned the entire time we were there. Now, I used to work at a food establishment and I can be very understanding in certain situations. One, the place wasn't busy. There were probably 4 people eating including us with a few customers coming in to order. Two, there were three people in the back because I counted 2 guys and 1 lady. One of the three could have easily cleared out the table the entire time I was there. It's just professional to keep your establishment clean. The workers seemed rather distracted and too busy talking to each other rather than checking the dining area for mess.

We finally got our waffles after 15 minutes or so. I feel like that's rather a long wait for just two small orders of waffles. I ordered the red velvet one (of course) whereas my boyfriend ordered the regular golden waffles. We both agreed they were good after finishing them. They only gave us two waffles per order and you'd have to pay an extra $2 for another one. But for the price, you get what you paid for so it was fine. However, on the website's menu, it says that you get more with the waffles like bacon and eggs. This is very misleading because I did not. It doesn't say on the menu at the store so I wasn't so surprised when I got my food. I just think that the website menu should be updated so that future customers are not mislead.

Overall, the waffles were good, the coffee was good and the salad was good. The customer service may need a little work however.

Couldn't stop talking about these waffles on our road trip. Luckily our trip began and will end in Las Vegas, so we are going to get some more waffles before we fly out! My brother loved the maple bacon waffle and I like the waffle sandwiches with turkey sausage.
Note to owners: One waffle is not enough....The waffles are so good, they should be sold in pairs.
Coffee is good also. It's nice to be able to get good coffee and breakfast in the same place! Staff is very friendly as well. It's located near Target if you need RT supplies, so a great place to have breakfast to begin your road trip!!

Delicious, healthy, unique & all around great. Also reasonably priced. Cute little spot with amazing coffee & waffles for coffee & breakfast lovers like me! They even have vegan & vegetarian options. Love the friendly, super welcoming & helpful staff. You must try this place. I'll be back to try more!

Came here since we heard good things about their other location.

We tried their West Coast Waffle and the Elvis one...the filling in the west coast one was good, as was the Elvis, but the one  thing I didn't care for was both of the waffles...spongy texture with barely any crispness. I like waffles with a  crispy exterior and a sft interior and this was like eating a pancake in waffle form.

The Snickers coffee drink we ordered didn't taste that great either. Very artificial tasting...The Churro waffle was okay too. Service was another issue...wrong things were sent to our table,  and when our food arrived,  there was no silverware down which took a while to get as well.

So-so first visit with a possible chance of returning.  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  3

This place was sooo good and plenty of vegan waffle options to choose from. Great great coffee. I got the churro waffle, with cookie butter vegan ice cream, and strawberries and bananas (which were super fresh). It was delicious and so flavorful. My sisters all throughly enjoyed there's too! Highly recommend it for vegans craving anything waffle.

Yummy!  From their speciality coffee creations to the waffle sandwiches...everything was so good!  The two ladies working also seemed to enjoy their job and life in general, which is nice to see. The only deduction made was due to the wait time.   Only one worker to prepare food?  Seems inefficient, particularly during a morning rush.
Great waffle place. Nice area. Cashier is great ! Will come again !  I tried the waffle is really good. And you get 10%iff if you check in .

This place is really cute- the atmosphere is hip and eclectic, and they even have decks of cards to play with at the tables. The establishment is clean, and they have a few  yummy looking things for vegans on their menu. The staff is passionate and friendly, and I loved the small business vibe that it had.

I didn't personally have a great overall experience there, but I realize from other's reviews that my experience was definitely not the norm.

When my fiancé and I ordered our food, I didn't think it would take much more than 20 minutes to get it on the table, but the guy working there did warn me that it might take a couple extra minutes. No big deal. After waiting about 45 minutes, I needed to leave for work but we had already paid for our food- which I found out hadn't even been started yet. There was only one other couple in the restaurant, so I went to find out what was going on. It turns out, the one person working there was filling a 30 sandwich catering order before making our 2 sandwiches. The owner/manager person came out to see what was wrong, and ended up basically yelling at her employee for not offering us a free upgrade to Belgian waffles so that he could use the other iron and get our sandwiches out quickly.

Now, yes, that would have been a smart thing to do, but what about the possibility of putting the only two waffles ordered in the last hour in front of the 30 catered waffles? Or the possibility of not charging for the meal we had to take to go and I still ended up late for work? Or at the very least not chewing out your employee for a unfortunately handled circumstance that could not have possibly been covered during training? 

Also the manager/owner lady was worried that I would give her a bad review on yelp, and kept bringing it up and asking that the employee's mistake wouldn't cost her a good review. I don't go on yelp just to give people bad reviews, but it's not often that I have an experience this bad either.

The sandwiches and coffee themselves were absolutely fabulous, and since the service was definitely situational, I would not be opposed to going back sometime to give it another shot. Even more than being late for work and not getting any sort of complimentary item as an apology, I just really don't appreciate the lack of professionalism that the management showed the day I went in. I've been in situations where my boss embarrassed me in front of customers before, and it's really the worst thing.

But like I said, it was just a poorly handled situation, and the food was so dang good that I would not be opposed to giving them a second chance- I'm just not chomping at the bit to walk through those doors again.
Oh. My. God. This place was so delicious. Go. Just Go.

Definitely a must-try! 

The waffles here are the bomb but what really surprised me that I loved was the coffee. As a barista, I can be a bit of a snob when it comes to it but every time I have gotten the coconut truffle iced coffee here it has 1) woken me up and 2) made me want to come back for more. This is a small feat considering how high my tolerance is for caffeine. I love it. 

The atmosphere is great for having a conversation, grabbing some lunch, or lounging about and I love the Guam seal incorporated in the back drawing! Also, Tiffany the owner is often working along with the other baristas and is great to have a conversation with, always remembers me, and the other baristas are friendly as well.

My fiancé loves their black coffee and waffles too. I am pretty sad that I'm not near UNLV all the time any more during the day so stopping by for now will have to be a treat but whenever I'm in the area I will make it a point to swing by!

Waffle looked and tasted great!!  Lots of options if you like waffles, Just wish the bacon was thicker. The staff was very friendly and made sure you understood your options or would make something for you.
First time in Vegas and tiabi was recommended by my cousin who lives here. A few minutes away from the strip but well worth the drive. Terrific prices for excellent waffles that are healthy too!

Delicious and friendly staff/owners! I went here with some friends after a hike with at Mt. Charleston and this was definitely what we craved! The 'Waffle macchiato', which was actually a cinnamon vanilla latte that came with a delicious cinnamon sugar covered waffle was PERFECT. We all enjoyed (this is a very modest statement because everything was fantastic) our food. We will be coming back again!

My best friend and I came here for brunch probably around 10:30am, and it was amazing! We both had the Dirty Mocha Chai, she had the Kisses and for me, Churronimo. Dirty Mocha Chai had good flavor, right amount of strength and not too sweet. The waffles were delicious! The staff is super friendly and the place had a great atmosphere. When we went it was easy to find seating. It was a really nice place to chill and hang out. I would definitely want to stop by again.

I really wish I could take this coffee shop back with me to Los Angeles! Very accommodating to a plant based diet. I got the lavender coffee and it was amazing!!! The ambiance and the workers were both very nice. I am impressed with this place :) this waffle is amazing. Best waffle I have had since I've been vegan.
Love love love this place. Best drinks and smoothies. I love their Thai basil waffle sandwich too. Just an awesome local place.

It's a cute little restaurant. It was busier then I expected for such a small restaurant but everyone was still really nice. The food is actually priced really well (especially for being vegan). The food and the coffee were great! Definitely worth trying.
This place is good. The chicken sandwich (west coast ) was one of the best I've had in town so fresh! #NomNomNom

Passed by Tiabi so many times. I Finally got in for brunch with my siblings. Nice and close environment with friendly staff . I absolutely loved the menu especially the vegan option. Ordered a waffle with bacon, egg and cheese, don't recall what I ordered but good portion size and flavor. I recommend coming here for breakfast with some friends or just to hang out on your day off.

OMG!   The best waffle ever.  Had a Belgium waffle. It was light crispy and DELICIOUS!  I love waffles.   But it is hard to find a good one.  This is the place!  Every thing is made here including the whipped cream. Got a chai latte coffee.  It was perfect.

Random place my friends and I chose while yelping brunch, after getting gas. I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with brunch because he always misses breakfast. Right when we came in, they greeted us. Since it was our first time here we took a while to choose what we wanted.  I ended up ordering a West Coast. It was okay! I wish they put more chicken. The cheese melted with the waffle which made it taste good! I also ordered a honey cream latte. I'm no coffee person so I can't tell what coffees are good but my friends and boyfriend said it was "really" good. The last thing I ordered was a Red Velvet. I personally liked it because it wasn't as sweet. It kinda bothered me because it was so perfect... (Hahahaha). I had a weird urge to stab the holes... When I'm near Vegas again, I am definitely coming back! 

Stars for the customer service! There was one lady who was kind of rude but then two other employees took her place right away when they saw our faces from smiles to me and my friend looking each other giving "She's so rude" look. (Yes, it's a thing haha.) Usually they would charge for Avocado and Chips but they just gave it to us for free with a smile. Thank you again! :D

Rate: 3.5

So glad I came here!! There is a variety of different type / style of waffles. ..from breakfast to lunch/ snack.

Southern waffle: diced ham, melted cheese, w/ avocado. 

Prices: very affordable. 
Environment: clean and friendly

One of our fav breakfast places- you order and sit so it's a great place to go with kids because you won't have to wait a long time. Healthy options as well as sweet ones and we've always had nice customer service.

Wow. SO glad I stopped by this gem on my way out from Vegas! Small place with big flavor! I tried the West Coast with an added egg....delicious their coffee is pretty on point too, great morning after food options and the staff is simply awesome

#breakfast sandwich was super delicious. Waffle with scramble egg and maple bacon. Jon had the strawberry Kisses breakfast. Both were served hot and scrumptious!  We shared a Strawberry Sunrise smoothie.  Oh my gosh, it was just the right sweetness from the fruit.  All the people  working here a are great, so friendly!  I really appreciate that.  The cherry on top of this put stop is the prices. They are so reasonable.  What you need after a three day stay in Vegas!  Lol. Let's just say I am super satisfied!

This is soooo yummy but ad for a diet.....yikes! Waffles & Coffee was so good. Only down fall is they need more staff and use plastic disposable utensils and plastic disposable cups for water. I will definitely be back. I have to bring my son here. Oh and there is. Groupon.....bonus

In town for the weekend and need a quick breakfast joint. Tiabi is the place to go! The customer service is wonderful and super friendly. Not only that but they're vegan waffles so I can't complain! Especially since my boyfriend is super picky on what vegan food he will eat with me since he's not vegan but he loves it here! They have great smoothies and a awesome choice of waffles. But definitely let them know you're vegan maybe tell them twice because I told them I was vegan and they made my waffle completely not vegan so I had to order something else and by the time I got it my boyfriend was already finished and ready to leave. :/ The Viva La Vegas is super filling and yummy. The waffles also feel very light and not heavy in your stomach! Defiantly check it out if your in town!

Friendly service with sweet treats. Enjoyed my coffee, I forgot what it was called, something like a Joe Special I think. Remembered it was sweet and satisfying. My friends had their own coffee and waffles and were happy. This place will make you smile :-)

I used to hate waffles once upon a time. I've never been a breakfast gal, so waffles never tickled my fancy. 
But in 2014,I found myself pregnant and working in Alaska. I happened upon a waffle house and ate there with my co-workers. They had the best pancakes I have ever had, with a ham and egg waffle that was divine. 
Since then I've been on the hunt for a waffle that could compare. I thought maybe those waffles tasted good because I was pregnant, like how many foods taste better when under the influence of certain substances. 
But I persisted. I have eaten at a few waffle places here in town and the waffles here are the best ones I have had yet. The maple bacon waffle reminded me so much of the waffle up in Alaska that it is all I can think about wanting for breakfast. The only thing that stops me is that I live in green valley and I already drive for a living so I avoid it at all costs. 

COME HERE AND EAT THE WAFFLES. Take it from a formerly-pregnant-lady-turned-mom-who-used-to-hate-waffles-but-now-only-likes-the-really-really-really-good-ones.

Great waffle bar, very affordable. Go for the great choices & yummy buttery waffles. Family friendly, nice environment. The sweet & savory choices were very good. Mocha latte & wild berry lemonade were delicious. The only negative was the bacon. My family loves breakfast and the bacon tasted like microwaved bacon. The staff was awesome & they even brought my baby girl warm soy milk...lifesaver.(that's like her morning coffee-she can't function without it) Overall we really enjoyed this place & we will be back, everyone gave the waffles a 10!
This is a cute coffee shop that makes amazing drinks and food. The atmosphere is very nice. The food is made so fresh and it is a great breakfast and coffee shop! Definitely worth a try!
If you're looking for some buttermilk chicken wings and waffles, this is not the place but If you are craving a wholesome vegan made to order waffle with grilled chicken, this place is for you.
This place is amazing! They have great waffles, shakes, sandwiches, salads, espressos and cookies!! There are tons of vegan friendly dishes too. It's a great spot, really happy we found it!

Best darn waffle I've ever had! If you're visiting Vegas, this place is definitely a must! Good food, great service! I subtracted 1 star only because they are so busy, they can't clean off the tables fast enough and seating is limited. Still, I would return in a heartbeat, it's so good!

It was ok. Great place if you have any dietary needs! Their gluten free waffle was amazing, Adams their vegan ice cream was quite delicious as well. Pretty good coffee, although a little burned. The inside was mostly clean, but kind of run down.

Can I have a waffle, a waffle, and a side of waffle? :D

This coffee/waffle inspired shop is a hidden sweet tooth haven. It's tucked away in a plaza off by UNLV. When you walk in the aroma of hazelnut, baked goods, and coffee tingles your nostrils and it's goood. I ordered Tiff's Special which if memory serves me right is a caramel vanilla machiatto topped with a waffle and I had to get a loaded waffle dish (Toppings include: bananas, Nutella, almonds, and whip cream). You get two waffles which is perfect if you're hungry or to share if you're just looking to snack. The coffee was fresh/strong/sweet/milky which made for a great combo. If you're looking for sweet, comfort food on a chilly day this is the place to be.
Best waffles in town hands down!!! And they are veggie & guilt free too. I will be going back a lot for the iced coffee too!

Came in for waffles at 6:00pm on a Monday. Place was dead. I thought this place had a lot of promise. But, it seems the kids behind the counter were distracted with their social lives and dating. My waffles came out cold as shit with no butter. When I got butter, the waffle wouldn't even melt. Really poor time management, we watched as our waffles sat on the counter waiting to be dressed while they did other things. Waffles weren't terrible, but who likes cold ass waffles? I asked if that's how they normally do and the apathetic kid said no, and would I like them to heat it up. Who like nuked waffles?  I'll stick to places run by adults. Too bad.

Excellent mom/pop Cafe in the Central area in Las Vegas near UNLV. The few times I've been here in the past months have been amazing. The Baristas are very engaging and accommodating to your needs. The owners are very passionate with Coffee and inventive with their food items that they offer. 

**A little FYI, I'm good friends with these former green apron workers for years. If your interested about their background ask about their story and how they come to have a coffee shop. Personal favorite is Stiles Java Jolt and West Coast Wafflewich, must try items along with Tiff's Waffle Macchiato and Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee drinks. Ambience is pretty much straightforward with emphasis on artwork and pictures of random travels of the owners with a hipster vibe. 

Cool place to hangout with friends and expect a lot of millenials and tourist here since it's near LV Blvd.

An extension of there original Maryland Pkwy. Location. The staff is friendly and manage by Tiffany S. one of the owners. She will always make you feel welcome and aims to pleased everyone she meets. Everything here is great and finally tried their Thai Basil Wafflewich today which was simply amazing, must try.

It's great to see an independent coffee shop in an area that is underrated. Kudos to Paul and Tiffany Stiles!!! for being part of a community that deserved something unique and truly TIABI - (To Inspire And Be Inspired).
Excellent food & service. I will definitely be back. Lots of Vegan options and super friendly staff.

I never knew how much I needed churro waffles in my life until today! My friend and I split a Strawberry Kisses, which was absolutely delicious. The waffle was crispy and definitely reminiscent of churros, but not overly sweet. It was nicely topped with a chocolate drizzle, whipped cream, and strawberries, and tasted just as good as it looks. I got the Snickers iced coffee, which was fairly yummy - more on the sweet side rather than having a strong coffee flavor. My friend got the lavender latte, which was presented with a cute latte art heart. I'm eager to come back and try more items from here!

Cute little place. Fast and friendly staff. The Elvis waffle was to DIE FOR!!! They have a huge selection of coffee drinks, waffles and waffle sandwiches. Leave room for dessert!!! Even the bathroom is adorable.

The waffles are very crispy and good! I got the lavender drink and also the peach drink but neither was very good. Both felt like there was something missing. The vibe of the place wasn't there; and it wouldn't be somewhere I'd sit and enjoy eating at. Especially since they are going for a cafe type place. The customer service was subpar as well. It took the person 5 minuets to actually acknowledge us even though we were the only people there.

A bit pricey for some waffles and coffee, but VERY WELL worth the money (and wait, since my boyfriend and I had enough time to play solitare and a couple of games of speed before our food came). The lady noticed that I was vegan when I asked for almond milk with my mocha frappe and she gave me a heads up and let me know they use milk for the base so I ended up just drinking water instead (which is free, they have a cute little water station). I ended up ordering the guru burger and my boyfriend got the vegan wafflewich and we also decided to get the churronimo. It's a quick little breakfast bite but it was so good! I know I'll end up coming here from time to time now that I know about this place.

Nice place, close from my house!!
Update review
- Slow day no  to much people sitting, slow service; 4 people in the kitchen they talk to much don't work, using the cellphone. Bad service today!! 
I ordered breakfast Sandwich 'cause they're out of avocado, It came first my waffle and then my coffee . I returned the waffle the egg was overcook tasting like plastic with a lot of black pepper.
The waffle machiatto was really good.
Then I received My waffle, honestly didn't like it to much, the turkey sausage very dry I believe the used the same that came at the first time. 
Maybe bad day, but the service is the same slow when is not even busy .. 3stars

The unique menu options and affordable prices make this place a great breakfast joint in the Las Vegas area. Though the preparation of the food isn't speedy by any means (~15-20 minutes), it's well worth the wait. It's uncommon that you find a place with exceptional coffee options AND tasty breakfast food. 
The breakfast sandwich I chose was well crafted with the perfect balance of each of the contents inside. The coffee was also noteworthy. 
Another aspect of this gem of a restaurant is the prices. For being situated in Las Vegas, the prices are reasonable for the amount of food you get.

We are from out of town and looked on yelp. We found this place and decided to come. It is kind of a hole in the wall and a little hard to find. When we came in  though it was really cute. The person at the front was really nice. We got a kisses waffle that was really good. Not like a waffle i have tasted before also got a vanilla latte with whipped cream that was super good. The bacon waffle also looked good. Next time.

I keep on coming back every time cz I started to crave waffles now that I know what they are. I actually had waffles for the first time in my life at Tiabi and I don't regret it at all. 
Girls that work here are so welcoming.  Feel like I'm invited to their house, and they're such amazing hosts. CLEAN and healthy. Very tasty .. The owner gave me this vegan cookie to try as a sample and I tell you.  It tastes amazing.  I'm not vegan nor vegetarian but I'm in love with this place.

Great little place near McCarran Airport. If you need to catch a morning flight out of Vegas, do yourself a favor and spare yourself the airport food and have a great waffle and coffee here before your flight!
Awesome spot!  Fun, fresh, funky great waffles!  Fantastic service from the fun and extremely nice employees!  You should order two things though if you like to eat a little more than average..

I thought this place was going to be a little different. I thought it was going to be more like a diner and not a cafe. I had a bacon and maple waffle and it was delicious. My two year old ate most of it. I also got the pistachio latte. Amazing!!!! The things I didn't like, there was only two people working so it took a long time to get our food. Each meal came out one at a time. My youngest fell asleep before his breakfast came. The other thing I didn't like was that they didn't have high chairs. That means that I can't bring my kids back. So I would say great food but not really as family friendly as I was expecting for a waffle place.

THIS PLACE. First, the waffles - slightly crunchy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside. Combine that with a wide assortment of their toppings and you're golden. Go for extra decadence with their drinks - boyfriend ordered their tiff macchiato (comes with 1/4 churro waffle!) and I ordered their tuxedo frappe, both of which were fantastic, if a little on the richer side. We are visiting Vegas only for a few days and so far we just haven't been able to have something other than Tiabi for breakfast. Kudos to the guy behind the counter, who was really friendly and made sure we enjoyed our stay!

I searched for the best breakfast in the local area I was staying a got here. Our first impression upon arrival was a very small coffee shop and nobody behind the counter working. No worries because we had never been here before and wanted to check out the menu. After 5 minutes and no signs of employment in this place we asked the only people in the place if this was usual to have to wait and asked if we needed to ring the bell to get service. So we did and a girl who looked like she wasn't to happy to see us came around the corner and asked what we wanted 10 ft away with no greeting. We proceeded with our order and our awkward exchange with this unhappy employee who appeared to be working solo. I was horrified when my food arrived the hashtag breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage. See attached pic and let it speak the words that I don't want to describe. Lets just put it this way, just stop and get a Mcgriddle from Micky D's and save yourself time, $$ and not to mention your taste buds.

Delicious local spot. Lots of sweet and savory options. I had the west coast and it was the perfect combination. My kids had strawberry waffles and my husband had the breakfast sandwich. They were happy to customize it and everyone was happy. I wish I lived closer. I'll def. be back next time I'm in Vegas!!

Totally random in a weird little shopping plaza. Quaint inside, but everything we ordered was delicious. Hard to find a good vegan waffle and this place has it! Also, the woman behind the counter that served us was super nice.

I wanted waffles for breakfast and this was close to school so I decided to go check it out. I ordered the the Banana Nutella Waffle from the classics and it was delicious! They have many options: sweet, savory, waffle sandwiches and dessert waffles. It was filling and a good breakfast. The prices were about $7-9 depending on what you get. You can sit in or do to-go. I did to-go because I had work. I'll definitely be back and would like to try the Red Velvet Waffle and waffle sandwiches next time. You also get a discount if you show your UNLV Rebel Card.
Awesome vegan options and jay was knowledgeable and friendly. Will definitely be back!

I was very impressed with this place.  Great food selection and prices.  My waffle was delicious, but it was so hard to decide which one to order.  There were so many delicious and unique options that you will not find anywhere else.  There is an equal variety of coffee drink options for those wanting to get coffee somewhere other than a national chain.  You will not be disappointed.  The only caveat I have is that the tables are small and there are few of them.  Seating is limited, although there was outdoor seating for when the weather warms up.

I love tiabi it's one of my favorite restaurants, the honey I'm home waffle is seriously so good it doesn't even need syrup. All the waffles are incredibly moist and delicious. I wish the prices weren't so high though! Without the groupon I would never go
Been her a week! Ate a lot at multiple places! Best food I've had! This place is delicious!!!!!!!!!!

A quiet lovely place away from the noisy casinos for good waffles and coffee. Love my red velvet waffles with bananas and strawberries, drizzled with chocolate syrup. The wafflewiches were also delicious, although was not big enough portion for big eaters like us for lunch, more like a snack size. Didn't have a chance to try their smoothies. Will have to visit again.

I love it! Almost all options are available in a vegan version. Yum!
I am moving, and am so sad I will not longer be able to come here. So I made one last trip today. I hope they consider expanding so I can enjoy the yummy items here once again.
I absolutely love the service here and the food. They have really perfected the art of the waffle!

I've been here twice now, both with Groupon or LivingSocial vouchers. The food is very reasonably priced without them, so I'd probably go back anyways. Around $6 for a delicious waffle sandwich. I'm not a huge waffle fan, but these are light and fluffy and make a great base for a delicious egg and sausage sandwich. Staff is super friendly. Last time I was in there I ended up chatting with them for quite some time before heading out of town. A+

The customer service was great. 
The shop was very cute.
The coffee was delicious.
However, I was not impressed with the food. I had a breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage and it leave me with a huge tummy ache.

Heading out of Vegas and was looking for light fare that was reasonably priced (unlike everything on the Strip).  Came across this gem on Yelp and had to try it out.  Had the veggie breakfast sandwich.  Yum! Girls had dessert for breakfast, which is fine because we are on vacation!  Would definitely visit again when in town.

Came in here cause of the reviews , I was expecting for this place to be soooo good and to be worth the drive , but I didn't like there food at all , the sausages  looked like there are just put in the microwave and they just tasted horrible .!!!!! I also had asked for one of there ice coffees and was expecting them to give it to me in the jar like the  pictures I've seen in Yelp , but they gave it to me in a to go cup !!!!! I seriously won't be coming back here again. There food is just nasty !!!!!!
Great little Cafe, The Waffles and Coffee were great, as was the service. Also dug that they had a Vegan Waffle Option!
Good creative waffle combinations. The churro w mocha almond chocolate ice cream was spot on. Awesome drink choices too. Staff was friendly and helpful.

This place was super awesome! I got a South American Wafflewich which was amazing-it had a little spicy flavor but still super good! I also had a Honey Cream Latte iced and it was very sweet & super yummy!! I defiantly recommend this place!!
I love this place! Closest thing to Bruxie here in Vegas. Captain Berry Crunch a must!

This place is amazing. I had Viva Las Elivs and a wafflewich - and they're both fantastic. I grew up in Europe and we don't have anything remotely similar to the waffles at Tiabi. 

I'm definitely coming to Vegas to have these again. 
Actually - I'm in the car right now driving to Taibi to get another wafflewich
Really cool set up inside. I like the vibes it gives off. I got the banutella waffle and I would say it was okay. I would recommend the Elvis one.

Even though I'm only giving Tiabi 3 stars, I'll be back. Why? 
-The prices are fair
-the atmosphere is clean, welcoming, and work friendly
-the employees are extra helpful
-the food is just okay

While the waffle alone is tasty, there's nothing extremely unique about it. And when put in sandwich form, the only unique thing is that it's sandwich stuff....inside a waffle. If you're expecting to be full, you may need to order another menu item as well. 

Here's what I've had:
-Golden waffle- tasty basic comfort food
-Vegan Tiabi Waffle- no difference in taste/texture so also tasty
-West Coast Wafflewich- bland and not filling 
-Tokyo wafflewich (i think that's what it was called. pretty much chicken, lettuce, and special dressing)- bland and not filling
-Avocado Dream Smoothie - not my jam
-I had a really delicious Coconut/Lime drink not listed on their menu online

Like I did state before though, the atmosphere is top notch. Everyone is warm, friendly, and very helpful when it comes to making food decisions. The other day I was there to pick up the golden waffle and I was kindly offered syrup, utensils, a back, all with a smile :-D The service definitely makes up for the okay food, and I'll probably just stick to ordering things on the sweeter side as opposed to the savory (bland) sandwiches.

This place is my new favorite for breakfast or lunch. Their waffles are EXCELLENT, and who knew you could make a slammin savory sandwich or burger with waffles? SO FREAKING GOOD!! The smoothies are also delicious. I'm vegan and gluten free. The waffles are already vegan, just ask for the gluten free mix. They are super friendly and accommodating. Try the coconut bacon and the banana peanut butter smoothie. And the Tiabi sauce is great. Yay, waffles...!!

Food on point, service not so much. 20 minutes just to order and another 25 minutes to make it. Not sure why they have 2 people working on a Sunday morning but they definitely need more employees to man the long lines. Waffle breakfast sandwich was good, a little over cooked on the egg but the waffle was perfect. The coffee drink was tasty as was the chips and the fruit. I indulged in the banana chocolate almond waffle and that was the icing on the cake -great way to end a brunch.

Our Churro Waffle with Seasonal Fruits was Delicious.  I'm not exaggerating  my husband and I enjoyed it til the last piece .  My Honey Latte was very flavorful.  My husband and I will definitely go back .

I hate leaving negative reviews, but hopefully this well encourage management to make some improvements.

First of all they're basically a self-service breakfast restaurant. I wish I would have known that before coming, because the last thing I want to do when I go out to breakfast in the morning is carry a bunch of stuff to my table. For instance, my order required 3 plates, how was I supposed to carry that, they didn't provide a tray. 
The floors were dirty, my table was dirty and the tables all around me were also dirty. It's hard to enjoy a meal when there's so much uncleanliness around. Please clean your floors more often and take the time to clean tables once customers leave. Small details like this say quality.
My waffle was also crunchy and cold...
Sorry, again I don't like leaving negative reviews. The restaurant was super cute I think the self serve concept might be good enough for some people but when you're half sleep and just want some food it's not ideal. They did complete my order very quickly.

I really want this place to succeed (who wouldn't want two young entrepreneurs to be successful?)  but some improvements are needed. We were lured here by a Groupon offer. I hope this critique is viewed by the owners and taken into consideration with this in mind. I love the concept of a waffles and coffee shop. Our coffees and waffles were very tasty and we did enjoy the food (maple bacon and red velvet). However, a place that specializes in waffles really needs more than one regular waffle iron and I would also like to see the option of a Belgian waffle added. Heck there are even waffle irons that make waffles shaped like the state of Texas...that would be a fun addition. Invest in more waffle irons! When ordering coffee to drink in the restaurant it is much, much better served in a glass coffee cup/mug. The paper plates and very cheap plastic utensils did not provide the best presentation. At the very least try to budget for a better quality of eating utensils. Again- the coffee (an iced snickers coffee, a latte and a cupcake coffee) were all very good, so maybe glass mugs can be added to make them perfect. The atmosphere is okay but I would encourage the addition of some cozier seating and décor...I would have ordered another coffee and stayed longer. I liked the chalkboard wall. The place was a bit cluttered with trash, overflowing trash cans and our table was sticky with dried syrup from what seemed to be days old. There were no pastries in the pastry case which made me sad. The music was too loud at first but was adjusted and included a nice variety of genres. This place has big potential. I realize it takes a lot of money to open a business and hopefully the owners can make some adjustments and improvements to make Tiabi a place to return to. Good luck girls!

I went with a group of seven and all of our dishes were great. Their smoothies are large and super refreshing. Great vegan options, highly recommend the Elvis (yum!) The workers took their time to perfect all the waffles which made the wait time worth while.

My TIABI experience was top notch! It's locally owned by these two young girls from Guam who works there too. Mae is one of the owner & greeted us with a genuine smile. She gave us recommendations for a health nut like me and I was not disappointed! I always opt for the gluten free options and I tried their Hashtag Waffle with turkey sausage & eggs- it was delicious!!! My friend had the West Coast Waffle that had bacon, chicken, avocado with their TIABI sauce & she was speechless! The waffles had the right amount of crunchiness & sweetness at the same time- & the portions are huge! We had the Kale Champ (kale, bananas, orange, almond milk) & Tif's Waffle Macchiato that came with a cute tiny churro waffle with the drink (like an umbrella in cocktail drinks but you can eat the waffle & dip it in your coffee- yum!). Kale Champ was a champ! No bitterness & just a tad sweetness. The macchiato- Wow! Smooth, aromatic with a hint of cinnamon. The price is very reasonable- where can you have gourmet coffee or shakes with an out of this world waffle entree for just a little over $10 bucks?!  The place is simple with a local vibe touch to the interior- chalk board with cute drawings, a locker that has graffiti signatures from customers, and couches to relax or study. It's right next to Target near UNLV.

We came here after our Spartan race yesterday because we were craving for some good waffles. We heard about this place from the locals & drove there from the race site as fast as we could without getting a speeding ticket :-) We were still wearing our medals. It was such a perfect place to celebrate another successful Spartan race!

Great service, excellent local coffee and delicious waffle sandwich. Not greasy or heavy, left me full and not feeling like a fat ass. I look forward to coming back again, especially after a recent  terrible breakfast fail at Bruxies (gross!).

Kinda disappointed... I search good coffee on Yelp and show this shop. I got signatures drink ... coffee was okay. Maybe I should get waffles... next time I'll get waffle not coffee
And takes 15 min to get wifi

This is the best place for waffles and they are so good. They make waffles with whip cream and strawberries with chocolate. The waffle is so good that you don't even need syrup. Then to the drinks I tried the snickers coffee drink and it actually taste like snickers in drink form.

I have been to Tiabi a couple of times now and I have to say that I absolutely LOVE the service you get here. Of course the waffles are awesome and the drinks are to die for (Twilight Lavender Latte is amaaaaazing) but the folks working behind the counter are the real stars here. Whether it is systematically breaking down the menu so you get exactly what you want to eat or trying to accommodate food to your dietary restrictions, they are TOP NOTCH! Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to treat themselves.

This place just happens to be right next door to my favorite sushi spot in Vegas (see review for Sakana) so i'm really surprised its taken me this long to try out.

The girl working the counter was super bubbly and nice which is exactly how I want to be greeted first thing in the morning. There is nothing worse then someone working at a coffee shop in the morning who hates mornings.

We ordered:

Tiff's Waffle Macchiato- 4/5

Great flavor and I loved the cute little churro flavored waffle piece that topped off our drinks! My only disappointment came when they were presented to us in plastic drink-ware instead of the cute little mason jars we saw pictures of here on Yelp.

Bananutella Waffle- 4/5

Came out perfect with just enough crunch on the outside and soft fluffy waffle goodness on the inside. Covered in Nutella drizzle, bananas, and sliced Almonds. It was very, very rich. I ate 1/3rd of it I had to take the rest to go. I feel like this would of been better for dessert, too heavy for breakfast for me at least.

I will and forever have a soft spot for TIABI. When they first opened, I LOVED the welcoming vibe the owners gave me and my friends. They stopped by our table and shared with us that they were UNLV alums (go rebels!) and friends who decided to open up this cute spot together!

Since their opening, I've tried plenty of their menu items. With my go to being the West Coast. It's savory and refreshing (thanks to the avocado). Other notable favorites include Kisses and the Red Velvet Waffle for those with a sweet tooth.

The only thing about this place is that you never know what to expect with service. There are times when it would be swift, friendly, and efficient. You are going to be welcomed with a bright smile from the cashier and get your order in a reasonable time. But there are times when you are greeted with a blank, cold stare as if you've obviously interrupted them with their cleaning and get your order after a longer than usual wait.

Do yourself a favor and if you are return guest, do a call-in order. You wouldn't wait as long and you have more time to eat and less stressing.

I think this has to be the most California place I've ever found in Vegas and I loved it regardless. Waffles, coffee, smoothies- what more could you want from your neighborhood cafe? Service is pretty fast and super friendly. 

Wish I took a chance to try more items off the menu, but I'll just have to wait until next time I'm in Vegas. Glad I ran into this gem of a place.

I want TIABI.  I want To Inspire and Be Inspired, but first coffee.  

TIABI has become one of my favorite spots to satisfy my caffeine cravings.  My drink of choice is their Espresso Frankenstein (4 shots of espresso & agave blended with ice).  I will usually Frankenstein my Frankenstein by adding some of my own MCT, protein powder, and some heavy whip cream (only if my fat intake is too low).  This drink is enough to give TIABI the stars that I say they deserve.  First of all, the beans they use is local and comes from Colorado River Coffee Roasters.  If you're not familiar with CRCR, then look them up. CRCR can be found in other coffee shops around Vegas like Grouchy John's.  TIABI's Americano alone is good. Having it in their Frankenstein Espresso is the best.  There really is no reason for me to try any of the other drinks since I'm sold on their espresso.  

TIABI also serves waffles in a bunch of fun ways.  They got waffles with fruit, bacon waffles, red velvet waffles, Vegan waffles, a churro waffle, waffle sandwiches, and a waffle named Viva Las Elvis (banana & PEANUT BUTTER). I've tried their Waffledilla (chicken & cheese wafflewich) and the Break-The-Fast (bacon, egg, & cheese wafflewich).  The proteins inside really hit the spot. I'm more of a pancake guy, but still liked both wafflewiches.  Besides, waffles are just pancakes with Abs anyway. 

As for service, I think it's the best.  I have never had a bad visit and it's always nice when you're greeted by name.  TIABI is very small and there's usually only one person working.  If you're getting a little more than just a drink, then you should also expect a little bit of a wait.  Waffles can't cook themselves, right?  Overall, I'm more than just a fan.  I love the coffee here and after just one sip, I'm ready to inspire. 

TIP #1:  Hours 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM.  Closed on Monday.  I would be here a lot more if they were open earlier. 

TIP #2:  Get the Espresso Frankenstein

2017 Yelp Review #69

I used to visit the Aliante location on a weekly basis and I'm still bummed that the location has since closed.  My go-to drink is their Espresso Frankenstein (4 shots of espresso & agave blended with ice).  This location doesn't have it on their menu, but they're willing to create it on request.  I love this drink and will add my own scoop of protein powder to it. TIABI specializes in latte's and great coffee.  I'll make the trip out here at least once a month for their Americano.  They also serve waffle sandwiches with a creative touch. As for service, it's the best. The owner, Tiffany, and the staff at TIABI know me by now.  They know that I'm here for either the Espresso Frankenstein or a large Americano.  TIABI, I will see you soon.

Great coffee shop close to UNLV. Awesome food and nice place to come and study or just hang out. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend for anyone who loves coffee and/or waffles.

Very solid little cafe off the strip to get a waffle and coffee fix that won't leave you broke. The creations are also pretty darn creative so you don't really lose with any choice, sweet or savory.

I went with the Viva las Elvis cause peanut butter, bacon, and honey are a match made in heaven. My only complaint (and I feel like I'm disappointing so many people saying this) was that there was too much peanut butter. It completely overwhelmed the bacon. I also had visions about adding some chocolate to this dish so I stole a chocolate chip off my brother's waffle and yes, it was 100% worth it. Also, paired it with a honey cream latte - yum!

Brother went with the red velvet waffle. He said it was pretty simple, but it was still very good. Mom and dad shared their choices a wafflezilla and west coast waffle with a fruit cup. Both enjoyed the savory/sandwich twist for their breakfast and they were also impressed with the fruit cup which featured fresh chopped fruits. Mom had the pistachio latte, which is definitely more on the sweet, not really coffee side. The only caveat was that food prep was a tad slow. Each person's meal came out one by one. Hard to have a holistic breakfast this way....but it's a small operation. 

All in all, it was a delicious experience.

This place was pretty good, good coffee waffles were a bit crunchy for my liking however that's just me. The Churro waffle has the perfect blend of cinnamon sugar, add some banana on top and a scoop of ice cream makes it perfect. Would recommend to any waffle and coffee enthusiast. Picture: (Churro waffle with Birthday Cake ice cream and Banana, Coffee: Snickers iced coffee)

A very cute coffee shop with amazing food and of course coffee. I tried their Viva Las Elvis which is vegan when taking out the honey and it was delicious! I keep coming back just for that waffle. The atmosphere is calm and it's clean!

This place is pretty average, not really seeing the hype.  Got a breakfast waffle sandwich with basic food vendor bacon and eggs that looked like maybe they were frozen in a previous life.  The waffle itself was way too sweet in my opinion for being made into a sandwich.  The place is too small to be comfortable to sit and eat, and outdoor seating was taken at the time.  The owner I'm assuming said goodbye as I was leaving as he was conducting business at the table next to me, but that was as friendly as the service got.

The waffle was really good !
I would recommend this to a friend. 

Shout out to Jay for the good customer service!

This place really took a beating on Yelp from some of my friends. Did they have a bad day or what? Maybe they've just improved overall? I love this place so far.

TIABI has been over on Maryland near Flamingo for a quite a while now. Maybe it's just out of sight, out of mind for me (since I haven't been to neighboring restaurants like Sakana that often), but it's certainly not too far from one of my workplaces. I was able to stop by for lunch to try their menu at long last.

They seem to be having some issues with music skipping (streaming lag perhaps), but it's a pretty quiet place either way with plenty of seating for studying or just enjoying food and drink. Baristas have all been friendly so far, and it was easy to use the Groupons that I'd recently purchased.

The iced Snickers coffee ($3.35 for 20 oz large size) is appealing, even mildly addictive. Although it doesn't perfectly capture the peanut-y essence of the candy bar, its chocolate and hazelnut combo are a reasonably sweet flavor fusion that provide both fuel and happiness. Plus, it's quite reasonably priced compared to other places.

The West Coast waffle sandwich ($6.59) is an obvious choice for a savory lunch. I was pleased first and foremost by the lightly crispy and spongy, fluffy waffle that's creased so that you can just pick it up. The chicken and bacon satisfied my carnivorous sensibilities. The delicious, fresh veggies (avocado, tomato) brightened the dish up. Finally, although the sauce wasn't that distinctive alone, it served as a perfect complement. Nothing was limp about any of this.

I went for the Pumpkin Truffle Latte ($4.65 for a large) on my second visit, opting for hot rather than iced. What a treat. It's a perfectly sweet, creamy drink with a moderate spice accent, and I wish it wasn't just a seasonal item. Maybe if I just ask nicely and bat my eyes, it won't be just seasonal? It's the drink that has finally sold me on that whole annual fad.

I also had the seasonal Zombie Waffle ($6.50). This red velvet waffle has bacon cooked on the inside. I had to ask because they're not immediately visible, but using a knife (obtainable at a station near the counter) to cut and even cross-section the waffle, I saw the thin fatty strips. This dough otherwise had the same texture as my wafflewich, which means it rocked. Flavor-wise, it's actually mostly savory, with the chocolate syrup drizzle serving more to accentuate the red velvet batter than to tilt the balance toward sweetness. This also needs to be a year-round treat.

TIABI has impressed me so much on my two visits that I wish I hadn't been so apathetic before. It's a great spot for caffeine and fuel to carry you through the day, and I'll be back even after I use the last of my Groupon 3-pack.

I ordered the Vegan Wafflewich and a Pistachio Latte both were very delicious! Staff was super friendly and helpful if you've never been there before. I didn't realize until after I ordered that you can substitute the waffle for ciabatta on the sandwich. I would definitely recommend doing it if you aren't a fan of waffles.
I love this place, everything is so cute & it seriously feels so hip, the food hits the spot & the teas are super perfect
What a delightful find! We're semi-stranded waiting for a tire change and Tiabi came to the hunger rescue! Loved out waffle-sandwich and kale champ smoothie!

Found this place thru a friend. At first I wasn't too sure about stuffed waffles butttttt oh my goodness! Heaven! I had the Bananatella waffles. Nothing but amazing. Peach tea is def on point. My husband had the ALL American waffle and added egg to it, delicious!

It's really chill here, and the food is tasty. Everyone is very attentive and kind. There are great vegan options, and the food is fresh. Large variety of coffees. Try Wednesday bogo 1/2 classic waffles.

Tasty, but realistically 5-7$ for a single thin waffle is a little steep. Can't comment on any of their drinks, but their waffles were very light and crispy. 

To the guy who gave them a 3 star rating for their decor alone, I don't know what you're smoking but you really ought to stop.

From the moment you walk in this place... You are transported to Seattle coffee house that has mated with a gastropub (if there is such a thing). Anyway it goes, I loved it. The food was so good and the culture is one all it's own. The service was top notch; friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. I'm really impressed and look forward to the new menu.

It's a great place. I was sad when they closed the one down in North Las Vegas. I have noticed that the portions have gotten smaller. Especially, their waffles. I mean how much are you really saving by cutting down the batter? I gave them a three because I called for pick-up one morning (in a rush/tired/hungry due to finals and lack of sleep) and I was on hold for five minutes. It gave me enough time to enter the freeway and exit. I hung up and tried calling back and no answer. It was 7 in the morning.. I can't imagine they were swamped with people. I didn't even receive a callback.

The service was amazing and the ladies working, I believe owners a well, were so nice. I have had better coffee but I am from Seattle, and I hanger had much worst coffee here on Vegas. The vegan waffles were so good and moist as well. It is out of my way a bit, but could be a special treat every once in awhile

Every single thing we had was A*MA*ZING! We had the Tiff's waffle macchiato and it come with a churro waffle, kind of reminded me a pumpkin spice latte, must've been because of the cinnamon spice the kids had the bananatella with vanilla ice cream and my partner and I shared the viva las Elvis, I will definitely be coming and we highly recommend this place! Just look at the last pic to see how much we enjoyed it!

This little gem was amazing!!! We found it on yelp. It was off the strip which was a nice change. It's by a target shopping center. The place is small and intimate. The menu is on the wall and very easy to read. I got a coffee and it came with a churro waffle! See the picture. It was sooo delicious! My banana waffle had bananas, nuts, and nutella drizzled on it. It was so amazingly good. I would have gone again if we were staying longer. Definitely will go again next time I'm in town!

I Bookmarked this Place earlier, I had some time so I decided to give it a shot! 

It is a Cozy little Cafe located on Simmons & Centennial on the North side of Las Vegas. Right between Roberto's Taco Shop & a Little Casino ( don't know what the name was, sorry) Anywho, The Customer Service was Excellent, Tiffany who is also the Owner of this Establishment Greeted me, I told her it was my First time there, She explained how the drinks are made. You are able to see your drinks & Waffles being made, if you sit close to the Order Counter (there is a little window where the Kitchen is). BTW: Their Baked Goods are Vegan!

The little cafe itself is very clean, there are only a few seating areas inside, and on the tables are Playing Cards should a round of Poker, Go Fish, or Crazy 8's tickles your fancy...lol! They have added more outside seating if you prefer.

Parking stalls are a little crampy, so just be careful opening your car doors, lol!

I have found my little getaway, Sorry Human Bean & S'Bucks....This Lady is Supporting this Cafe instead!

I came in here for the first time and decided to try the pistachio latte, it was so incredible, sweet but not too sweet, smooth and creamy that when I finished it I decided to try the waffle macchiato as well. That was also great. The place was clean, bright and not overly loud. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, and the prices are very reasonable. I will definitely be back and would absolutely recommend this place to anyone.

This is a super cute hole in the wall coffee shop. I had to try the churro waffle. Jay was friendly and helped guide us through the menu. They have traditional coffees as well as signature drinks. My boyfriend tried the snickers. I tried the Twilight lavender latte. I also got it with almond milk. As someone who can't have dairy,  I love when I have other options beside soy milk.  They also have an extensive waffle menu and a vegan friendly menu, including vegan treats. I tried a kale chocolate chip cookie and was impressed with how tasty it was. I also tried the churro waffle. I would recommend getting it with ice cream I got it without ice cream, and it was a little dry but other than that it was really good. If you want to be adventurous, and try a churro waffle, you can add a quarter waffle to any drink for a dollar. It is a smaller Cafe, so it's much more friendly to smaller groups and more intimate settings. They also have Wi-Fi.

This place is heaven. No, seriously, it is.  Where else can one find green smoothies and scrumptious waffles in ONE place?

So eat the darn waffle, and then repent by drinking blended kale. Yup, pretty much,

As we walked in, we were greeted by happy faces and the scent of warm, delicious waffles. I was very impressed by the selection of vegan goodies they offered. But luckily, im not vegan, so it was time to indulge with deliciousness. We ordered the Banana Tella waffle and sat down. They make the waffles fresh for each order so we had to wait a couple of minutes. When the waffles came out I had one regret: we had ordered one to share. And although one is actually pretty big, this is the kind of dish that should never be shared with a lived one. Its seriously good enough to break friendships and end marriages. Luckily for my husband, I had a big lunch before it, so it  wasnt so bad (the sharing, that is).

If you like waffles, GO. If you like smoothies, GO. If you like coffee, GO.

Just go. Seriously. And order the banana tella. You are welcome.

Great waffle! Good prices. I had a vegan waffle with strawberries, whip cream and drizzle in chocolate. Amazingly tasty. I had a similar waffle on the LV Strio for a lot more. There are other vegan choices as well such as the guru burger. Well worth the drive to find this place. Will definitely return when back in town. Wish I had one near my home.

Super delicious and super friendly, plus their mantra is one that is close to my heart. I got the Viva Las Elvis waffle with Nutella added and it was an explosion of sweet and salty goodness in my mouth. The Snickers iced coffee was also good, but not as impressive as the waffle. I'll definitely be back.

My friend is an expert barista at Starbucks who knows everything about coffee, so when she asked me to meet her here for a cup, I knew it must be good! I'd never had vegan food before, so I figured I'd be adventurous and order one of the vegan waffle sandwich thingies - it even had a veggie patty on it. To my surprise, it was delicious! Everything was fairly pricey, but it was a fun new experience that made it worth it. Definitely the kind of place I'd go to right after getting paid. Oh, the coffee was great, too!
Like mentioned before, it's a hidden gem in Vegas. Their coconut basil tea was amazing, very refreshing! I've tried their west coast waffle which was great, not heavy nor greasy. Defiantly recommend!

I had high hopes because I believe that waffles are the ultimate breakfast food, but I was sadly disappointed in every aspect of my experience at Tiabi.

The gentleman taking my order had visibly unwashed hair with very bad dandruff. 

My waffle sandwich was extremely dry with a poor quality of sausage patty and overcooked eggs. 

My iced coffee came after my meal was served and was watered down.

I still have high hopes. I'd like to see Tiabi turn it around. They have a great concept, but they're not executing it very well.

I got the groupon for this place and decided to try it out with my family and another family after church. I can say that this place was overpriced for the amount of food that you get. We got the south american, the waffledilla, and the bannanatela and I was not amused. the food did not have any flavor and the chicken tasted like it came out of a can. It tasted like a watery sponge. It was very chewy. it also lacked flavor. the Waffles that came with every meal were over cooked and very dry. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Once I finish of this groupon I will never go back waste of 40$ P.s. their self proclaimed Frankenstein espresso wasn't not even strong or filled to the top. I got a large and it was filled halfway. Did I say it was expensive??!

One of our favorite places!! They have the best peanut butter smoothie and my kids love the waffles! Gabby is super sweet and always knows exactly what to recommend of the menu! Great service all around!

We just moved to Vegas and had picked up a friend in the area. I searched for breakfast places and this place popped up. I'm not a big fan of waffles but the signature coffee drinks looked good. Both coffee's that my husband and I got were amazing and the waffles are Incredible!!! Need to come back with the whole family.

Making this my ritual stop when visiting Vegas!  You are welcomed with the hip hop music and the cozy eclectic vibe. The staff is very helpful and patient with your abundance of menu options. Love how they offer Daisy Mozzarella option. The Pistachio Latte with almond milk hot, iced, and frappe is full of yummy .  The West Coast Wafflewich is good eats!  Crispy on the outside and soft inside.  Tiabi sauce was very flavorful.

Ok let me start off by saying i absolutely love this place super offbeat in the best possible way, the quirky decor and i love the huge chalk wall the message is totes me. Right away when you step into the doors you feel relaxed and welcomed. Between the chill atmosphere friendly staff you never want to leave, bonus they have playing cards on the table to entice you to stay a while. Perfect for an after work chill spot or rejuvenate after a long day of shopping!  The prices for the portions are redonculous! Averaging about $6 buck. I got the Banatella Belgium waffle and i know you can see my face but its covered in drool! the waffle is crispy on the outside and fluffy warm goodness on the inside i had mine topped with a scoop of Thriftys (yes i said Thriftys) ice cream and my waffle stood up to the scoop the bananas, delicious Nutella drizzle and almond slivers without ever getting mushy! My friend got her own creation (she's a bit of a mad scientist) She had the traditional waffle with chocolate chips, strawberries and caramel and she had no complaints. I will definitely be back hope to see you there!
Found this nice little place. The service was friendly.  The waffles were tasty.  I had the red velvet waffle.  I really enjoyed my peaches and cream latte.  Not too pricey of a place either.
Absolute best. Must come in and have the waffle macchiato. Just perfect. A Vegas staple for us. I also have the viva Las Vegas waffle. Great!

Really love this place. Purchased a Groupon which got me in the door but I will definitely come back. I ordered an Almond Joy iced coffee which tasted more like chocolate to me that any notes of almond or coconut but I still found it to be delicious. Had the break the fast and the South American. Came cut so that way my bf and I could each get a half of the sandwich to try it out. I like the crispiness of having a waffle as a substitute for bread and both of the sandwiches were satisfying. 

Recommend this place as the service was amazing. Everyone was very nice and welcoming from the moment you walk in. Also, they have a deck of cards at each table to play some games while you wait for your food. The bathrooms were clean and appealed to my inner nerd by having a Star Wars sign outside of the bathroom to indicate the gender.

This little waffle bar is adorable. It has a cozy ambiance. It is clean and the staff is friendly (hugely important). 

The waffles and sandwiches are warm and light and infused with amazing flavors and unique combinations. They are healthy comfort food stepped up a notch!

Add coffee, tea, smoothies and a laptop or a friend and you've got your morning or afternoon neighborhood place to go if you just want to kick back and you're not in a hurry. 

Bravo! Well done Taibi! You get it!

First off, Tiabi has both a Groupon and Living Social deal. The Groupon is $14.25 for 3 $8 deals. The Living Social is $4 for $8 or $6 for $12. 

The shop is in the same plaza as the Target on Maryland Pkwy. It is to the right of Target if you're looking at it straight on. The shop itself is cute with some couches and drawings on the walls. Unfortunately, that's the only good thing I have to say. 

The girl at the counter did not know how to use the Living Social deal we had. After calling 2 other workers over and charging us the wrong price she had to refund the entire order and start over. Also she never scanned the app so if I were not the good person that  I am, I could re-use the deal and get $12 of free food haha. You should probably teach your workers what to do with it!

After our food was made they placed the food on the counter and called our names, however we didn't hear them and the food ended up sitting on the counter for a couple of minutes.
