There were four workers in the store all standing around behind the counter talking. Take the time to bring the order out guys! It was obvious we didn't hear you and it wasn't like you were busy- it was the only new order you had.  I thought it was a little rude that you would call our name out again instead of just walking it over. 

We ordered the bananatella waffle and pac man waffle. The bananatella was good, but nothing I was impressed with/would want to go back for. The presentation of the pac man waffle was horrible. I hope there's a picture of it on here, because I forgot to take one. Who wants a waffle that's a quarter missing? 

The dirty mocha chai sounded amazing on the menu board, but it was all disappointment in my mouth. It was just a strange combination and did not work for me.

My first visit. I had the waffle macchiato with a churro waffle. It was delicious. Great combination of sweet and coffee. The menu has a lot more fun items to try. The place was inviting and had comfortable chairs. There are not too many tables so I am not sure how it is when it is super busy. Check it out.

Staff were really friendly and welcoming. They have really yummy drinks, teas and coffees. Their waffle sandwiches are really tasty. They serve their drinks in cute little mason jars. A great little hangout for friends and also a cool place to study.

Their churro waffle is amazing. Warm and crispy and the coffee is really good too! Tiff's waffle macchiato is my favorite. The place is nice and cozy, staff is super friendly. They are good for breakfast or brunch with their different waffle selections.

So very disappointed.  Maybe we came on a bad day.  It took 10 mins before either of the guys behind the counter bothered to look up and say hello.  We ordered waffles and regular coffee.  25 mins to get the waffles and when I asked about the coffees, the guy behind the counter got really snarky.  He said the were slammed and the coffee would be up soon . Seriously??  It was regular non fancy coffee !?  It finally came 10 mins after we got the waffles.  Coffee was like warm and the waffles weren't very good .   Oh  and there were maybe 14 people in this place, and 7 of them was our family !

The staff is friendly and even came around with free dessert samples...which now I may need to get because the churro waffle was incredibly good.  The prices are cheap (2 people 2 lattes a waffle-wich and a waffle was just about $20).  The lattes are great and unique (never saw a pistachio latte before) and the food is great.  If you want a cheap great place with a very relaxed coffee house type atmosphere check it out!!!

found this gem via living social.  
Break fast waffle (waffle, egg, cheese, bacon).  Simple and yummy.  I can see some people preferring some kind of sauce on this but this was right up my alley... perfect.
Ice cream taco waffle (waffle with ice cream, chocolate chips, and nutela drizzle.  Amazing!  I wish I didnt have to share this with the wife.
This was probably my favorite place I visited on this Vegas trip that included some much more pricey places.

I just love this place and the prices you can't beat. The employees are always super nice and welcoming. This was my first time getting an iced caramel macchiato from here. Its delish, espresso is strong and the caramel is buttery. Once you mix it all up, its perfect! Oh and the icing on top was the churro baby waffle (paid extra) but worth it!!

Love this place. Cheaper than Starbucks. I had the frankenstein espresso and hubby had the signature iced macchiato that comes with a waffle. Both delicious and huge drinks for under $10.  Minutes from the strip. Will def be back.

New coffee gem on the north side. I had the Tiff's Waffle Macchiato and it was so delicious with the little wedge of waffle and whip cream. Can't wait to go back and try the pistachio latte. Will definitely be a frequent flyer.

came here for brunch with my mom and loved it! We tried their Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee and had the West Coast with Chips and #Breakfast Sandwich and delisciously fresh baked Pecan Hazelnut cookie...YUMMY! Mom really liked her Pistachio latte and said it was creamy and complimented the espresso. The weather was perfect today so we also decided to sit outside. We love this location because it reminds us of the first location on Maryland Parkway and we're so glad that we can come here when we're in the Aliante area!
Delicious waffles, great coffee and amazing customer service! Will definitely be coming back :)

The place was playing classic rock which was an immediate plus. We were the first customers that day and the woman who was working at the time was very nice. I ordered a bananaetta (a waffle with bananas and nutella) and was not disappointed. The banana's were delicious. I also enjoyed the vanilla chai latte. This is one of the few places where I felt like I paid the right amount for what I received.

Great waffles, coffee and vibe. 5 mins from UNLV can't wait to go back and try a waffle sandwich. The waffle macchiato was amazing! Wish the cashier was a little more friendly considering it was our first time. Didn't really give any suggestions.  Deff worth checking out!

My review solely relates to the waffle sandwiches. I LOVE waffles and love idea of sweet and savory food but my craving for a yummy sandwich and chicken was only faintly satisfied. The problem was the flavor, or lack there of. I got the West Coast, which comes with chicken, avocado, bacon, tomato, cheese and Tiabi sauce. Somehow the sandwich was really dry and missed the flavor the mentioned ingredients should have given. The waffle had no crispiness or flavor at all. Super bland. This is my second time having Tiabi, the first was probably about a year ago and as i remember it was underwhelming as well.
I will try ONE more time and see if sweet waffles are better.
Best customer service in town! Delicious waffles i broke up with Starbucks to get my lattes here at Tiabi best coffee ever come try !

Absolutely love this restaurant. Officially one of my favorite spots to visit whenever I get back in town.  Waffle pack so much flavor however remain light and puffy. No one wants to feel sludgy and overfull at brunch time! According to society i have a tight restrained lifestyle of being a vegan. Tiabi provides many many options for me which don't include me yawning as i chew down, if you know what i mean. :)

This place was amazing and awesome and this is my new regular spot. I'm glad Ian told me to stop by and the Vegas option was great. I took a bite of her sandwich and was already prepared to be disgusted but it was actually amazing. I got a west coast and had to come back for the breakfast sandwich

This will definitely be a go-to whenever I'm in town! I ordered an iced coffee with the West Coast waffle sandwich & it was amazing! Chicken was tender, avocado ripe, bacon was perfect, & waffle was soft with a nice crisp. The staff was very friendly & Israel was helpful in suggesting items on the menu to satisfy my cravings. Atmosphere there is was casual & cozy with good music playing.

Not bad. I come here because it is so close to UNLV. Good drinks- try the waffle macchiato! 
Food is A-OK. I like that they have vegetarian and vegan options, but the waffles and sandwiches aren't anything too amazing or memorable to me. It's worth a try if you're really into waffles, but for me the food menu items are just whatever. So far I've had the cinnamon waffle, elvis, and vegetarian wafflewich. I'll keep trying more items and update if anything deserves recognition.
The location is a bit shabby so I make sure to bring my stuff with me. I wouldn't think of this place as comfortable- so it's not a place that you would want to study at. Eat, chat a bit with friends, and go. 
As for customer service, don't expect too much. They get the order done. 

Groupon has some deals for this business ($24 for $12 or so), so be sure to check that out.
Never had a waffle sandwich before. Exceeded expectations. Waffles were light and soft. Plenty of delicious looking options to keep us coming back

The food is amazing, the drinks are even better. A little pricey but totally worth it. I recommend the Butter Pecan Waffle with infused Bacon and ice cream. Also hot espresso with a scoop of ice cream.

Enjoyed a simple Mother's Day lunch at this fun spot in the Target shopping center. We each got a different waffle and shared. My daughter always goes for the breakfast sandwiches and got the Hashtag sandwich. She loved it. I got the Waffledilla and the hubby got the West Coast Wafflewich. All were very good. Unfortunately, their Belgian waffle machine was down, so we couldn't try that type of waffle. Also, the drinks look yummy, but we just opted for water. Service was very friendly and there were games and cards around the tables leading to a killer game of War (I did not win).

Looking forward to returning soon to try one of the sweeter concoctions.

Just disappointed with 2 out of 3 of my experiences here. Food is good, when it's served hot, but very inconsistent. I'm not sure if this place is owned by a teenager, I know they have to work too but proper training is definitely necessary here. My first experience my food was cold and they forgot the strawberries and syrup, really it's waffles. My second time was perfect, hot food, good coffee. This third time,c'mon who makes a dirty Chai with hot chocolate. And it was cold, so when I asked to steam it hotter he brings it and it was basically a hot chocolate, then argues that dirty Chai is made with chocolate. I've been drinking coffee longer than he's been alive and anyone knows dirty Chai is with a shot of espresso. Anyway this will not detour me from giving a LAST chance, however I hope training is in order. Thank you. I'm not mad at you, but consistency is key, "consistently good that is".
Great waffle spot! The butter pecan waffle is really good. This is not a full service breakfast spot, just waffles or waffle sandwiches. Great treat, good coffee selections!
BEST PLACE EVER! Crave the west coast for days!! The waffle macchiato is amazing! Tiabi is so wonderful and a great vibe. Wish they stayed open later!
I fell in love with their pistachio latte.  awesome.. I had their sandwich which was awesome too.

Great little place, food was good, coffee was excellent. No-frills fee, limited seating - but a great breakfast. Waffle breakfast sandwiches were good. Will be back for sure. First had TIABI at the Maryland Pkwy location.
Good breakfast...the waffles are okay, not great but well made...all the items we tried did not disappoint...if you want a change in breakfast this is good alternative...

Traveled off the strip on our Vegas trip to this cute little waffle shop and we were not disappointed. We got the Viva Las Elves waffle and the Bananatela waffle. (I substituted the Nutella  for chocolate) Both were excellent !!

Hands down my favorite place when I need a carb (waffle) fix.  LOVE the recipe (though they could bring back the almond flavor) and they have vegetarian selections which is great for my friends who follow that lifestyle.  We can all enjoy a day out together.

Offers vegan options 

Had the vegan wafflewich and the twilight lavender latte... Amazing will definitely be back!

I stumbled across this place early in the morning & might I say I'm pleased I did the breakfast is amazing I ordered two waffles one for me and one for my boyfriend I didn't eat mines so my boyfriend added ice cream to it overall he said it was good I got the waffle sandwich eggs avocado tomato it was delicious just wish they had some type of sauce to add to it imagine eating a breakfast sandwich with no sauce just dry the food here is great but the wait time various i waited over an hour for a sandwich one time & the restaurant wasn't packed so give yourself some time when here
Food is good, but how do you serve a waffle with no butter  not as enjoyable so there's that, hopefully my server is more aware next time

Great coffee drinks horrible service. Wait over a hour for waffles and fake eggs. Under manned and over priced . Not sure if I would go back. But the coffee cake BZB was fire! Luke the thought of the wafflewich but dry and needs a real egg....  which would also make it less dry if the egg was over easy.

Another win. I love finding hidden gems when home, traveling for business or pleasure. From the moment we walked in until the "Goodbye" we received when we left Tiabi, i was called to tell the world, from my Instagram post and first snap of the morning. The atmosphere is refreshing. Music was on point. Food and coffee were flavorful and unique. They have vegan and vegetarian options. Tiabi really caters toward any pallet. I will be back.
Very convenient and friendly atmosphere,2nd time coming here and it's great to walk in and order right away

The lightest, crispiest waffle I've ever had wrapped around delicious bacon, basil and a perfect, flavorful tomato. Friendly staff, cool artwork. Great environment to enjoy a fantastic breakfast. You simply have to try this place.

Best place for coffee !! Better than Starbucks !! Mika and lueck are always awesome sorry but don't really know everyone else's name yet lol I work next to them at Sakana. So I always get big orders from them and they are always awesome and everything I try is always good ! Gingerbread man frappe with expresso is my new favorite must try !!

I came to Tiabi to scope it out for future use with my dessert meet up. I am not hugely familiar with that area, but it was easy enough to find. Up the street from the Boulevard Mall, in the Target parking lot. 

When I arrived I was kind of nervous because we were the only people there on a Saturday around 4pm. I took the lack of business as a bad sign, but I was wrong!! Maybe not enough people know about it?? I'm not sure, but if you aren't going to Tiabi, you are totally missing out.

As I said, this was a recon mission, so I had to order a little of everything, right?? We ordered 3 of the Wafflenuts - the white chocolate macadamia, the red velvet, and a vanilla one that wasn't listed on the menu. For waffles we got the Strawberry Kiss, but instead of strawberries we subbed bananas (on a Belgian waffle) and customized a classic waffle with blueberries and white chocolate. Everything was fantastic!! Everything was cooked to order perfectly. Hot, melty, sweet and so delicious!! I almost always get a to go box, and this is one of the few times ever that it was so good...I couldn't stop. No to go box needed.

The have lots more on the menu I would like to try...including their coffees. I am excited to go back. I, also, heard there might be ice cream coming in the near future. Fingers crossed!!

You should definitely check them out. They are worth a drive even if you don't live down that way. They are pretty affordable...$20 for everything I ordered plus a bottle of water. Portions are perfect...not too big or too small. The establishment is clean and relaxed. They have games and decks of cards on the table should the mood strike. Staff is super friendly and helpful.

I will definitely be back!

My boyfriend is extremely particular when it comes to his morning coffee and this place was as close to his Illy cup he makes at home. We weren't planning on eating breakfast here until the owner told us they had gluten free waffles!!! The chef thoroughly cleaned the waffle maker for 10 minutes before making our waffles. It was well worth the wait and he did it right in front of us ( the kitchen is open).  
The owner is welcoming and told us they have vegan and gluten free items. I also noticed they had bakery items (from a different maker) that are gf and vegan. 
I ate the wafflewich with eggs, cheese, and turkey sausage. Yummy! Best of all, The (regular) waffle was flawless: warm, crispy on the outside, and chewy on the inside. Even better dipped into the tasty maple syrup!  
My boyfriend got the gf waffle. He loved  that the whipped butter was soft and spread evenly. Melted right away!

This place was great! Fantastic coffee (pistachio and their notorious waffle coffees were amazing!) Waffle breakfast sandwiches were terrific. They ran out of turkey sausage which sucks, but even with bacon, the sandwich was really good! Would highly recommend! Affordable and great tasting food and coffee.

I'm glad I came across this place. local spots are much more engaging with customers and the vibe and atmosphere is great if you want to enjoy some good espresso.  

Super friendly and the food is tasty...crispy to perfection.
The vegan waffles are to die for! My only complaint is that the service is quite slow, so make sure you have plenty of time scheduled for your meal.

I've had a waffle sandwich!  Bucket list item completed.  The West Coast Wafflewich was excellent.  Great combination of chicken, bacon and avocado.  Nice coffee selection as well.  Tiabi is a nice spot for breakfast, lunch, dinner or anywhere in between.  Fast Wifi connection too.  Sign me up.

Delicious and unique! Their selection of both coffee and waffles is nothing I have ever seen before. I love that. We got the Snickers Iced Coffee and Twilight Lavender Latte. Snickers Iced Coffee is smooth and tasty with chocolate and caramel. My husband's latte was out of this world. Never would I have thought Lavender in a coffee would taste so amazing. It's a subtle end note that really makes the drink shine. Our Maple Bacon and Strawberry Kisses Waffles were perfectly crisp. The toppings were just enough to add some except flavors, but didn't over power the delicious taste of the waffles themselves. Overall, very impressed! Go check this place out!

This place is great! We just discovered it and ate here twice in two days. The waffles are the perfect mix of soft and crispy. I had one folded into a sandwich with bacon egg and cheese. The bacon was crispy and eggs fluffy. So good! We also tried the butter pecan waffle with candied pecans on top. The best! To top it off, their coffee drinks are delicious too. And in cool flavors like coconut truffle, honey nutmeg, or lavender latte. They aren't too sugary, and the espresso is awesome. They have cool tea flavors too. I want to try them all!

This is a very small place with two ladies working the orders.  They are pretty slow, but everything is made fresh to order. They have playing cards on the table, and after a 20 minute wait, we found out why. 

I got the Mango tea, which was very good.  I am not a big sweets person so I put very little sweet and low in my tea if any.  This flavor did not need any sweetener. 

Then I ordered their B.A.T. on waffle instead of bread. It was just ok.  The waffle seemed overdone to me and the sandwich was lacking taste.  Nice fruit side bowl, but strawberries were on their last leg. 

I think most of the positive reviews were for the waffle desserts. So if I ever come back again, then I will stick to the sweet side of the menu, even though sweets are not my favorite.

Awesome! Very delicious , try the maple bacon waffle. I'd say if you came here on your work lunch and it's crowded, you might not get out in time, but otherwise it's a great place to cone chill, have a great coffee and a waffle.

Well done guys! We had the kisses and viva la Elvis and they were great!!! The viva bacon and not too salty although I was expecting really salty. We didn't have any of the gourmet drinks but definitely enjoyed the cafe like feel.

Still full of Awesomeness...no matter which waffle I try I have yet to be disappointed.  And you can get anything you want gluten free and vegan.

On this particular visit 3-7-16 I believe one of the owners was in the store because the staff was not as warm and friendly as in the past.  There was a totally different vibe in here then in the past 3 or 4 visits.

Not sure what was going on but the food was still amazing, the drinks were amazing and this is a place I not only highly recommend but will come back to as well.

To me this is one of those places you just cannot seem to get enough of.  You can get breakfast or lunch stuff anytime and you always leave satisfied.

There's too much to say about this place! I absolutely love it if they were open longer I would be spending more money there than waffles are simply amazing tasty sweet and just hold off we should be they make their own syrup with some funky way and it's delicious always asked for extra encourage them to make bottles to sell. My favorite thing about this place is the black lemonade also known as charcoal lemonade. It's literally black and it's delicious anyone I'm way as I put drive-by I instantly think of them and have to stop so they can try it and they all love it, I wish that they came in different sizes but at this point I'm just glad that I discovered it. It's a must try, must go, must experience!

There's only one waffle sandwich I order here and that's the waffledilla. It's exactly what you think it is: a waffle quesadilla. It's a subtly sweet, overly savory serving of food heaven layered in a healthy serving of cheese, chicken, and their very own Tiabi sauce all densely packed in a crispy yet soft waffle, usually accompanied with a side of deliciously flavored kettle chips (add $1.00). 

I guess the only complaint I have is that the sandwich isn't big enough to satisfy my hunger, and at $5.79, I really wish it came with two waffledillas. Heck, I'd pay a little extra if there was a special two wafflewich combo. Make this happen, guys! There are too many times where I just end up ordering two anyways.

I stopped in here at about 7:45am on a Tuesday to a restaurant with about 3 people seated inside.  
I was warmly greeted upon entering the door. The somewhat nondescript, simple interior had the menu on the wall.  The lady gave me a run down of the 5 Wafflewiches, point out her favorite as well as the most popular West Coast Wafflewich. 

I ordered the #Breakfastsandwich and was somewhat underwhelmed. The waffle was soft but the flavor was very distinct and there was no sauce to liven it up.  I ask for a side of the Tiabi sauce, a basil based sauce that was ok, but not a compliment for the entree but probably pretty good on another entree that had Chicken. 

I guess my biggest disappointment came from the limited menu selections and the fact that there was only one "breakfast-like" sandwich.   A lunchtime meal might be perceived differently. 

To their credit they had quick and friendly service, but I would have to try something else to "wow" me.

Would I go back? Sure. Would I make a special trip to visit this specific place? Nah.

Decent little spot for coffee and waffles. 
Tried this place out for the first time today. First impression as you walk in sort of an island feel. Good amount of tables/seating. Friendly customer service. We ordered a "bananatella waffle", which was basically a decent sized waffle with bananas, whipped cream, and a drizzle of nutella. Satisfying, however, seemed to have skimped on the nutella a bit. For my coffee, i ordered a small size drink (two shots of espresso blended with almond milk and ice) It was made perfectly to order. 
Two stars missing are for the price, my small coffee beverage cost over $5 and i was just a little disappointed by the meager amount of nutella on my "bananatella" waffle. 
Overall, would probably not return due to the price of the coffee, even though i did enjoy it. :/
Amazing food and great service! Nothing better then eating at a place with good food and smiles from the whole staff. Definitely coming back!

Churro waffle is really good! Cute little shoppe! Glad it's in North LV! Wish they used real eggs and bacon. The eggs are microwaved I think? I just think those little extra touches would make this place a 5 star eatery. Overall, good experience! Friendly staff. Espresso is good as well.

I was looking for a place to do some work i with tables and Wi-Fi and came across Tiabi.

Had a great early dinner here consisting of the recommended West Coast Wafflewich with housemade chips and a Just Peachy iced tea (with less sweetener).  The Wafflewich was good (wasn't the biggest fan of the tomatoes, as I felt it was too much of a soft component, I took them out and replaced them with some chips and added the crunch I was looking for) and the peach tea was great. (next time, I'll get all the sweetener--who am I kidding). 

Later, I additionally had an Almond Milk Green Tea Latte and it's possibly my favorite Green Tea Latte I've ever had.  It was refreshingly nutty and not overly sweet.

The owners who had served me were great and friendly personalities and I can't wait to come back here again with others.
this place is awesome! the food is delicious and the service is always so friendly and welcoming. i'll recommend it to everyone!

I love this place. Waffle flavor is on point. Vegan options are available. They were out of vegan ice cream last time but I'll be back in to try it soon. Try the Oreo coffee. Soooo delishiousness and the environment is chill. My only complaint is that I wish they had longer hours.

Amazing small business owned by 2 women of Guam!! I first found this place in search of white espresso! I moved here from Seattle so you can imagine we are well known for our love for coffee. Anyway, the yummy looking food and coffee pictures is what summoned my family and I! As we pulled up we seen a Guam sticker proudly represented on the entry way! It made me feel proud to be a Chamorru but even prouder to see a small uniquely owned island business in sin city! Strange how this place stuck out and so happened to be of the same cultural background. Amazing customer service by the young lady and man who was working. She thoroughly explained good items in which we were interested in regardless of how many questions we threw at her. I myself being a server in the food industry know how tedious it could be. We ordered a few items off the menu! 
Red velvet waffle 
Maple and beacon waffle 
Southwest waffle sandwich
Banananutella
And the Tia waffle iced mac. Coffee

All tasted lovely and reasonably priced! Go support a small island owned business!

Really cool they have real freshly made waffles. The works are super polite. Got the breakfast sandwich with beacon and eggs. Too bad the eggs and beacon are industrial made thousands of miles away. They taste and look totally unfresh. Too bad.
It is a cute little cafe. I used the yelp eat24, and it was ready by the time it say it would. I ordered the red velvet waffles, and it was soo good. This food here is really good

I was looking for a quick bite and pick me up so decided to try Tiabi's on my lunch break. It wasn't busy at all and I was glad that the service was great! The guy who took my order was helpful and friendly, it made the ordering process easy. 

I ordered the signature drink - Tiff's and it was good, I like the top off of a cinnamon waffle! I ordered a savory sandwich (forgot what it was called but it had chicken cheese avocado and the house sauce) it was pretty good. 

They have a decent selection of drinks and quick eats, I'd go back if I was in the mood for waffles.

Overall the quality of food was good, the staff was friendly. The only critique is when I sat down the bench was wobbling and the table was sticky.

One of the reasons I love living mid town! Had the west coast wafflewich, sooo good! Something about a fresh waffle folded around seasoned chicken breast, avocado, tomato, bacon, melted cheese, and with the signature Tiabi sauce. Do your taste buds a favor.

This has to be the best place to get waffles. They always come out perfect. I ordered through postmates and it still came perfect. Even the iced coffee. Usually when you order a drink through delivery it gets watered down by the ice but nope still great!

Absolute best place to get waffles in Vegas. The waffle has an excellent texture and is soo tasty. The whipped cream on the top is one of the best parts.
The sandwiches are also really good. 
The kale champ smoothie is good if you're a fan of kale. If you don't like kale try a fruity smoothie because you can still taste it.
So far I haven't had a bad meal here!
SOOO good! I got the Elvis waffle- very good. Great staff!!! The manager is literally the nicest person in the world- Recommend this 100% !!!

Service: Quick, friendly, and helpful. 

Our banana berry came out within a few minutes of ordering ($5.25). The smoothie wasn't icy at all and you could actually taste all the ingredients they put into the drink, unlike most places. IMO, $5.25 is a lot for a smoothie, but I would say it was well worth it's price.

I also ordered the west coast ($5.99). I was torn between the steak and egg waffle (a new addition to the menu) vs the west coast. I went with the west coast since the person at the register suggested it and I'm glad I did.

The west coast was the perfect balance of sweet and salty. The avocado didn't over power the sandwich which I feel most sandwiches do. It was definitely enough to make me full since I also ordered a side of house chips. The house chips tasted like kettle cooked mesquite bbq chips, but they season it themselves kinda like potato corner. Would recommend. We have a place like this in Cali called Bruxie's, but I'd rather come here because their items are more flavorful. 

P.S. They play a variety of girl power songs from Ciara, Beyoncé, Nicki Minaj, Destiny's Child, etc... lol

I love visiting the location off Maryland, great staff, friendly environment, exceptional food! This location is another story. Same look except for the quality and environment, was very disappointed by the staff and quality of the food. Sad that this location was so terrible as I love the other location.
Nice little spot off the strip, 5 minutes away. Located in the same center as Target. Workers are very welcoming and hospitable. Waffles are fresh and crisp. Very delicious.

This is a cute little cafe that I found on Groupon. I had the breakfast sandwich with bacon & a sugar free vanilla latte. This place really does a good job catering to gluten and sugar free lifestyles. The food is delicious, the portion size was a bit much but its something that can be saved for later and still taste great, if you go for lunch it's best to order ahead of time, everything is cooked to order. Love This Place!
Smells great and decent pricing for a waffle bar. Busy staff so may take a while to get food.
I died and went to red velvet heaven! Place is amazing from the customer service, their drinks to their waffle. Would definitely be back

It's been a while since I wrote a review, but I wanted to write one about my favorite cafe - TIABI.

TIABI - "To Inspire And Be Inspired". I discovered this little place through a student organization at UNLV. They are super close to campus and an excellent place to "be inspired," in my case this is the only place where I know I can sit down and focus on writing and studying. I've been here several times already and have accomplished so much (yelping reviews is the bottom of my list up until now). 

First, the only downside I can mention is that there is only one wall outlet (that I know) where I can plug in. That little area has become my personal spot. Other than that, I thoroughly love this venue.

Location/Open times: TIABI is down the street from UNLV. It is in a secluded area of the Target shopping plaza right next to a great sushi place. As a potential schoolteacher, the 7am open time is right when I have to get to class but it is open until 8pm on most days making it a good place to have breakfast on my off days, lunch, or chillax after class/work.

Aesthetics: Local art, waffle "hashtags" everywhere, a couple of couches and sturdy tables and seating. The wired art light fixtures  add a nice rustic look (though they tend to accumulate dust quickly). Nothing is too distracting, and I can zone into my work or a conversation easily. Their playlists are provided by Pandora and varies by the people working, but I have enjoyed the musical tastes of the staff thus far, ranging from islander to indie.

Food: In the words of a lego dude, "EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!" There are plenty of options, especially health and allergy conscious, handcrafted on the spot. I have always enjoyed that "fresh" taste and have never suffered a regretful feeling leaving (as is sometimes the case with Chipotle or even Starbucks). As I am writing this review, I am having their red velvet waffle (so sweet and delectable) paired with a new beverage, the Frankenstein frappe, a cool and refreshing drink lightly sweetened with agave but not so much as to overpower the taste of the coffee. I am enjoying myself and am getting my morning kick (which is why I can write). 

Service: The owners, Tiff and Mae, are both super awesome and have taken care of me on numerous occasions. Their staff are just as kind and sociable, and I haven't had a problem striking up a conversation as I am often here alone. I feel as welcome as sitting at a desk in my own living room. I'm surprised that not as many people come to just hang out, but I'm certain that will change as more people come to know about TIABI.

I like small hole-in-the-wall local places, and I feel especially at home at this one. Hope this review was inspiring!

Small but fun. Extensive waffle menu. I had the Viva Las Elvis (banana, peanut butter and bacon). Their coffee and latte selection is also extensive and way less expensive than STARBUCKS. The only negative is, since it's all made to order, it's not quick. But still, really good and fun and inexpensive.

Cool ,cute, unpretentious lovely little place with wonderful workers, chef making waffle with his heart , taste all good ingredients are using for the creative waffle sandwiches , the honey creamy latte is fantastic 
The owner and workers there so pleasant, friendly and passionate about what they are doing, I respect people like that. They got it right , focus on few things and make it toward perfection!
I am going again tomorrow try other items on the menu!
My Viva Las Elvis was amazing and my snickers coffee yummy loved the bathroom  great find

All the things I love: coffee, tea, and waffles!! Once you walk in, you immediately know that you're in for a great experience. With everything prepared to order, the food and drinks are fresh and high quality. 

They have a very interesting coffee menu with things like red velvet lattes. The flavors offered are rich and well executed. 

This has a small cafe environment with open seating for all people. The clean and friendly environment makes for a great meeting or work space. Free Wi-Fi is offered for your internet needs.

The location is not the best however the customer service was stellar. Cleanliness was fair. We had Tiff's Waffle Macchiato. It was excellent! Sweet, decadent, full of flavor and the waffle was delicious. I would definitely return to restaurant.

I've only been here twice but both were good experiences. I ordered a caramel iced coffee but she heard it as an iced caramel macchiato. I didn't end up correcting her since I figured it wouldve tasted the same lol. I also ordered the red velvet waffle with no whip. The food and the coffee was good but nothing spectacular. 

When my waffle came out, the girl put whipped cream on it. I didn't complain about it but I was a little irked lol. The girl did apologize later on so it was fine. The workers are really nice and friendly!

I love this place!!! I love that it's not super busy. The waffles are so soft and fluffy and perfect. I plan on coming back many many times. I attend UNLV and it is so close to campus that it is perfect for an after school lunch, snack, coffee, etc.

This is a small 3 person operation.  My wife ordered the bananatella Belgian waffle with a nutella drizzle, slivered almonds and whipped cream topping.  I sought nirvana by ordering a hashtag breakfast sandwich - Belgian waffle with turkey sausage, eggs and cheese.  I enhanced my sandwich with a generous douse of breakfast syrup.  Both entrees were very good as was the strawberry sunrise smoothie that we ordered to go.

I really like the concept and service at TIABI. Laid back atmosphere where you can hang out solo or with friends. There are people working on their laptops or hanging out with friends. Their specialty is their vegan waffle. Either sweet or savory they have options for both.

There is a a big board on the left when you walk in for the menu. The customer service at the ordering  counter has been consistently friendly. I've had the West Coast waffle sandwich and that has chicken, avocado, bacon, and their signature aioli sauce. I really like it, but sometimes I get it without the bacon. Their chicken waffledilla is a quesadilla made out of waffle instead of tortilla. Very cheesy and hits the spot when you're in need of comfort food. The only drawback is that sometimes the food takes a while to come out. I've tried calling ahead for pick up, but was put on hold for a while and ended up driving there instead. However, I'm never disappointed when I get my food though. 

I do want to differentiate that this particular shop has a more soft and fluffy texture than a super crispy outside kind of waffle. I personally like the softer version, but for some people the waffle texture was too one noted. I have yet to try their dessert versions, but the strawberry and whipped cream seems to be very popular when I've dined in. The prices are very affordable too. Lunch with a drink will be around under ten bucks. All in all, it's a cool and casual spot worth giving at least a try. May call way ahead of time before the busy lunch hour, but it's definitely on my rotation of lunch options.

Needed to kill some time yesterday in the area so decided to give this place a try. Had the Elvis waffle which was ok but had way too much peanut butter for my taste and pretty much overwhelmed everything else. Also tried the snickers iced coffee which was excellent. Service was friendly but slow. We waited about 15 minutes for our coffee and then at least another 20 for the waffle. Definitely not the place to come if you are in a hurry. Luckily I wasn't in a rush or starving. Overall decent but not really worth the wait.

Table was wobbly and not cleaned off, vegan burger came without sauce and was just two boca burger patties with tomato and lettuce between a waffle. Dessert churro waffle came with perfect scoop ice cream but only one waffle for $7.50.  Not worth the drive in my opinion when there are much better places nearby.

Awesome vegan options! The guru burger is great. I'm not the biggest fan of Daiya but it's good on this burger. Iced coffee is also great. It's also very cute inside and quiet, which I appreciate because I went in for breakfast. Much better than some coffee shops with loud music or loud customers. I'll definitely be back soon.

After seeing other great reviews for Tiabi on Yelp, I finally ventured out to check it out! Parking was a bit of a tight squeeze as this location is crammed in with other small businesses next to Target, but the restaurant itself was quiet and laidback. 

I decided to try the Red Velvet frappe, which the employees upgraded to a large for me for free because it was my first time! Nice! The frappe was delicious but a little too sweet for me to drink the whole thing. 

Now that I know where Tiabi is and have had a good experience with the employees, I definitely want to come back and try the waffles and other drinks.
Tried this place for the first time! Nice and clean on the inside. I order the West coast waffle it was delicious. Everyone in our group loved the food. Definitely coming back!

This is probably one of my favorite cafes to study at! They have a great selection of food, especially my favorite, the West Coast. Definitely can't go wrong with a waffle sandwich to begin with. The music isn't too loud and the feel of this place is very relaxed and chill. Their WiFi is good and not laggy whatsoever. They have lots of table room, which I definitely like taking advantage of when needing to study and catch up on homework. Wished they stayed open longer, but what can you do? Overall, a great place to grab a bite while studying for those exams. Always leaving focused and content after coming here! :-)

Introduction:
Always looking for a good coffee place. Came across Tiabi on Groupon and decided to try them out.  I must say, it was delicious. 

Quality: 5/5
We had the snicker "iced coffee" and  the honey "I'm home waffle".  They were both equally good.  The coffee had the perfect sweetness and so was the waffle. However, if I must rate between the two, I enjoyed the waffle  slightly better. 

Quantity: 4/5
For the price, I think it's good, but not great. Although the large coffee was plenty, I usually see that as a medium size. So fyi, in case you are considering a small. It's really good, so I recommend the large.

Customer Service: 4/5
Nothing spectacular, although there was only two parties in there including us, we were not acknowledged when we walked in like most places do with incredible customer experience.  However, they were good once we were assisted.

Atmosphere: 5/5
It was kind of cold in there, there were us and one other couple that was in the shop. Mainly because we went about 4:30 p.m. Coffee shops are not known to be busy during that hour.  The music volume was however perfect tone. Not too loud or too soft.
 
Cleanliness: 4/5
The place appeared a little older, but was clean and organize.

Price: 5/5
The price was good, however, we got Groupon promotions, so it made their pricing exceptional :)

Tips:
You can get three $8 groupons for $14.25.  So we have two left to utilize. Will definitely be back to try out their other items.  Keep an eye out,  It's located in a plaza, so it's not a stand alone coffee shop. We almost missed it. Enjoy! You won't be disappointed.

I really wanted to like this venue as it's a small business & the items on the menu seem fairly tasty,  but the service was lacking. 

We came with a family of four. The kids were served their food & finished eating (20 minutes) before the other food arrived. I was truly floored!  The kids initially wanted to wait for our food to arrive, however, had they waited their food would have been cold. 

We also ordered a side of eggs & bacon to accompany the waffles we ordered. That too was served 20 minutes apart. 

The hostess/owner apologized & said their was a "mixup" but I wasn't impressed with the lack of concern that was given with our poor dining experience. 


I know this is a new venue & only opened a month ago but sometime & effort really needs to be put into the flow of business. We came to eat as a family & that did not happen. I'm extremely disappointed.

This place is cute. It is catered to college crowd. The prices are pretty darn good. I ordered Tiffs special that included a caramel macchiato and small waffle garnish. You can get it iced or hot. It was 4.25! My friend ordered a waffle with chocolate and strawberries and a green smoothie. The waffle was a bit dry and smoothie was very light. But the prices and vibe in here was good enough to try again.

Second time at Tiabi and we keep falling in love with the menu. The fresh brewed coffee is amazing. If you are Vegan then enjoy the Veggie Waffledilla that's on the menu. The snickers iced coffee is also a must. 

Come here...enjoy the atmosphere and enjoy the food. Tiabi has the best waffles in the area...and they're 100% Vegan!!!!!

Food was actually a little bland, waffles had no flavor to them unfortunately, my sister & I got the red velvet waffle to share, she got the vegan sandwich & I got the breakfast sandwich. If the breakfast sandwich didn't have bacon on it, I would've tasted like I was eating nothing. 

Coffee was excellent definitely would return just for the coffee alone. Great atmosphere & the ladies working were very pleasant. Just wish the food had more flavor.
Best waffle spot in Vegas.  Hands down. The waffledilia with avocado is always a good choice.  The Thai basil waffle is also tasty and zesty

Love, love, love this place. The staff is so nice and welcoming but the best part is the variety of unique waffles. You must try the Maple Bacon Waffle and the Red Velvet (so yummy and to die for). 

I can't wait to return and try some of their other items.

Um can I just start by saying this is freaking delicious I was suppose to be on a diet but that has failed as of today. Greta little shop, friendly staff. The west coast was beyond amazing. The sauce is delicious over all. I just have to say that this is an amazing place to come grab a sandwich or a drink it's just delicious.

Time to update. Yesterday's visit wasn't very pleasing. I cannot believe how long it took to get my food...and the nice gal at the cashier took down my name incorrectly so after waiting an excruciating long time for my food, I wasn't sure if my name was being called. They keep calling "Maria" when my name is "Nadia"...I looked around and noticed no one was responding to "Maria" so I went up to the counter to clarify the name...With an attitude, one of the girls making a drink said "isn't that what you  ordered?" (as if the sandwich was exclusive to me alone)... I said "yes, but before I take the food I want to make sure it's actually my order and not some Maria that could be nearby". After taking the food I sat down and immediately overheard the same girls  gossiping about me, laughing and saying my name. Whatever. At least wait until the customer leaves to trash talk. The Thai sandwich was just okay. The waffle was too soft and when I bit into it it was unpleasantly soggy. It's been that way on each visit. The idea of a waffle sandwich is good, by if it isn't cooked crispy enough, it ends up tasting like dough. I think I'm going to scratch this place off my list.

Cool spot + unique menu but not the best service. My mom had 3 things wrong with her simple order and five minutes after she we began eating someone else came in to return their meal as well as their Togo order was cooked improperly. Maybe would be better if a new cook were in the back.
Dang ... finally a place dedicated just waffles ... The Bananatella and Waffledilla is awesome...

I wanted to pick up some morning macchiatos, so my friend suggested I try out Tiabi. I was greeted by the friendly cashier who was open to answering all of my first time client questions. I ordered two regular caramel macchiatos and also received a macadamia/caramel Lolly waffle for checking in. The macchiatos barely had a caramel taste, but did showcase the fresh coffee it was made with. Definitely better quality and more refreshing than any chain coffee shop. The Lolly waffle was satisfying but had an awful amaretto after taste and was undercooked in the center. If they gave their waffle maker a good scrubbin' and ditched the almond tang, I think the lolly waffle could have a chance to be great. Overall, the customer service was friendly and coffee was tasty, but the lolly waffle and cleanliness of the establishment need improvement.

This place is near the UNLV campus and is amazing. I go about every other week with one of my good friends. 

I really like this place and the food is delicious and all fresh made. I am a big fan of avocado and a lot of there waffle-witches have avocado on them an its so appetizing and filling. They have man options too, including vegan options which is really nice. This is perfect for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. They have amazing coffee too. The drinks are so yummy and cute. They have a special menu in front of the cash register as well. They have a lavender vanilla latte that is so yummy and it has a soft lavender flavor. Also, I am not a big fan of honey but they have a honey creme latte that is so soft and decadent. It makes me smile and it is perfect.

The workers are also very friendly! They are also so nice and help out.

This place is serve yourself though, so they make the food and the coffee but you get the utensils and the maple syrup on a table across from where you pick up the food. 

They are always packed in the morning when I go and I really enjoy coming here.

We found this place on Groupon it is Delicious if you are in Vegas you need to stop in we (4 of us) had the Butter Pecan Waffle, Wafflewiches, Strawberry kisses, latte, macchiato OMG this was awesome.  The staff was the best J is so cool. Will visit when we visit Vegas again.

I was so excited to find out that the waffles were 100% vegan! It's tough to find good breakfast places with vegan options. The coffee is great the waffles are great and the vegan ice cream? Awesome. I'll be coming back here every time I visit Vegas.

Great service / good vibes / great food.


Pros: 

-Both Vegan & non Vegan friendly

-They have a all flavors for those who love sweet & savory as well.

-good music

-comfy seating

-VERY CLEAN 


CON: 

I can't find any to be honest

The waffles are magic in your mouth. I'm not a big waffle fan, but this place does it right. Crispy on the outside and nice and airy on the inside. There's a variety of waffle sandwiches and waffle desserts and the coffee choices makes it hard to pick just one.

We wanted to grab lunch before heading on our long road trip ahead.

We ordered a coffee, Snickers drink, 2 wafflewichs.

We sat and waited and waited. There were 2 people working only.

We waited about 30 minutes before getting our drinks. Then another 10 minutes for our food.

My drink was okay, but my guy said his coffee was good though.

The wafflewichs were okay, but a bit soggy. Definitely use the syrup since I think it enhances the flavors. The fruit were strawberries and bananas, but the strawberries weren't that ripe. I did enjoy the chips.
This was my first time here. I ordered the West Coast waffle sandwich and my first bite was the bomb. This place is tasty and affordable! Definitely get the West Coast!
Really beautiful coffee spot with reasonable prices! Super friendly staff! Definitely gonna come back and chill :)

Not particularly fond of this place. 

My friend got the lavender latte, while I got a cappuccino. The lavender latte was good, not too sweet and had a good taste of the espresso. Mine tasted only like a shot of burnt espresso.

I'm giving 3/5 stars for the concept, but I won't be a regular
Food was good, place was decent, waiting for waffles to be prepared was a bit tooooo long. With lots of good reviews, they need to buy more waffle makers to speed up service

A churro waffle?? What a goldmine! Was craving a midday snack so I dragged Mom and sister out to try it out. 

Looking at yelp reviews, I expected it to be more or less a Belgian waffle with cinnamon and sugar (which still sounds delicious). However, this waffle was much thinner than a Belgian. This kept it nice and crunchy, even with a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream on top.

Super delicious! And the staff was very friendly. I'll have to again next time I'm in Vegas.

The Breakfast Veggie waffle is dope. Good job on the flavor and the yummski factor. The tiffs waffle macchiato was tasty!!! 

Friendly people clean place!!!

Walking in you are bombarded with the smell of deliciousness that is waffles. I would go there just to soak in the aroma, it smells that good. Unfortunately, I can't eat the food there because it's not gluten free, so my review is based upon the coffee I got. My friend and I decided to come here because it was a local coffee shop and it wasn't Starbucks. Not a fan of their coffee. Tiabi's coffee selection was pretty good but their waffle selection was better. They had creative coffee drinks like the Jolt and the Snicker's bar which I got. My drink was ok...it a little more on the mocha side than I would've preferred but my friend's drink was amazing. I would definitely go back and get the Jolt next time I'm in Vegas. Definitely check this little coffee shop out. It's got a cool concept going on and who doesn't love waffles?!

Omnomnomnom. We came here after reading a review on a vegan website. I'm the only vegan so we love finding yummy places that have vegan options. 

We had the new vegan waffle burger, a caramel syrup macchiato with almond milk, a hashtag breakfast sandwich with bacon waffles, kisses waffle, and a strawberry sunrise smoothie. Everything was nom to the max (see first line). The sauce with the new vegan burger sandwich was amazing and we loved everything else. 

The employees were very friendly and we loved playing cards while our food came. Thanks, Tiabi, for a great breakfast and living up to the hype! We'll be back.

This place is so delicious! My boyfriend and I got waffle breakfast sandwiches: one bacon and the other turkey sausage. Both reasonably priced and delicious!!! We also got a strawberry chocolate waffle, yummy and fresh berries. Definitely recommend coming here.

Great first time experience, great customer service, food was amazing. I would definitely recommend others to come and enjoy the vibes. My meal of choose today was the Strawberry KISS Waffle, substituting the chocolate for caramel and adding bananas. I definitely enjoyed the food and it is inexpensive and offers cafe vibes and music. It is also great that they offer vegan friendly options. This is the perfect brunch restaurant and a great way to start your day.    The atmosphere is wonderful.
First time here and they are really good. Super nice, make modifications with no problem. The ambiance is cafe-ish and has a friendly vibe to it. The food is fresh and tasty. #awesome

Well, it's lunch time again at the office. Joe came in my office and asked if I wanted waffles for lunch, I was like that seems odd, but Joe is a standup guy so I trusted him, and I was down for an adventure after my extremely boring day so far. So we loaded up a couple cars or coworkers and we rolled on over. The inside of the place was cool, actually it was a little cold. I liked the painting of princess leia and Vader. They have a waffle sandwich named the West coast, which is what I got, mainly because I like to say "West Coast" in my white "Gangsta" accent. They have Mexican coke in "medio litro" sizes, that was good. Exp date on it was august of 2017, so that gives it plenty of time. I liked the music, it was like a funky sax beat that got my jiggy flowing. Jami got the Guru Burger, she said "it's delicious" Joe said his waffle was "primo" he got the strawberry kisses or something. "The kettle chips are delicious" - Jami. Alex said the Guru burger was "good so far" Jamie said the Strawberry kisses was "really good!" Byoungha said about the WestCoast "it's good....real good" In addition they had playing cards at our table, me Jordan, Alex, and  Sarah played "go fish", Jordan won with 8 matches.

Omggggg!! I didn't like waffles until this place!! These crispy light waffles are a winner! I had the butter pecan waffle and it was delish..I'll be bringing all of my family and friends here!! The selection is great for vegans which isn't something I often see. They are nice too!

Guru burger is the best veggie burger ive had in vegas (besides the ones I make) 

Its just a boca burger i think, but its just so delicious wrapped up in a fresh waffle! 

The vegan viva las elvis was tasty, but a bit skimpy on the toppings.

The lady who helped us was very friendly and helpful. I forgot to get her name but we went at 7 or 8 am on thursday.    

Lattes with Lots of unique flavors here (like pistacchio) 

Next time ill try the churro waffle!

I wish the prices were a bit lower or the portions a bit bigger, but overall i was very happy with my visit and cant beleive i waited 2 years to try it!!! Will def be a regualr!

Tried it once out of curiosity and had to have my guests go complete their tasks while I waited for my waffles. No communication or compensation for the wait either. Food was good but the wait was not. Either the prices need to come down or the wait times do.

Ordered 2 Churro waffles. They were luke warm. Wasn't busy, but a long wait on cooking the waffles. I watched it get peeled from the iron, placed on a cookie rack, place in a toaster oven, then peeped before serving. Simple order, but somehow it turned out mediocre. Service without the smile.
Found this place on yelp. Nothing more to say than EXCELLENT! Waffles are so good! I highly recommend!

My boyfriend recently decided to go vegan, being one that would eat anything and everything he's now very cautious and needless to say I can't think of places he'd actually eat from! Searching yelp for vegan places I found this place, and I'm sooooo glad I did!!
The guru burger is what he went with and he was very satisfied! I went with the west coast and oh my goooodness
It was delicious!!!
The waffle was PERFECT
He also tried the green nut smoothie and loved it!
So happy I found this spot!
We'll definitely be stopping by again soon!
Pistachio latte is bomb! I get the #breakfastsandwhich every time I come and it never disappoints. They have vegetarian and dairy free options which is a huge plus! Highly recommend!
Food is delicious. Pistachio latte mmmmm. The owner is super nice! I drive 40 mins to come here and it's worth it every time.

Delicious most unique coffee and waffle shop. With a friendly and helpful staff. Came here a couple days ago. Can't believe what I've been missing. Although I didn't have the waffle, the lavender latte was a hit, bought my daughter the charcoal infused lemonade. It's black and taste like a fantastic glass of lemonade! Pretty exciting. My husband had the java jolt. He loved it, gave him the kick he needed. We'll definitely be. Everything tasted amazing.

Had Groupon I purchased. A friend and I went about 10:00am. I ordered red velvet waffle, she ordered a waffle sandwich.  No one was there except us, my waffle came out in about 20 minutes, friends didn't come until about 10-15 minutes later.  Hate to start eating befire she got hers. My red velvet waffle was awful, not only missing flavor but it was dry and just had chocolate chips scattered over the top,  no butter, syrup very very dry, it was terrible, friends sandwich she was just OK. You do have to get up to get your silverware, condiments, water and napkins. Drinks are good but really need to work on flavor and moist texture. Mat just inside very dirty looks like they never vacuum it. Would not go back.
A delightful experience! Excellent espresso, bright environment, and it smells like the most fantastic waffles.

This place earns its five stars. It is so delicious.

I can't eat dairy, so waffles are often off the table for me. When I found out about this place on my last trip, I was excited but I had no idea what was waiting for me. These aren't just waffles. They are delicious, fluffy, soft waffles with just the right amount of crisp and crunch on the outside. I got the Thai chicken waffle sandwich without cheese. It was the best food I've had on my vacation by far. You can get a more classic waffle dessert with different batter options and customized toppings if you want more of a dessert. Also, yes, they have vegan ice cream. 

The drinks are nice too. I've tended to stick to tea blends to hydrate on hot days, but they have a few interesting looking blended drinks and, of course, fun coffee options.

The waffles take a little bit of time to make, so go in with a little patience, but know that it is so worth it.

I fully recommend this place to anyone with a mouth who enjoys food.

Found this place on Groupon and had to go back! I've never tried waffles with anything other than syrup because I always thought it was weird any other way but this place proved me wrong... Their sandwiches are sooooooo good I tried both the South American and west coast & they were Delicious!!! Their coconut truffle ice coffee is LIFE! If I didn't live so far I would totally replace my everyday Starbucks with their ice coffee!!!
Came here after reading Yelp reviews (thanks!) and was so glad I did!  The Westcoast was amazing! Staff was so friendly. I'll def b back.
They have the best coffee in town, and if it's waffles you're after, then this is the place to be!

Gluten free waffles at affordable prices in Vegas? What? And Nutella? Sign me up! Great coffee for an amazing price. Staff is friendly. This hole-in-the-wall coffee shop is definitely worth venturing off the strip to go try.

I am seriously impressed by the quality of these waffle sandwiches - they're not just tasty, the avocado and all the ingredients I have regularly are top notch. Amazing. They may take a little time to make, BUT I promise it's worth the extra couple minutes. The owner is extremely genuine. I never review stuff - but I really am singing high praise. Been back about six or seven times. Waffle breakfast sandwiches for the win!

It's been a while where I go to a new breakfast place and order something new and like it. Everything is fresh which is amazing. 

I was amazed that they had vegan options as well. 

The honey cream latter was exceptional. It blew my mind. 

I ordered the vegan waffle with daiya cheese and egg. Omg, I just can't believe how good it was! 
They should open a location in Los Angeles :))))
OMG this place is so good!!! I loved their red velvet chocolate chip frappe and wafflewiches! I had the west coast wafflewich!

This is the spot!  Would be nice if they went organic- and some better options for sweet syrup, but great for vegan selections while passing thru Vegas on a road trip.  

lots of fun options, especially the Churro waffle.  we had the vegan wafflewich too, it was super tasty.

chilled out space, cozy seating, good music, wifi, and outlets.  good for travelers and study

This place is awesome! they have great coffee and delicious waffles! id eat there every morning if i could! the place is small and quiet and the service is friendly! give this place a shot if you havent already!
We drove 20 minutes from our hotel to get to this little spot and I'm glad we did. It's unique and the waffles were worth the wait. West coast waffle and the chocolate coconut latte were amazing!!!

Amazing restaurant! Two vegan wafflewhich choices, The Guru which I have had multiple times and always enjoyed, and the Savory Thai Basil can be made vegan with The Guru's patties and daiya vegan mozzarella. Scream for vegan ice cream!

Not only does Tiabi do amazing waffles they also hold the coffee game down! "To Inspire And Be Inspired"! I love the quote and your food and coffee are inspirational to me!!!!

So far I have not tried the sweet waffles, but on the savory waffle front I'm in love with the Waffidilla add the avocado and the West Coast. Both full of cheese and meaty goodness inside a perfectly cooked waffle. 

The coffee is amazing! On your first visit you must have the Tiffs Waffle Macchiato. It has a churro waffle in a very strong, slightly cinnamon flavored coffee. My favorite is the Espresso Frankenstein. It's perfect if you enjoy the taste of coffee. Plus, as sweetener they use is agave. Yay!

The service is spot on and everyone is talkative, energized and helpful. If you go in often you will get to know them and how sweet they really are. The atmosphere a is pure coffee shop, random tables that don't match and chairs that are odd. I do love the long wood bench that runs the length of the wall. Plus, the cool art on the walls are really unique and cool. 

My love of coffee shops runs deep and Tiabi Coffee has definitely become close to my heart!

Second time here and second yelp review. This place let's you basically make your own smoothie!! You can pick what goes in it and what you want to leave out. Plus it's very decently priced. Ironically cheaper than Jamba Juice and Tropical Smoothie even though it uses real fruit when the other chains DON'T.

I ordered the West Coast. It came with chicken, tomato, bacon, avocado, and their tiabi sauce. The sauce was really good! I was a little disappointed with the waffle itself. Very bland. Luckily the filling was tasty! My boyfriend ordered the Viva Las Vegas. Very good but again, not the best waffle. 
We ordered a Red Bull iced drink which was pretty tasty if you like Red Bull. I had the caramel mocha coffee with a pinch of sea salt. Delicious!

Just had a sugar free frappe , hazelnut. Quite good. They give you a choice 5 of many different types of milk, so that's nice to be able to choose.  Nice atmosphere. .. no smoking.  Music not too loud.
TIABI is in a niche of its own! Where in the valley can you find great tasting waffle sandwiches??? Nowhere! Love, love, love them! You will too!
I love exploring new vegan friendly places when visiting Vegas and this is def one to try. They are friendly and everything was delicious.

I had their best seller, Banana Nutella waffle and Caramel Machiato. 
Waffle was good, coffee too. Ambiance is alright, casual but the music was a bit too loud. 
I'd like to come back to try their savory items.

I had the Thai Basil (vegan) and the Honey I'm Home (vegan version). SO DELICIOUS.
That Honey I'm Home had my cravings going for weeks!

This hidden gem is definitely my new favorite breakfest spot!!! The restaurant is tucked in behind the target shopping center. Tiabi is decorated way beautifully and have a very interesting beverage, smoothie, and food menu! I wish I could try everything on the menu so I will be back! The food was amazing and the staff were SOOOOOO nice and friendly!! :)

I went here only because Waffle Cafe was closed. We got there 45 mins before close and they told us they shut down the dining area 15 minutes before closing time. They honestly looked shocked we even came in at that time. As a family of four, we spent about $60 four waffles, four drinks and the thinnest pieces of bacon I've ever seen. Needless to say we left hungry. They brought out one waffle at a time and my husband almost didn't get his food in time for us to eat there. We rushed to eat and get out in time not to get kicked out. They weren't flat out rude but I wouldn't call them friendly either. Well that is until we were leaving and then it was like "bye have a great night!" Honestly I would never go back. I get way better service, way better food and for less at Waffle Cafe. I've never left there hungry and I have even heard them training their staff and the owner repeatedly mentioned customer service. Plus it's much more comfortable and cleaner in Waffle Cafe. I wouldn't waste my time going here unless you aren't that hungry and you have money to blow.
Very good! I got the bananatella waffle it taste Soo good. My boyfriend got the vegan veggie burger and it was decently good to for someone who doesn't like vegan food at all.
YUMMMMM WAFFFLLESSS!! But really, the waffles are amazing. And the lattes I had were pretty darn good.

This was an unbelievably pleasant surprise. I stopped in for a cup of coffee and felt indulgent so I added a Maple Bacon waffle to the order. Holy moly!  Best waffle I've ever had!  And the Americano was delightful as well. I'd return in a heartbeat!

First time here in Vegas and this place was recommended. . My fiancé got the guru burger and I got the bananatella.. apparently Wednesday's are waffle Wednesday's!! Anyways this place is great! The environment is soooo welcoming and they girls that were here were so friendly ! I didn't get their names :/ the food was just as great as the service !! Thank you guys for being part of my first Vegas trip !!! I'll be back when ever I'm in the neighborhood
This is my second time here and it is great! The waffles are really good, I never know what to order because everything sounds delicious. Would recommend if you are in the area! :)

Came here for the first time the other day and really enjoyed it. I got the Guru Burger and thought it was quite good- this is definitely a compliment from me because, honestly, I'm not usually a huge fan of waffle sandwichs! My previous waffle sandwich experiences have always left me feeling like I could have made the sandwich at home with two Eggo waffles (and it, honestly, would have probably been easier to eat than the folded, taco-ish style they all go for!). This waffle sandwich blew my Eggo creations to the wayside- their waffles are really flavorful and fluffy, better than I've had in ages. I also had one of their seasonal lattes- the Fa La La Latte, because I'm a sucker for anything mint!- and a bit of the lavender latte on accident... which, leads me to my only complaint about this place. I came with a friend who has a very similar sounding name to mine and when the barista called out her name, we both thought it was mine because I had ordered a few minutes before her... well, we were definitely wrong! I thought the latte didn't have much mint to it (but it was damn good, either way!) but didn't think anything of it until the barista called out my name followed by the name of my latte about 5 minutes later. That could have been avoided so easily just by writing the name on the cup. Having to remake a drink sucks way more than taking the 5 seconds to write a name on the cup! Either way, great coffee and great waffles- would recommend! :)

Today was the second time going and it was yet another bad experience. This time I drove 10 minutes there to find out they were closed when their hours posted were 7am. It was 730 with no one in sight. Last time I stood there for 15 minutes to get two coffees. Customer service is awful there and the coffee is subpar. They will not be getting another chance.

The setup of the cafe is nice, there's large tables for big groups to comfortably sit at, complete with a deck of playing cards to entertain you until your food is ready. There's lots of chalk writing on the walls with a bunch of UNLV references and other scrabble, which gives it a local and laid-back feel. It was kinda cool but the colors get obnoxious if you stare at them for too long.

I was pretty impressed with the waffles here. I ordered a sugary cinnamon one, and my boyfriend had one of their waffle sandwiches. I think the only thing slightly disappointing was the coffee. I got a pumpkin spice drink, and the espresso/coffee they made it with tasted burnt and old.

I'd probably return here, but not for the coffee.

Gluten free waffles were delicious! Next time I think I'll get it well done for a bit crispier bite. The West Coast waffle sandwich was super tasty as well. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely go again!

There is nothing like the smell of fresh waffles and coffee in Tiabi!!!
As soon as I walked in I was engulfed by the smell of butter, sugar, and the smell hot irons. I thought I walking through heaven, this is intense.  

These guys have a great list of waffles ranging from sweet to savory.
My favorite sweet waffle is the Vivas Las Elvis
Bananas, peanut butter, chopped bacon and honey on a Belgian waffle. Vegan version-sub bacon and honey for almonds and agave.

I believe the place stands out for the Wafflewiches.  
The West Coast wafflewich is chicken, tomato, avocado and bacon in between a toasted waffle.
The lightly crunch with the saltiness of the chicken and bacon combination is over the top.
Definitely something you must try!

On top of that they make fabulous coffee too, complements the food.
They carry all types of coffee you would expect with few specialties the one I'm eager to try is Tiff's Waffle Machiato; Cinnamon vanilla latte, whipped cream and caramel sauce and served with a churronimo waffle on top. 

The customer service there outstanding!! 
Mae is a delightful person and shes cool to have conversation with. I was fortunate to have similar food interests with her as far as finding new things in town to eat. 

I'll definitely be going back!!

Waffle me, please. 

Once your senses are completely overwhelmed from casino dwelling on the LV Strip, head over to Tiabi for something a bit more down to Earth: smoothies, coffee and waffles. 

It sounds a lot more decadent than it really is: an honest to goodness cafe. No gimmick, no half naked servers, no gaudy decor or slots. Plain and simple good eats, drinks, wifi and everyday people.

Tiabi opens early, around 6:30 am on weekdays. Which is good because I arrived around 7:45, parched and hungry. Strawberry banana smoothie took the edge off for a few hours, then the West Coast waffle sando took care of the rest. 

A few hours of normal does a body good. I headed back to my hotel feeling recharged and ready to take on the Strip again.

Hands down the best coffee shop in Vegas! Coffee is amazing every time!! You have to try the Tiffs waffle macchiato and the Red Bull cider, they have an amazing waffle bar with the freshest Ingredients. Their expresso beans are roasted locally in Nevada and are 1000000 times better than Starbucks! I only wish this place had more locations

First time here & I loved it!! The girl at the register was super sweet and informative . She recommended couple items ( we ended up getting them picture shown) . Prices are reasonable plus we got a 10% for checking in !! Food tastes great you can taste the flavors from fresh strawberries whip and all that !! If I lived in Vegas I would definitely be here all the time !! Definitely recommend !! :)

I had the red velvet with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. One of the best waffles I've ever had.

They had a bunch of really unique weird ones. Like bacon with bananas which you don't think would work but it actually does.

Anyways, highly recommend if you're in the mood for something sweet.

Tiabi is located in the heart of Las Vegas on Maryland and flamingo in the target shopping mall. I like to support independent coffee shops, Tiabi is unique, and they have a variety of coffee flavors and a very large variety of waffles. I ordered the Churro-mon in which was a waffle with cinnamon sugar, I asked for the non-vegan waffle and whip cream on the top. I also ordered the lavender latte hot with almond milk. I had an enjoyable experience the waffle and the coffee were good. The place is clean and the staff is warm and friendly. My only issue was the location. I went early Sunday Morning around 830. There are some homeless men in the area but this part of Vegas has not gone through the revitalization that Freemont East has enjoyed yet, I do like the fact that Tiabi is located there, the area needs businesses like Tiabi to revitalize the area. I would like to support this local business, but I won't return. I was very uncomfortable with the homeless men in front of the shop. There was even a homeless man inside trying to make a purchase with change, he didn't have enough money and went back and forth with the cashier half the time I was there. I wanted to make sure I left the restaurant before Him so that I could get to my car. While He was talking to the cashier I quickly grabbed my purse and went to the door to leave, the homeless man was right behind me. Luckily He went the opposite way from where I was going. I was a little scared by this. I went to my car and locked my door. I noticed the homeless man that I saw inside was near the shop yelling and cursing at an invisible person. Also noticed that there was another homeless man in sitting in the parking lot singing very loudly to himself. Unfortunately I won't be back unless I go with a group. The neighborhood is too sketchy.

Leslie Knope is my spirit animal and one of the traits we share is our love for waffles. As a vegetarian who dabbles in veganism, Tiabi's wide array of sweet, breakfast waffles satisfies my sweet tooth and my dietary needs. Thank you ladies for opening your shop and making Vegas a little sweeter :)

Delicious! There was a quite a wait before receiving our food but they warned us. It's a good think we shared because we ordered a sandwich and a waffle and they came out separately. Both were good. It's nice see them making everything fresh in front of us.

Went to this place during a birthday weekend after I bought a Livingsocial deal, pretty awesome little spot! 

Exceptional customer service, great food, and cool atmosphere. I love small businesses like these, especially in a place like Las Vegas, they are diamonds in the rough!

Trust me, we went to some pretty bad spots using Livingsocial/Groupon deals before here.

John, our cashier was very polite and friendly, and the food was pretty unique. Definitely recommend hitting up this little gem next time you're in Vegas and don't want that tourist Vegas service. :)

Loved the coffee.

Got one of the smaller stuffed waffles from the front case- It was pretty and cute but I didn't really like the taste- kind of mushy on the inside. But I will prob. try something different next time. Super friendly owner and I love the idea. I will most differently be back for the fairly priced delicious coffee and espresso!

I found this place Yelp and with a shining review from my fellow Elite-er I decided to give it a try. I kept it simple...large coffee and a coconut orange muffin. DELICIOUS muffin and a great cup of coffee. Small spot with counter service and easy parking. I'll be back for more !

Excellent staff, very friendly and eager to make sure the customer is satisfied. I'm impressed. I had the bacon maple waffle, it was very tasty. This is very much a cafe, so the portions are smaller, if you're hungry order a couple servings.
Super friendly staff and a yummy selection of waffles! There are so many toppings to choose from! Come check this place out!
This place is amazing! If you're looking for amazing breakfast and lunch this is the place to be! Very trendy and the environment is fun! We're definitely coming back!

It seems to be so rare at times, but they've got it here. Perfect customer service. Friendly, cheerful, helpful, inviting. Felt like I'd known them for years or were neighbors. Food was great too. Need more tables, but place was clean. Music cheerful and modern indie. They thanked everyone too as they left. This was our last stop on our visit to Vegas this trip. I'll be back in a week and likely swing by for breakfast again. I got the golden waffles.

Thoroughly enjoyed my Twilight Lavender Latte,  hubby was ok with his Pistachio Latte, but he's used to heavy sweet flavoring from Starbucks.  I thought it was nice and smooth with enough flavor, not overpowering art all.   Waffles were nice,  not heavy,  well cooked.  Just a little on the small side for seating,  but it worked out. Pleasant employees and a groupon helped!  We will be back.

I'm a big fan of TIABI's other location on Maryland. 

I've recently moved closer to this side of town, and while I was out with my mom on Sunday, I decided to pop in for a coffee.

This location is much smaller than the other, but its cozy and clean. 
Service was great.  The guy who took my order was very nice, and service was quick!

Loved the Twilight Lavender coffee iced!  So delicious.  

I will definitely be coming back soon to have some waffles!

Oh Tiabi. 

"To Inspire and Be Inspired."  My visit yesterday was definitely inspirational.

I came out here last month for the Yelp Coffee Cruise event, and have been trying to make it back since.  Yesterday, I was in the area for a birthday party a little early, so I popped in for coffee and a waffle.  

Tiabi is an adorable little coffee shop, hidden away in the strip mall near Target on Flamingo and Maryland Parkway.  Before the Coffee Cruise, I had no idea it existed, even though I frequent that area all the time. 

Yesterday, when I stopped in,  I took a look at their drink and waffle menu, and decided on the Twilight Lavender Latte, and the Golden Waffle.
