Service was super friendly.  The cashier was polite, and the girl who made my waffle had an infectious smile.  Tiffany, the owner, remembered me from the Cruise, and said hello after I had been seated.  We chatted for a minute, and then my waffle was ready.

So...the coffee.  
Light.  Flavorful.  Aromatic.   Delicious.  I may have done myself a disservice in ordering the Twilight Lavender Latte on my first time back, because I may not ever want to order another drink as long as this is available.  It is SO good...I shared a sip with a friend when I arrived at the birthday party, and her whole face lit up, it is THAT delicious.  Home Run, Tiabi.  Home Run. 

The waffle.  Oh, the waffle. 
The Golden Waffle is simple.  Its a light, crisp on the outside, fluffy on the inside, golden, perfect waffle.  Its dusted with powdered sugar, and served with butter on the side.  There was syrup on the table, but I didn't need any, and I normally drown my waffles in syrup.  

Sweet.  Delicate.  Awesome.  

Tiabi, I'm so glad I had the time to pop by yesterday.  You've excelled at making me feel welcome, and the quality of your offerings is truly inspiring.

Everything is so delicious here! Perfect spot for a brunch break! Super small and cute but very organized and clean! Great customer service! They messed up on my order one time and gave me a free wafflewich for the inconvenience! Two thumbs up

My first time trying a pistachio latté which did not disappoint. Tiabi is a nice cafe with great food options. The interior could use a little sprucing up as I wouldn't want to spend my day here to work/study, but if you're in the area and looking for good coffee and food this is a great option.

Loved this place!! The nice man there gave me 20% off because of an order Grubhub had to cancel, which wasn't even his fault so he didn't have to discount my order but he still went above and beyond to do it. That's first. Second! THE FOOD THERE WAS AMAZING!! Me and my friend ordered the west coast waffle sandwich (amazing) and also the pistachio latte (super amazing). I highly recommend this place for amazing service and amazing food altogether. You won't be disappointed :)

Everything we had was absolutely amazing. We ordered a couple of different waffles and sandwiches and none of us could decide on a favorite. They were all so good! The lattes were also delicious and the staff was so kind and helpful. We'll definitely come back next time we're in Vegas!

This is a really great place if you are looking for something unique. Its on the smaller side, but its very welcoming. The prices are fair and the coffee and waffles are great! I will deffinetly be returning.

I've always come here for drinks. First time I tried food there was yesterday and had that West Coast Wafflewich. Amazing! Not too heavy for all those flavors and that Tiabi sauce was out of this world! Had a Sirena Tea to go with the wafflewich, very refreshing. A must-return-to-restaurant for sure.

Was in town for a concert with friends and wanted to eat breakfast/brunch somewhere not on the strip as we normally do and try someplace new. We found this place on Groupon, turn out our Groupon couldn't be used but still decided to try it. Walked in, staff was very friendly, spacious place, good music playing, cool art on the walls. Lots of different waffles to try! If you love waffles you'll love this place. I got the "Golden Waffle" with a side of fresh fruit and my friends both ordered the "West Coast" Waffle Sandwich. Everyone loved their food, the waffles are made to order. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.

Tiabi's new Aliante location isn't quite up to speed compared to the Maryland location. The small eatery lacks the quirk and style of the second older location, and is bare and white. Hopefully within the coming weeks the new Tiabi will spruce itself up. 

VIVA LAS ELVIS ($6.99): I got the vegan version with coconut bacon and agave. The waffle was a bit overcooked and the peanut butter was also dry. The sliced bananas were the best part. :/ 2/5

WAFFLEDILLA ($5.59): This chicken-waffle sandwich looked pretty plain. Avocado is $0.75 cents extra, but we're not fans of avocado. I think lettuce and tomato could have made the waffledilla more interesting! My husband said it was just okay. 3/5 

COCONUT TRUFFLE ICED COFFEE ($3.50): We ordered a large. This drink was sweet and had a delightful coconut aftertaste. 4/5 

AMBIANCE: Oldie music and Sinatra played in the background, which is fine by me! However, out of three tables inside, two of them were dirty. On the plus side, there was a cute self-serve water station available. Napkins and silverware are also self-serve.

Worth a Return Visit?
We probably won't be rushing back anytime soon, but will give it another whirl once Tiabi works all the kinks out.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #16

Items ordered:
"Snickers" Iced Coffee
Lollies - Red Velvet, Nutella & Almonds
Kisses - Sliced strawberries, chocolate drizzle and whipped cream, served Belgian style
Viva Las Elvis - Bananas, peanut butter, chopped bacon and honey
Honey I'm Home - Vegan Churronimo waffle tossed in cinnamon and sugar topped with vanilla ice cream and honey

Tucked away in a small strip mall off Maryland Parkway and dotted with cute décor plus paintings from local artists it was alongside two friends that I sat down for a midday snack at Tiabi Coffee & Waffles and as much as I really wanted to like the kitschy little spot and their menu of made-to-order takes on the European classic our experience could best be described as mixed, an effect of dogmatic rules regarding the use of discounts and coupons alongside batters that proved utterly unremarkable, the toppings alone serving to save the day in the case of standard and $1-upcharged "Belgian" options, both.  Apparently named as an acronym of the underlying motto "to inspire and be inspired" with free WiFi and an innovative drink list including a rich caramel and cocoa infused iced coffee for myself plus a heavily praised honey cream iced latte for my friend it was after only a few moments of indecision that our order was placed and chatting while we waited the tasting soon began with a duo of $2.50 "lollies," the single strips of spongy dough pressed between hot metal proving paltry in portion and largely flavorless save for the sweet finishing drizzle that unfortunately warned of things to come.  Entirely eschewing savories in favor of items far more sweet it was after perhaps a twenty minute wait that our proper order arrived and beginning first with a doughy Belgian topped with fresh berries beneath artificial tasting chocolate I quickly turned my attention to the alternatives, the Elvis faring a bit better by balancing sweet and savory over a slightly more study base while the "Honey I'm Home" proved the best of bunch in its sugar-crisp coating overlying a somewhat dense crumb - its "veganism" thoroughly compromised by honey and ice cream but the result all the better for it.

This place had me at muffin tops. No, not that kind when jeans are a bit snug;)
Friendly staff, always important!  The staff makes sure that one is satisfied  with your drink order. If not- they will correct that for you:)
Tasty treats, and oh yes tasty caffeine drinks!
Fours stars, it's not close and def out of my way or I would be here more often than not. 
My latest visit I ventured out of my espresso shot habit and ordered a pistachio latte:
Half the sweetness 
Non fat milk
End result: pistachio delight!
I've been here probably a total of ten times, always with a tasty caffeine pick me up.

Perfect place for a Sunday breakfast/brunch. We ordered the Red Velvet waffle, Bananatella, Pistachio latte and the Guru Burger. Added some fresh fruit on the waffle for a dollar more.All of them were just so good! Definitely recommend.

Tiabi Waffles was really good. Worthy the drive. Hidden on the side of a strip mall with a a Target. I had the Banana Nutella waffle as. Late afternoon snack along with a Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee. Bother we're very nice. The coffee was very sweet. The waffle was just right. Sliced bananas whipped cream and Nutella. What more could you want?

Wait time was way more than expected, 38 minutes for a waffle is insane. When my partner and I finally got our waffles, they were cold and hard.  

My partner requested no whip cream due to her being lactose intolerant. Watching you guys scrape the whip cream off is lazy and unprofessional. There's still traces of whip cream on there...

Customer service wasn't very friendly. We found Tiabi through Yelp based on their reviews and the overall experience was NOT up to par. It was very disappointing. 

Environment was overwhelming crowded. The layout is a bit compact and not ideal for a large group of people. We had to sit at a dirty table until 2 mins before we received our food. It was disgusting. 

Our drinks (teas) were also not given to us until 2 mins before our food arrived. Water wasn't even offered. 

Don't get me wrong, we weren't expecting Ritz Carlton service BUT the basics of dining at a cafe. We might try it again when it's less busy, but I would give our overall experience 1 out of 5 stars.

If you are ever in Vegas and is in dire need for caffeine, opt for Tiabi instead, their handcrafted coffees are sooo good. My favorite is their Pistachio iced latte. (sad that I don't know where to get the exact blend in CA) The waffles and sandwich waffles are pretty dang tasty too. Highly recommend.

This place was so so good. Got the pecan candied vegan waffle just for kicks (not vegan) and coffee with almond milk and vanilla. So fantastic. Can't wait to try this place again. They seemed to have a fantastic variety of fresh juices too.

I got the West Coast, and it tastes awesome! Couple it with syrup and it tastes amazing! My wife got the Banatella with strawberries instead of bananas and a side of vanilla ice cream and milk. Overall, I'm from Cali but I'm hitting up this place every time I come! Totally recommend!!

My girlfriend had a groupon which landed me here on a Sunday morning, well morning for me, which was 1 PM. The place was slammed and the four employees behind the counter were busy making fresh smoothies, espresso, waffles, and the like.

My iced honey latte was perfection. Fresh espresso, cream, and a touch of honey. It wasn't overly sweet and it still tasted like coffee. Really enjoyed it. It was just too small. I had to order another.

I got the Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich. Really nothing too special about it. Fresh made waffle, egg, cheese, and sausage. Wasn't awful, wasn't knock my socks off. It was offered with either a side of fruit or house made chips for $1, I opted with the fruit (because this was a total fat kid breakfast).

As I stated previously, the place was slammed. My friend and I snagged a table after a group of four left. We stacked up the dishes and ate at the "dirty" table because we are savages and needed the immune system boost.  We sat at that dirty table and the place had died down, not once did the 4 people behind the counter begin to clean the place up or even clear our dishes. 

Decent spot, coffee was the bombDOTcom, food was meh. Definitely would go back for the coffee, but I'd skip the food.
I am not a vegan but their vegan waffles are so good! And there coffees are creative and delicious. I love going back there!
pistachio Iced Coffee is better than #sex this place has so many creative options from down right satisfying to vegan options. I'm in love   Banana Nutella Waffle

4.5 stars!!

It's surprising how much this place has grown on me. It's really not a bad place coffee, small bites, etc. nearby UNLV. I've tried multiple items and have been satisfied each time - never have I felt I wasted my money. 

Hot White Mango Tea - I was having a huge headache and getting this hot tea definitely made me feel better. I'm not usually a flavored hot tea person but this will be my togo when I'm craving a hot and healthier beverage.

Iced Caramel Macchiato - The coffee taste here is suuuper heavy - not too much of my thing, will skip this for the future.

Tropical Siena and Just Peachy Tea - they are separate teas and I've tried them both. The taste for both were a bit subtle, can live without it in the future.

Red Velvet Frappe - holy crap is it good here or what. Per me since I don't like too much chocolate, I've asked them to lessen the Cocoa and oh my, it is delish. Per bun it's probably the best we've found out here so far.

Waffle Sandwiches:

The Waffle Dilla - add the avocado. You'll thank me later.

Cheers!

Um the frankestien coffee has five shots of expresso and it made me tired...  It's over priced coffee and I've tried a few flavors for 5$ really isn't worth going there.  It's good to try it once and try a unique coffee.  Waffles are weird
Great savory waffles. A little stingy on the fruits with the paceman. Delicious place overall

We tried the ice coffee, peach tea, Viva las Elvis waffle and the Breakfast Waffle Sandwich with Turkey sausage instead of bacon. 
Overall the coffee was better than McDonald's, 7eleven, dunkin iced coffee but I didn't enjoy it more than Starbucks. The price was also a bit higher. This is just my personal taste preference but my opinion nonetheless. 
The breakfast sandwich was alright but didn't come with any sides like salsa. Also the Viva Elvis didn't have butter but was acceptable with the toppings. The tea was freshly brewed and I admire that. 
Overall I would not give this place a second go anytime soon as what they offered wasn't out of this world or a game changer. I have had far better homemade waffles and coffee in my time and seeing this is the bread and butter of the business it should exceed all others and then only add to the greatness with other optional dishes. The place could use a bit more outdoor seating, however the place is in not in the largest area for seating options.

I love this place! Super chill coffee shop with the best vegan food around. Their special coffee drinks are all worth trying but I recommend the lavender latte. It has a good vibe for doing work in or for a casual date. Definitely stop by this place if you're in the UNLV area.

The Good : We had the waffles with fruit and a bananatella waffle. They were all delicious!! We also had iced coffees which were great as well. The staff is super friendly. 

The Bad: they forgot to make one of our waffles. We had to remind them. 

The Ugly: the restroom was a bit dirty and we went right when they opened. 

But, yes , I recommend this place. Flaws were minor.

When I came to Vegas on vacation, this was my last breakfast stop before headed back to NYC and I wish I could have taken it with me! :( I miss this so much, I crave their mixed coffee drinks! They've inspired me to try out recipes and maybe open up a food truck. HA love it though and can't wait to come back to Vegas and make this my go to breakfast spot!
Good coffee and good waffles.  Impressed with thr vegan waffle.  Service was excellent

Order the kisses with bacon. Its the best thing you will every place in your mouth. Think strawberry and bacon infused waffle with whipped cream and nutella to top it off. It is fabulous and they make it super cutsie. Staff here is awesome, they really know what they are doing and have a knowledge of what people like.

I LOVE this place. My favorite restaurant hands down! Vegan options, fair price, and delicious fresh food. It usually feels like they don't really have quite enough people on staff, but I don't think the wait is ever unreasonable. Most employees are friendly and listen well. They give student discounts and have cool lil events every once in a while. They have also a Leslie Knoppe quote on the wall, so they clearly have it together. Definitely give this place a try. True Vegas gem

Yummy! We decided to find something to eat for breakfast of of the Vegas strip and thanks to Yelp found this great cafe! Great waffles and great coffee! Oh and the people working there are fantastic!!

The Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich was pretty amazing. I didn't quite enjoy the cold brew as much as I wanted, it was a bit too bold and not very smooth. Prices were good since I had a student discount. Would definitely stop by again for the breakfast sandwiches.
Dropped in for coffee and glad I did.  Ordered a caramel macchiato, which was amazing!  I was also very impressed with the quality of customer service.  I look forward to returning here soon.
Very yummy! The vegan waffle is so light and has a great flavor(: I think I had the vegan waffle with the cheese if that's what it's called haha? Don't remember it was really good!

It's super cute inside with magazines, games, and good music and the staff was super sweet and helpful. The coffee was sweet but good (got the cupcake latte and the iced dirty mocha chai... The second was too chocolately to be a real chai honestly)
But for a healthy place, they had no egg whites! Which to me is silly. 
We ordered the white macadamia waffle nut which was good but they put the toppings on top, not inside the batter which would've made it better. The toasty Tokyo was good along with the waffle club.  
The groupon and punch cards are a nice touch. Giving it four stars because it's great that a place like this is by UNLV where there are no breakfast places or healthy places.

If you like candy and everything sweet, then this is a good place for you. Their churro waffles are good, but the coffee-and I've tried multiple different ones-all taste like Bonnie Bell lip balm. They're also insanely overpriced for what they are.

Came here because of the reviews and the one $. Definitely lived up to our expectations!!!! While we were staring at the menu the cashier asked us if we wanted help with ordering (LOVE be asked as opposed to someone just jumping in!!) he asked what my taste preferences were and offered examples, sweet, savory, etc. he then made suggestions based on our answers. We took his suggestions and we were very pleased! He was totally on point!! I also had the coffee of the day, Guatemalan. Smooth and robust! Not bitter like another coffee place we all know and love ;) ! I cannot wait to come back try a few other items! I definitely want to try their Kale smoothie next, sounds divine!
Very good breakfst!! Waffledilla and west coast are bombs.  Will be coming back for more in this place

This is probably the best coffee and waffle place in Las Vegas. The best thing about this place is they have lot of basic stuff that you can expect at a waffle shop but then their own creations AKA Wafflewiches kills it. Their espressos and lattes are nice. More of the darkers side. Being a vegetarian, I tried the Guru burger. It was good size and I was set for the day. Try it with their special TIABI sauce.
So cute and so yummy! Always have gotten the West Coast sandwich and check in for a free lolli
Amazing waffles and coffee. Service is great.  Staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is awesome.  We are in town for a few days and will definitely be back.

Coffee and waffles? YES PLEASE!

Came across this great spot on the Yelp app - on the hunt for something sweet. We skipped the coffee, but sure got our sweet tooth craving fulfilled with one of their delicious waffles.

They have various waffles to choose from with toppings such as nutella, banana, strawberries, chocolate and other sweets. Then they also have savory waffle sandwiches with bacon, turkey - and even egg and cheese!

We stuck with the Banana Tella which has banana, nutella drizzle, almonds and whipped cream. You can make any waffle a "dessert" by adding a scoop of ice cream. YES PLEASE! The waffle was incredible. I would of liked more of a "home made" whip cream - this one was possibly from the can - but it was still great.

We got the chance to chat up the owner and she was so nice! We asked her about the concept and apparently it started as a coffee shop - then they wanted to add some desserts and decided waffles would be a good fit - then decided to hit the lunch crowd so they added the savory waffles. Genius!

Awesomee concept - great folks working there - and a delicious product! Wish I had tried the coffee! Aw, well - gives me reason to come back to Vegas!

Probably the best waffle ever. Perfect amount of crispiness. The butter was just enough and light. The guys that run this place already have the reviews to match the restaurant. The mix of healthy options to compliment the waffle are a bonus. The service was top notch. Super friendly and customer service oriented.

This place was pretty packed for a Saturday morning.  The prices are really good for the large waffle breakfast sandwiches, probably just a little more than what you would pay at a fast food joint.  I really enjoyed my chicken BLT waffle sandwich, the waffle just had a slight crunch on the outside but was still soft on the inside.  They have a special sauce...that didn't quite come through, it could have used a little more sauce to balance the sandwich out.  Overall, cute atmosphere with a lot of good breakfast options and drink options.  The service was a little slow since they were so busy.  I think it took them almost 10 minutes before they took our order =(, but I would still go back for a lazy Saturday breakfast/brunch.

Super cute shop, great menu variety, decent food, but SLOW AF. 

Came here for what we thought was a fast breakfast option. Just to take our orders took a while. Ok, whatever. Got coffee orders quick, a good sign. Then we proceeded to wait like 45 minutes for our food to come out. How long does it take to toast a damn waffle and put some toppings or sandwich meat and eggs in the middle? 

The service is friendly. The atmosphere for the restaurant is nice. It's laid-back and relaxed. Clean bathrooms are a plus. But perhaps the laid-backness is what caused the slow food. 

We got the Green Nut (?) the super green smoothie, the breakfast sandwich plus sausage and bacon, and the western sandwich. The green smoothie tasted like what you'd expect of a green smoothie, I wouldn't really want to get it again cuz it wasn't much of a wow. The breakfast sandwich was tasty. Not too flavorful but I didn't mind it. The western was delicious and the highlight. The waffle was perfect. 

3 stars because it doesn't deserve lower. But I don't think I'd come back based on how long it takes to get a WAFFLE.

We had The West Coast and 2 Hot Chocolates and Maple Baci  Waffle.    Everything was absolutely delicious we will definetly be back... I wish they had a patio to smell some fresh air and open later like midnight.  The staff was cool!!!
I'm such a fan of this place! Quality ingredients that you can taste for a fair price! Everyone that works here is super friendly and upbeat. Try the West Coast sandwich as soon as humanly possible!

What a spectacular find! The lady working was so friendly and helpful. There are different waffle sandwiches you can get or you can do a build your own waffle with custom toppings. I got the classic golden waffle but I want to go back to try the churro waffle! They also have a pretty expansive drinks menu that range from creamy espresso drinks to light teas with basil! The prices are pretty good, for two customized waffles and a coffee was about $16. This place is definitely worth a try.
DELICIOUS!!!!   We had the Vegan Waffle with coconut vegan bacon and Strawberries.  It was perfect.

My friend's backyard is this strip of businesses. I don't even know why he drove? Lol. We were way due for this so-called monthly promise of getting together no matter what. Life happens. I got children...he has none. So really it's me who has been slacking. Now that I'm done with confessionals...

I show about 936am. There was only another couple who were ready to be done. It is not big in there. Just a few tables inside and one outside. Or two? Dang, forgot. Since we agreed to this spot the night prior...I had all ready scoped the menu online. I opted for the vegan wafflewich--which has tomatoes, spring mix, avocado, and their Tiabi sauce for $5.50. Call me boring, but hey...that's what I wanted! The waffle itself was cooked very accordingly for what it was holding inside it. I wondered if it'd be too crispy/overcooked would the tomatoes and avocado along with their sauce sog the waffle..but no it didn't! I mean, I had it sitting there while chitchatting so it definitely help up. I completely forgot to ask if the waffle is literally vegan, because if not...they should change the name of that sandwich. I don't exactly know what the TIABI sauce consists of...I thought it was rather light and peppery, but it blended well with the vegetables in my sandwich. The vegetables were very fresh and crispy. Love that. If you don't have a sweet tooth or feel like consuming anything with meat, I think this is a great meal choice.

I also ordered their honey creme latte as an iced drink. Honestly, I don't know shit about coffee and lattes. Lol.  I just thought adding such a drink to my morning breakfast with the homeboy felt like I was completing the tone. So if you're like me, it tasted like a light iced coffee that's been creamed out. Coffee lovers don't frown! Lol. HOWEVER, I thought it was pretty good. It even sat for a few hours after I left Tiabi (yes, I didn't finish it) and I was seriously amazed it didn't taste watered down. It definitely got my day going without feeling whacked out. I would order it again.

So my friend is on a diet...he had a smoothie! I can't even begin to tell you how sideways I looked at him. Make it a cheat morning and get the Viva Las Elvis you retard!! Says the person who ordered a vegan wafflewich. He thoroughly enjoyed his banana peanut butter smoothie .

There were two people working that morning and they were certainly friendly and humorous. I did think my wafflewich took just a tad long than I'd imagine it taking considering what i was ordering. I kind of excused it because the other worker had just started. Training mode i assume. There were only two things that got me curious that morning...1)I wasn't sure where the hell to put our trash and the workers were in the back for a bit to even ask 2) I see a case for vegan pastries but twas empty? Boo. Not that serious, though. Those 2 things are stuck in my memory bank from that morning. Oh! so we just left my plate on the table. I'm assuming that's the drill.

As we exited a couple mothers with their jogging strollers and one of their dogs rolled in. Dog outside, obviously. Other than that, it was fairly quiet and the place wasn't dirty. If you love waffles, then I highly recommend it! Definitely kid friendly, but I'd skip bringing the stroller(s) in.

Enjoy!
Great little place. My Belgian style bacon waffle was perfect! Plenty of parking, fast WiFi, & super-friendly folks.

We chose to eat here at tiabi before our first day at Edc, with my husband and I from Sacramento and a bunch of our friends from Los Angeles, we were really excited to try out this really cute waffle shop. Seeing the pictures and menu on Yelp, I already super intrigued by the banana and Nutella waffle. 
With a big group entering the shop, we were sort of aware that maybe we would have to split up our group to sit down and eat. 
It was self serve, so we each ordered our meal, standing around at first trying to find a spot to sit. Eventually we found a table big enough for us if we all squished together. 
The food sort of took a little while to get to our table, but we did get our drinks first. 
I ordered the Serena tea (or something like that I don't remember), but it was super refreshing. Especially against that Las Vegas heat. Some of our friends had also ordered several other drinks, and they loved theirs as well. 
When our food finally came, we got the sandwiches first. Most of my friends had ordered the west coast sandwich, and they were super pleased with it. Another one of my friend ordered the Thai chicken and he was really glad with that one as well.
Overall I'd say that tiabi was pretty satisfying for my group of friends. Although small, it does give off a comfortable vibe. Very easy going and relaxed, the customer service was also pretty great.

Really awesome breakfast experience. 
From now on, our first breakfast option in Las Vegas

This place lives up to the hype. I ordered the West Coast waffle sandwich and it was delicious! I also tried their snickers iced coffee and in my opinion it tastes just like a snickers bar. I will return. Recommended.

Loved this little coffee shop in the middle of a not so great area. Was looking for a caffine lift and found this place nearby where I was. When you walk in it is a very cafe vibe-not so much coffee shop. The decorations are super cool and there is a lot to see inside this small place.

They have a nice variety of waffles both regular and vegan. I think this is a good choice for breakfast and even for vegans and non vegans so they can eat well together. They also have meat waffles such as bacon, fruit waffles and tons of other tasty choices. 

 They have a hot lavender Infused latte which I loved, and many options for cold coffee as well. If in the area its a great choice for a nice homemade waffle and a good coffee.
Excellent coffee drinks and great food,  as long as you like waffles.  Freshly made waffles, smell so good.   Tried the pistachio coffee, excellent.

I'm so excited to eat this west coast wafflewiche. Got big reviews that it's the best sandwich. 
Shoutout to Jessica for her awesome customer service and helping me because I've never been here. 
She was a true help, THANKS :-)

This place had delicious food, tasty coffee and a cool vibe. The people working there were friendly and helpful. It was my first visit and I am glad I found it. It's a local gem and I will be frequenting this place often now! They suggested "The West Coast" sandwich for lunch and it was very tasty. I paired it with "Tiff's Waffle Macchiato" and a cool glass of ice water. I sat and read my book, ate my lunch and enjoyed the chill atmosphere and my tasty food/beverage. Thanks guys and gals for a great experience.

The coffee and food was delicious! Ambiance and prices are wonderful. The only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is the speed of service, they were just really slow at getting the drinks and food out. Everything else was great!

These vegan waffles have been on my radar for a while and I'm glad I finally got to try it! 

My bf & I came in on a Friday at about 8:30am and we were the only ones in the restaurant at this time so we were served right away. It's cafe type ordering so you just order and pay at the register and seat yourself. 

Since it was our first time, I asked the girl which items were vegan and she told me the only one was "Viva Las Elvis" which had coconut bacon, peanut butter and agave syrup on top. I'm not a huge fan of PB but decided to give it a try since she said it was the only vegan option. Little did I know, after I ordered I saw on yelp reviews that they do offer vegan butter to top your waffles which sort of bothered me as to why she didn't give me the heads up on that since I could've technically ordered another "non vegan" waffle and just customized it to be vegan. I mean I did like my waffle but it wasn't the greatest and wished I had opted for the butter pecan waffles instead but maybe next time. 

My bf absolutely loved the Guru Burger and couldn't be more satisfied! We liked the fact that the patty isn't made of soy and is made of superfood ingredients that make the burger so much more enjoyable. We also got a free "snickers" iced coffee with check in which was also pretty good. 

Overall, we had a good first time experience. The staff was friendly, I love how big the cafe is and it's a perfect place to study for students especially since it's right by UNLV!

Found this place on Yelp and was not let down. Simon greeted us and helped me out with what to order. Very friendly and knowledgable. Great food and we couldn't believe the awesome prices. I had a breakfast waffle sandwich, and my fiancé had a Nutella waffle with banana. Not to mention we both had specialty coffee drinks and the whole bill came out to practically $20. We will be coming back again!

This small, locally owned eatery is close to UNLV.  It is in the Target shopping center and is difficult to find the first time.  But it's worth it!  The food is spectacular! 
The waffles are crispy and chewy, the coffee is delicious, and the ambience is fun and quirky.   It is apparent that customer service is very important, as all customers are treated well.  Both the savory and sweet waffles are fantastic!  It should be a must go for every Las Vegan!

Great place. me and my lady tried it. food was delicious. service was very good. the woman was very thoughtful and took care of us. forgot to leave a tip though. felt bad about it. looking forward to returning even though its far from my house.

Really, really slow. I know this isn't McDonalds, but 30 min. to get half our order and another 20 to get the rest? This was 9:30 am and there were only 6 other people in there the entire 1:15 hours we were there. Really cute place, small portions at great prices; but it just doesn't matter when they are so slow. Seriously, the woman behind the counter was even moving slow, no sense that people might be coming to her food establishment because they are hungry. And - the reason for 1 star- I could see her work because I was facing the counter, she was handling all the food with her bare hands. Picking up waffles, slicing strawberries, AND taking cash, answering the business phone, texting on her cell phone, never putting on gloves to handle food AND never washed her hands. Disgusting, I won't be back.
Still love you Tiabi but I've been coming here for a long time and the restaurant just looks dirty and things look worn out and yeah... still love you though  food 10/10
Don't usually go out for breakfast. I had a friend in town and she didn't want McDonald's . I had the west coast and an iced snickers . Will get again. Loved it!!!

Just ate here first time. Foods are okay. It just took so long to get our two orders. Waited abt.20 min. Long long waiting while not many customers and its Monday late morning. 

I received the reply from the owner to my review bi think we have to try the place one more time. Hope it will be good next time.  

Since the restaurant left me msg, we will try one more time when we go to LV next time. At least they care of review. That is good to know.

I don't know why I've waited this long to write a review but I should have a long time ago. I LOVE THIS PLACE. The coffee is great, the waffles are delicious, and the place is spacious and great for working or studying. Music isn't too loud and the service is great. 

If you get a chance stop by this place and enjoy!
This place serves good coffee in different fun ways! Oh and the waffles are are delicious as well! No too sweet, savory options as well!

First introduced to TIABI Coffee at their first location on Maryland Pkwy for a Yelp Coffee Cruise event, I was happy to learn that they would eventually open a second location in our neighborhood.  I told co-owner Tiffany S. at that time that I couldn't wait and sure enough, we frequent TIABI quite often since they opened.  My usual order is the Honey Cream latte with almond milk, but the other drinks that I also like are the Twilight Lavender Latte and the Pistachio Latte.  Waffles are a specialty here as their name says.  Try the Red Velvet or the Bananatella for a sweet treat.  
There are still several other items I have yet to try, but since this is TIABI is so close, I'll get around to them sooner or later.  A great addition to our neighborhood and an excellent coffee stop for the locals.

New find thanks to a friend that posted on ig.  I had the breakfast wafflewich.  I added a side of bananas with churro dust with chocolate drizzle.  Had my regular iced coffee with 3 shots.  The music was upbeat and the vibe is super chill.  I will be back I will be back to try a build your own waffle :)

Very friendly staff, amazing waffles and the coffee was epic.  Try "Tiff's Special"!  It is a cinnamon latte topped with a churro style waffle.  Amazing!  Can I move the restaurant to the East Coast?!
Food was alright. I don't know if I would go back. I didn't find the food to be very tasteful, it was pretty bland. It was also kinda pricey for what you get.

Went here from the Strip on my vacation with the Groupon deal and enjoyed it!  Had the Waffle Breakfast sandwich and it was pretty good, could have used more sausage though.  The owners/cooks/cashiers were very friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome on our visit.  They explained the whole menu and asked where we were from and were very helpful in deciding what we should have.  You should check it out!

Is there anyone here willing to argue that waffles aren't delicious? That's right, I rest my case. 


Anyway, this place was not exactly what I expected when I read the Yelp reviews... I was picturing a cute little café with table service. What I got was essentially a coffee shop that happened to have waffles in a strip mall. This is not necessarily a bad thing, it just was completely unexpected. I was planning on getting a waffle and egg sandwich, until I found out that they use those weird egg patty things (they don't, you know, cook an egg), so that was out. Ended up getting the Elvis, waffle with peanut butter, bacon, and banana.... of course this was good, how could that be bad?!?! I also had their specialty latte with the cinnamon that comes with a triangle of the cinnamon vegan waffle (got the latte sans vanilla syrup, you know, being healthy and all... lol).... oh ya, super tasty. Definitely a dessert. The waffle was crisp and delicious, the latte was sweet and dessert -y. The breakfast was cheap and satisfying. I would return!

First time here, greeted with good music, a "hi ! Welcome in! and a simple but clean menu. Mainly focusing on waffles (Awesome) they offer their own twists to iconic breakfast food including a churro style or red velvet waffle, make it a viva las Elvis and you got one wild treat. They have daily lunch specials for around $6. so i ordered the signature tiffs waffle macchiato (its topped with a CHURRO WAFFLE!)  And a waffledilla ( yes a quesadilla but with a waffle! With chicken and bacon in it! What!) 

Overall:    sollliiddd

Omg. Hidden gem. I had the bananella waffle replacing the almonds with candied pecans because i didnt want almonds. This was amazing. I chose to eat the sweet waffles and it truely did not disappoint. I had a side of turkey sausage patties. I really didnt care about those. It was dry. I should have gotten bacon. Cant go wrong with a side of bacon. We had the Just peachy green tea. That was pretty good too. Nice and refreshing. My sister got the West Coast. The tiabi sauce is to die for. I would come back for that sauce. If you want savory, get the west coast. Overall great place to have breakfast. I would come back. I would have given 5 stars. I subtracted a star for the turkey sausage. My only disappoint. Dudes that work there was very nice and helpful.

Atmosphere: naturally well lit, café style layout with open counter and free WiFi.

Beverage: pistachio latte with no expresso. Very tasty and addictive. Dipped my strawberries in it and was great.

Food: chicken berry salad with waffles. Super fresh and abundantly flavorful. Waffles make a neat crouton like crunch. Waffles are light and crispy crunchy with light soft inside. 

Waffle breakfast sandwich was delicious. The cheese was great.

Service: very friendly and bubbly like. Offered more dressing and asked if we needed any else a few times. No gossiping behind counter unlike most casino cafes. They seemed all very happy, adding to the light atmosphere. 

Clean restrooms

Definitely going back.

The coffee here is amazing, the iced coconut truffle is my favorite! 

The breakfast sandwich is what let me down. Plain dry waffle, with 3 strips of bacon, small slab of cheese and barely an egg. Not worth $6 in my opinion. I could definitely find any jack in the box and get the same exact thing for HALF the price and drive.
Really amazing service and food. Ordered the guru burger last time I was here and it was one of my favorite vegan burgers ever !

Great coffee, waffle was outstanding.  A bit of a wait for everything, but worth it!
I ordered the Tiff's waffle Macchiato and a butter pecan waffle.  My son ordered the West Coast and a Rebel Punch.  We both agreed we will be back!

I like it. My friend got me the hashtag breakfast sandwich and I like it! I can't speak much for their service but my friend said she had to wait a awhile for the food and her waffle was too crispy and overdone. However I will come back to try their coffee and other tings

Came in with my family of 4 (including two kids)...ordered Tiabi Red Velvet, Hashtag, two Hash Tag Sandwhiches and two mocha latee's...food was pretty good...coffee was sweet...ambiance was cute...seating was lacking...staff is nice...service was super slow...50 minutes to get 1/2 our order out!!!  Over an hour to get second half of order!!!  It's a fairly new establishment...hopefully they pick it up...it has a lot of potential.  I probably wont be back.
Stopped in on a whim now I'm dying to go back for more. Waffles with Nutella and banana are my fave and the coffee was good too.

I decided to come here on a Friday at 1 p.m. while visiting Las Vegas. The pictures on Yelp looked absolutely wonderful which made me really want to go.

Parking is free and was easy to find. The store is located in a strip mall with okay ambience, but nothing that I was too impressed with. 

I decided to order Tiff's Waffle Macchiato because the combination of a coffee and waffle seemed amazing. While the churro waffle was tasty, the coffee was super gross and I could not finish it. It made me wish that I had only ordered a waffle and not gone for the coffee.

While the service was friendly, I was not asked whether I wanted my order for here or to-go and their default was to make it to-go. It was only after they tried to hand me the waffle in a paper bag that I corrected them that I would like it for here. That was sort of disappointing and I wish I was asked while ordering instead.

If I come back it will be for the waffles only and to try some of the vegan menu items. I would definitely not recommend getting coffee here.
Wooo! Wow what a treat! Wonderful rich coffee and a warm greeting from the staff! The food and coffee were to die for.

It's a waffle heaven place, the must try things here for me is a west coast waffle that has chicken, bacon and avocado on a classic waffle and for dessert order a Belgian waffle with banana, strawberries and of course some Nutella. You haven't lived until you'll had some!!!

Tiabi aptly stands for "To Inspire and Be Inspired" and I was inspired to stuff my face hole with waffles.  

Visited on Sunday 6-26-16 at 10AM.   $28.34 got us a breakfast waffle sandwich, two drinks, a side of fruit, a cookie, and a variety waffle. This restaurant is located two doors down from Sakana on Flamingo & Maryland behind Target.  

I had the viva las elvis waffle for $6.99 which is a waffle topped with honey, peanut butter, bananas, and chopped bacon.  I was literally in heaven.  It's one of the best things I've ever eaten.  My only complaint would be they serve real maple syrup which I hate...I'd rather have the fake Aunt Jamima stuff clogging up my arteries and killing me slowly.  #DIABEETUS

I also had the Tiff's Waffle Macchiato for $3.95.  I had the iced version and it was wonderful.  I loved the whipped cream topping and the waffle on top was still warm and covered in cinnamon and sugar.  

Service was fast and friendly.  I highly recommend this place.

love the decoration in this place! super rad star wars paintings near bathroom done by Patrizia who I randomly know from bikram yoga! the staff was very friednly and helped my boyfriend and I picked the perfect drink.. we got their khale drink and it was refreshing and delicious! we weren't hungry enough to try a waffle but we are definitely going back!
Food is rlly good, tastes fresh & not greasy or fattening. A little pricey, but worth it, you get what you pay for. They also have vegan options which is cool (:

As I sit here recovering from the prior nights festivities, relaxed, content, and belly full from a hashtag breakfast sandwich(photo will follow), I'm actually debating whether to have a waffle dessert.  Being that I'm always in search for new and exciting places to experience, this place is now my goto coffee spot for the Vegas Road Trips. 

If you love Belgian waffles, you will enjoy these.  They make the Vegan batter here in the premises.  I'm not Vegan, but I am for the period of time it takes to scarf one. They have many of sandwiches and desserts to choose from, all made with waffles, including the Churronimo(a waffle churro), which I wolfed down yesterday.  

The coffee items that I've experienced so far are the Red Velvet Latte, speaks for itself, and the Espresso Frankenstein.  One would think the Frankenstein to be a very strong and intense drink, one would be correctamundo.  Four shots, ice, and agave, all blended together into a very light and frothy monster of a drink...don't be scared, try it!  Even though it's strong, it's not bitter strong.  You can really taste the roasted smoothness of the beans. 

Yes TIABI has hit a home run with me.  The staff is lively, informative, accommodating and diligent.  To the owners Mae and Tiffany I thank you.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon to try a new vegan option in Vegas. The PB&Banana waffle was tasty and I appreciated the house-made coconut bacon. My friend really liked his chicken and avocado waffle. The atmosphere could use a little love and I'd love an outdoor patio, but all and all a cute little spot.

I recently went to Tiabi with my wife. She had the kisses waffles, and I had the viva las Elvis waffles.  We also shared a west coast waffle sandwich. Everything came out well-presented, and the food was delicious. Not too sweet, not too salty, just right.  And although we ordered three items to share, it was not too heavy.  The service was superb. I only wish I lived closer so that I could make this a more regular thing!

I've been here a few times now. Trust this picky Vegan...you're in the right place for waffles and coffee drinks. My wife likes the RedBull drink, I think it's called Rebel Punch?. I liked their waffles so much I had to recreate them at home. You can tell they are into the craft, and you have to respect that. I'll be back soon!

Decaf coffee flavorless. Was told that people don't know the taste of coffee that order decaf. Bacon was microwave, waffle thickness of toast. Two drinks and two waffles for over 20 bucks could have make better at home with my money. Guy at counter was super nice but he service wasn't enough to want to ever return.

The remark about the decaf coffee was made by the young lady who made the coffee. The flavor of your waffle was good. It was the quanity and quality of your other ingredients used that were not good especially for the price.

OMG!!! The best Waffles ever. Went here with my beautiful daughter and ordered the West Coast sandwich with house chips and a red velvet waffle with a 20 oz Coca-Cola and a 20 oz Dragonfruit Vitamin water.

First both waffles were cooked to perfection with a crisp crunchy texture and served warm fresh from the waffle iron.

The West Coast was loaded with chicken slices, bacon slices, avocado slices and tomato slices with Tiabi Sauce and cheese. 

The house chips were very good with a awesome seasoning that was a little sweet and savory. I'm glad I ordered them and I would recommend that everyone must try it for themselves. You'll thank me later.

The Red Velvet Waffle was topped with of chocolate chips, hot fudge and whipped cream. 

They have some great coffee drinks and other beverages to choose from.

There is free wifi and a roomy seating and study area and outlets to juice up your gadgets.

We will definitely be back for the best waffles that I have ever ate.

I was craving a good breakfast place when I found this little beauty. Oh man, did this place not disappoint. I got the maple bacon waffle. First off, I like bacon, but most of the time I feel like people overdo it. This, however, was the perfect amount of crisp, fresh bacon mixed into the BATTER and then cooked into an amazingly soft but crisp waffle. Offset the saltiness of the bacon with a sticky sweet maple syrup and you have a perfectly balanced waffle. I also got the honey cream latte. I do feel like the honey needed to be intensified a little more to cut through the bold taste of the espresso, but overall it was a nice fresh taste on a normal latte. Will definitely track this place down again the next time I'm in Vegas.
Great selections and coffee! Waffles are too crispy..almost burnt! I would recommend asking for them not to cook your waffle so long, unless you like them that way!

Thanks to yelp. we found this local waffle house before we headed back home. Attentive staff and a place with characters. Decent coffee (had to have their Waffle Macchiato...its dessert) only one thing missing was they could of roasted the almond on the Viva Las Elvis. 

Side note and its kind of unrelated: Why can we have a place like this in Tucson? Last time we had the lemon puppy seeds waffle at Mother hubbard's it was disaster...They effing poured the lemon syrup and sprinkled the puppy seeds over the plain waffle. And we waited for 45 min for that lousy waffle. Still pissed me off today!!! 
 
Solid 4 stars.
Great fast service. Nice relaxing enviroment, especially if you are staying on the strip. Reasonable prices and portions.
Super yummy waffles and a great selection for vegans. Wish it wasn't so far from my side of town!

Great vegan options and reasonably priced! Had the viva Elvis waffle with vegan coconut bacon and savory Thai bail sand which with vegan cheese. Both were really good!  All waffles are vegan so that's great to know. Coffee was really good ;)

I was so excited to try this place. I always try to find unique places in Vegas and this placed sounded just like that.

Why three stars? Well, it's a great idea for a business using waffles on every single plate but unfortunately their waffles are not unique.

We ordered:
- Kisses Waffle
- Golden Waffle
- Waffledilla 
- South West Sandwich
- Breakfast Sandwich 
- Americano
- Chai Latte
- tuxedo frap
- waffle caramel ice coffee

While the whole menu idea is creative, some of the waffles were burnt and crunchy. The kisses waffle, golden waffle and Waffledilla were so toasted that it would hurt to eat them.

All others were soft and done the right way. Flavor was ok but nothing to wow anybody. I just feel that they are missing something that makes their waffles in general stand out.

Their drinks were amazing. I would definitely come back for drinks. Tasty and several options available.

The Good:
- Great cafe in a random strip mall
- Nice Staff
- Great Drinks
- Only one of the very few places that have Stevia

The Bad:
- Burnt Waffles
- We got all coffees on to-go cups although we ate there. 
- No High-Chairs available

If you are really hungry. This is not the place to order, waited for my food about 45 minutes. It was not as good as the reviews made it seem. I deff recommend Bruxie on Las Vegas Blvd, I mean it's very Good.

Just the way we like it!  

Nice and crispy waffle and bacon!  The waffle churro on Tiffs Waffle Macchiato was yummy.  The Waffledilla sauce was like a chipotle sauce and my son said really good!  Will be back...need to try desserts next!

Return visit:  always good!   Came here after a disappointing breakfast elsewhere...thank you Tiabi for saving me (and saving my husband from me being a crazy hungry caffeine deprived wife)

My constant companion and I decided to try this place after an excursion to Target.  Despite living in the area, and walking as my primary mode of transportation, I hadn't noticed this place before as it is tucked away on the East side of the Target shopping center.

What a delightful find!  This corner of Las Vegas is not known for it's culinary delights, and Tiabi Coffee & Waffle is a gem.  We ordered a nutella, banana, and almond waffle which was delicious, and my constant companion ordered some sort of coffee.

Honestly, I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but my constant companion didn't seem overly awestruck by the coffee.  The waffle was delicious, though, and the waffles at the tables near ours looked equally scrumptious.  I look forward to slowly eating my way through the entire menu in future visits.

I definitely recommend as this as one of the better breakfast places in the immediate area, and the waffles beat any of the waffle/crepe places I've eaten at on the Strip.  Definitely worth moving off the Blvd for a better breakfast meal at a much better price.

Saw a Groupon for Tiabis, decided to try it. It was very good. Using Waffles for the sandwich bread is great idea. Tried the wafflezilla and now the vegan burger. Tremendous! They're homemade are pretty amazing as well. Will be hurting this place up when I'm in the area.

I'll admit, I came here about two years ago but the impression left on me was so great that I've been thinking about this place and had to write a review. My friend and I came here for some grub before a music festival and thought this place was unique and had great reviews. Those reviews did not disappoint.

I ordered a West Coast wafflewich and since I'm not the biggest fan of bacon, they allowed me to sub it out for ham. This one entree was freakin' amazing, and I need to come back to Vegas to eat here again. I think my friend ordered one of the sweet waffle entrees, and I'm sure that was good too but I don't quite remember.

The place itself looked nice, and the service was great. Looking forward to coming back.

Came here on 3 separate occasions. Loved everything we tried! The 3rd time I came, service was a bit slow and had to get my stuff to go, but it's because so many people enjoy eating here. 
1. Green smoothies are always good.
2. I love their lollies.

Fantastic waffles.  Good coffee.  Chill atmosphere.  

Tried all the Tiabi Classic waffles.  No complaints.  U don't like their preselected options, you can create your own.  

Staff is always chill.  

People sometimes complain about the wait, but that's what happens when your food is fresh and made to order.  

If you're short on time, this is not your best option.  This is a dish best served when you've gots time to chillax... and then go hit the pools and get turnt up.

Decor: 4/5
-looks like a local coffee shop with large tables and benches

-Service: 5/5
-Israel greet us as we walked in and took our order. Our drinks were done in a few minutes and the food was ready in less than ten minutes

-Food: 4/5
-Snickers ice coffee didn't taste like snickers however it was a good sweet ice coffee drink
-The west coast wafflewich was great. I'm a big fan of avocado and bacon. The chicken was not try at all. Recommend this one
-Savory Thai Basil - I tried this one because it was unique. Overall I felt the flavor was slightly lacking but can't put my finger on it. I think it needs more crunch and flavor.
-I was impressed that the waffles stayed crispy on the outside, soft on the inside

Sad to see that the location in North Las Vegas closed. There's no way I'd go all the way to Maryland Parkway to get my coffee fix though. Their coffee is amazing, their waffle sandwiches are okay. A little pricey for what it is. I'm really gonna miss the coffee on my side of town!
Great waffles & nice ambiance. Service was friendly and the food selection was pretty good. We will definitely be back.
It's pretty good, but not a place I'm dying to come back. Very low key place. Staff are friendly. Still on the hunt for a waffle place that meets all expectations for sweet and savory.

We came here on a Saturday and it was really busy. The wait took forever because the amount of people there. There's also a limited amount of tables available. And from what I saw, they only had three waffle makers. You would expect a waffle place to have more waffle makers than just three, which probably added to the wait. Unless, they have more waffle makers hidden from view, which makes the waiting a little worse if they do. However, I suppose the waffles were worth the wait.

They are pretty cheap for a big (at least for me) sized waffle. Here in California, waffles that big cost about $9-$10 but in Vegas, they were half the price. They have a variety of different waffles to choose from if you prefer waffles or a waffle sandwich. They even have a vegan menu if that's for you. They also have a huge variety of drinks.

I'll definitely be back here again when I return to Vegas. I look forward to trying the different waffles and drinks on their menu.

Skip the strip people, this place is so cool.  It is almost impossible to please my little family when we are traveling.  My main concern is always getting a good cappuccino and coffee house food is not a satisfactory option for my teen so this gem of a cafe was an awesome find!  Everyone got what they wanted, the food was delicious, and made with love.  The people were super friendly and the ambiance is both casual and welcoming.  I've eaten at many of the well known places on the strip and have frequently been disappointed.  Venture out to Tiabi Coffee and Waffles, you will be so glad you did
Great lattes and frappes. Good waffles. Prices are reasonable and they have vegan options. Waffle sandwich was good and so was the red velvet frappe.

I've tried this place for the first time last week. A friend of mine and I came over to grab dessert and I have to say we made the right choice. 

It's very cute and clean inside. There are magazines and couches to lounge on and there are decks of cards to play with on each table. They also have board games to keep you entertained.The staff is also very nice and helpful on their suggestions. 

Their waffles are delicious! They are the perfect texture and go well with ice cream. I will definitely be coming back to try their Churronimo!

The coffee was the best part of my meal! My husband and I both got waffle sandwiches and the waffle itself was thin which is perfect and tasty but I had one with chicken and the chicken tasted like that pre-packed stuff. Got the coffee with the cinnamon waffle on top and the waffle was awesome on that so I would go back just for sweet waffles and coffee.

Delicious food! Had the #breakfast sandwich, west coast sandwich, red velvet lollipop, and strawberry sunrise smoothie and everything was delicious. Employees are helpful and friendly too. Matter of time before lines are out the door!

BY FAR MY FAVORITE FOOD SPOT IN LAS VEGAS!

The food, drinks & service are AMAZE BALLS! lol.
Saw that there was a Groupon but we wanted to try it out first.
We ended up buying the Groupon because we knew we would be back for the remainder of our stay :)

You walk in & the menu is to the left. 
I love how it's set up, cafe & you can see them making the food.
They take your order & ask for your name (they will call you name when your order is ready)

The FOODS:
- Lemonade: So yummy! Sweet, just how I like it!
- Tiff's Waffle Macchiato: THE BEST DRINK EVERRRR! lol. It comes with a waffle that is dusted with cinnamon sugar, it's messy but worth the mess. So yummers!
- Pac-Man Waffle: Exactly what it sounds like. Pac-Man shaped waffle with blueberries & raspberries as the thing that Pac-Man eats. Lol. Super cute!
- Vegan Wafflewich: Tomato, spring mix, avocado & Tiabi sauce toasted. Pretty much like a salad in a waffle, sandwich styled. Sooooo good! I ordered this with the Macchiato every time I went here.

The employees are AMAZING! They remembered us & they're super friendly.

I totally recommend this place, RECOMMEND, RECOMMEND! You will not be disappointed!

I've been coming here consistently due to the aesthetics of the place, the service and most of all, the food.

This place brings out elements to food and combining it together and it turns into one hell of a dish. No lies. Good stuff.

Shouting out John/Jay? for ALWAYS giving bomb recommendations! First timers, ask them. They'll surprise you.

OMG I would be here every day if Tiabi were in my neighborhood!! Waffles are one of my faaaaaaavorite foods and these waffles do not disappoint. I think these might be the best waffles I've ever had. And when they are made into a wafflewich?!? Wowwwww, that's just.....wowwwww. So freaking good!!! We ordered the breakfast wafflewich, the Thai basil wafflewich and the bananatella on our first visit here. We came here twice in 3 days. Luckily it wasn't hard to convince my husband to come back since he thought these were delicious too! Yessss! Waffles FTW!!! :)

On our 2nd visit we got another Thai basil wafflewich (obviously our favorite!!!), the west coast wafflewich, the maple bacon, and the Elvis (with bacon, honey, AND peanut butter! All were delicious, can't say a bad thing about any of these waffles. 

Thank you Tiabi for the awesome service too, we will def be back!
Bomb waffles! And great (nutty) tasting pistachio iced lattes. I had just a the plain waffle, it was super tasty. A dance party for my taste buds :)

Quiet, clean, friendly and delicious! What more could you ask for?

I stopped by when I lost my voice. I got the most amazing green tea and I'm addicted. I also give a thumbs up for the churro waffle; I just wish I had eaten there while it was still piping hot. (I didn't want to get anyone else sick )

Very nice hidden gem.

My husband took me here for our first breakfast after we got married! It was SO GOOD. Really fun and friendly staff - tasty waffles and great options. I was worried it might be too sweet because I don't have a huge sweet tooth but it was perfect! I couldn't recommend it highly enough! And it's not too pricey either.

My last visit was not on par with my other visits. Service was okay, waffle was okay, and it was pretty slow getting my order even when the place was empty. Plus, the waffle wasn't the gloriously crispy goodness it usually is.

Maybe it's because it wasn't breakfast time, but it was a disappointing meal and I won't be rushing back anytime soon.

What is tiabi you ask? "To inspire and be inspired." What an awesome statement. This little waffle shop/cafe is a vegas gem. It's one of those home town places where you want to bring your friends. You can hangout and have brunch or stop by for a late snack and dessert. They have all different types of waffles that will satisfy your craving. I personally love the waffledilla. It's the cheapest waffle sandwhich and will melt in your mouth! It's chicken, cheese, special sauce (that is sooooo yummy) in between a waffle folded in half and is super scrumptious. You can add a fruit bowl (variety so I'd ask what kind they have that day in case you are allergic or don't like a certain type of food) or homemade chips just for $1! Sweet deal! And it's pretty much a meal. They have a water pitcher towards the back. But they also have teas and smoothies. I haven't tried the smoothies but I want to! I like the "Just Peachy" tea. It's not too sweet but has a good taste. I always suggest this place because it's very central, it's cheap, they have dessert waffles too (try the red velvet) and they're friendly. It's located inside the Target plaza so there's a lot of traffic goin on around the place. But definitely a place to try if you haven't!

AMAZING WAFFLES! I love to come here for coffee and waffles on my mornings off work. The employees are always friendly. I sit down with a book, and someone brings my food to me. There isn't a lot of seating, but I have never seen it completely full (yet). This is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Vegas.

I hate to leave a poor review for them because they are super nice and cute concept. We have tried this place multiple times wanting to love it. We always have a super long wait, I'm talking 45 min for two waffles, there is no consistency (order is ALWAYS different) and our orders are always wrong. To wait 45 min for cold wrong food is just so disappointing. Missing key items that are listed on the menu like whipped cream on a waffle that literally has 3 toppings is just sad and inexcusable or missing items you specifically ask for every single time is just not good.

Really rude service, drive 4 hours to Las Vegas and look for a sweet treat after a long trip, and they tell us "we're closing early so we can only make drinks to go." You might as well tell us "we don't feel like working; we wanna go home and enjoy our weekend even though you're paying for our paycheck. Really rude girl at the counter, said something about having to close early because it's slow day, but you can't stay open for 10more minutes ?? Keep in mind we got here at .7:30 and they're supposed to close at 8.

This place is very quaint. It reminds me of a small business in northern California. My favorite is the West Coast with a Kale Champ. This it's my favorite new spot. I hope the Las Vegas residents appreciate the new private business Tiabi has to offer. Both Tiffany and Mae are awesome and super sweet. The customer service is enough to keep you returning. Thanks ladies.

We tried this place for the first time today and already I can't wait to come back. The waffles were simply delicious! We got one with Nutella, almonds and whipped cream. It was actually pretty big too, and not expensive at all. The menu was pretty big for a tiny place like that. Another good thing is that they make a real Italian style espresso. The staff was very friendly and seemed to enjoy their work.
Very good food and service! The waffles are perfect consistency and the drinks flavorful.  Please build one in Henderson!!

My Vegas family and I met here when we were visiting Las Vegas. Great,simple delicious food! It's like breakfast sandwiches,but served on waffles! The coffee's wonderful too! The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had a group of seven adults and two children,and no reservations,as none of us made them!They let us sit at a large table that another group had reserved.(Some of that party had an emergency;and it was ok with the half of the group that was there.) Some of us waited a bit to get our food,but I didn't mind, as we were visiting.Our family was there for two hours!-I'm surprised they didn't ask us to leave?! The staff was just so nice!

I came here with some friends yesterday and we shared a number of items. As I walked in, I noticed how lovely it smelled and was excited to try their waffles.
 
We sat and perused the menu for a while and I was a little disappointed that no one really checked on us or even asked if we wanted waters or more menus than just the one for our group of three. We finally figured out what we wanted and went up to the counter to order.

The lady behind he counter kept interrupting my dining companion as he started to order by yelling behind to another person who worked there. I thought that was a little rude, so that definitely put me off.

Our food took a while to come, but it looked really pretty. 

What we ordered:
-red velvet wafflenut 
-Nutella and almond wafflenut 
-The Fat Elvis waffle
-Strawberry and chocolate waffle
-Vegas churro waffle with honey, cinnamon, sugar and vanilla ice cream

Everything was solid. The consensus was that the churro waffle was the favorite and I personally enjoyed the strawberry waffle, minus the chocolate sauce. 

Service needs work and the location is awkward, so I don't see myself making much effort to come back to this place in the future.

Delicious pumpkin latte best I've ever had. I order this at many different coffee shops and always get a sugar punch to the throat. This one is not over syrup grossness, it's perfect. The organic toasty Tokyo is light and delicious too!
The West Coast and Kettle Chips are life changing. Love this place. Their juices/smoothies are good too.

I love this place!  They have delicious cold brew coffee, and several different amazing vegan options.  My absolute favorite thing on the menu is The Guru Burger.  After I tried it once I haven't been able to order anything else, I'm totally hooked!  A tip for ordering the Guru Burger is adding avocado and daiya cheese, now you have the perfect waffle sandwich!  Also make sure to check the cookie case on the counter for a variety of fresh baked cookies!

Cozy little place with style. I ordered Kale Champ blendies. It pretty awesome. Taste good and feel healthy! Little hidden gem around Target
 building.

This is probably my favorite breakfast place for when I have a sweet tooth. The establishment seems very clean and has a mixed modern but slightly rustic feel to it. It has plenty of seating and I find that even if it's full, it's never too loud. The food is always great! I usually get the bananutella with a churro waffle and ice cream (a 10 year olds dream breakfast). The coffee is also exceptional. I find that for the price, this is the best of the best if you want a quality waffle meal in a quality waffle place.

Eagles with pecan nut and caramel are the best!!
Special "star" giving you for coffee guys.
Latte was great!

Full from a weekend of eating buffets in Vegas?  Think again.  While you may be stuffed to the core, what you thought was going to be a to go stop at Tiabi Coffee & Waffle will end up being a sit down eat everything on your plate once they serve it to you no matter how full you are kind of afternoon.

It's just that good.  While you thought you were full, you didn't realize how hungry you were once you take a bite out of one of their delicious desserts, that they serve to you on a plate since it looks better that way than to go.

Came her with my hubby and grandma for the first time. I was impressed with the Viva Las Elvis Waffle with in house made Vegan Coconut Bacon! The sweet and salty combo makes it a delight. Order an extra one to go for my mom to try. Will definitely come back again!
